jLSqqXE0TMSxxjWPRqypwg.review_text: Ok so took a small group here for drinks that were in from out of town.  Starts off good, because we got there early and found seating for the 8 of us.  But then the crowd was louder than expected and one waitress seemed pretty rude but then this waitress Carly came out of no where with a smile from ear to ear and was so pleasant she really made what was ending down hill a great time.  Thanks  Carly (I think that was her name)

-Ca1wV6l1paaFinQ9zdylw.review_text: So I went back to Harry's to try it again.  And this time it was much better.  They had bottomless Belinis, which were delicious.  And they were very giving with the Belinis.  As soon as our pitcher was even slightly close to being empty, a new one was place on our table.  The food was good as well.  I ended up with the egg sandwich.    I will definitely be returning to Harry's for another brunch in the near future!!

dK6UJxkLPLgrmLvi20sjdA.review_text: I only have an opinion about the drinks - but I love the bellinis! The employees are friendly and the drinks are good. The neighborhood is fun, the music is good and they have tables outside. It's a great place to bring people because it's fun without going to the Marina. :-)

Vjk5FemZ5rwJuJ7Sznd3fA.review_text: I like picking how rare a burger is cooked, which while it usually only happens at shishi gourmet places (and really only should happen at these places, because you don't want to order your grade F patty medium), is a luxury that I can enjoy.  After all, there are few things as satisfying as a cold beer and a great burger.  The burger did not disappoint at Harry's.  The medium-cooking was probably more like medium rare, but as I like my steaks practically mooing, I guess I wasn't compelled to send it back.  Fries were good too.  And the booths were spacious, lush, and comfy.  I'm docking this place 1 star because it is deafening.  Like you can only go here if you loathe your friends and don't want to hear what they're saying at all.

BQ73YHpyADiz-Wf1OQ0EPg.review_text: So it was another one of those, "I want to have fun but don't want to go far away" nights.  I had already had dinner and pre-gamed at my house.  Where to go when you're with a group of 10+ people?  Harry's Bar!  Good choice considering the rain and proximity to my place (and no cover).  The DJ was awesome and we just danced the night away.    I'd never been to Harry's for late-night going out, but I was very pleasantly surprised.  Oh, and the DJ was really nice, took my friend's and my requests AND played them.  Kudos to him for that.

JcsoLpiX1DTrrgqs3NVD2w.review_text: We liked the food very much  awesome garlic fries. Friendly and fast service. Sportsbar athmosphere. Would definately come again.

tERbi3yzjRIQ6p6HADFeZQ.review_text:
I used to avoid this place for what it represented,  a giant meat market.   Truth be told, It has really changed quite a bit from it's earlier days.  Now It's more of an upscale sports bar.  I'll call it that because that's truely what it has become...and it works well.
 The wings are great here as is the wedge and chicken sandwich.  Good atmosphere but on game night it is crazy!!  Yes it can get a little fratty and there is LOADS of peacocking going on.  If you can get past that  or that doesnt bother you, then it's a decent place to get dinner and drinks if you are in the hood.  We go frequently.
  G

Ux2FJjS6odvgS83Eh03cnA.review_text: it was on a sunday. so it was busy. being i was at work and was kind of looking to kind of get in and get out, it was hard to do so. this is "regulars" place which is in no way bad. but i can get a better burger (had the turkey burger) for less money and less capacity. the host was very nice in checking on me, the waitress was too busy talking it up with her friends at other tables. i may give it another try NOT on a sunday.

CgKb22edkZoIqbOrDFnwtQ.review_text: A great go to bar that caters to different age groups throughout the day/night. Game days are filled and Thursday nights are busy. This is a charmer because the drinks are good, the service knows their menu, and it's always busy yet you'll never be without a seat or table. Go for a classier yet as affordable night than a bar you'd find on Polk.

ksLEtpBAdVGaEramRXYYSQ.review_text: I came in for a beer and the beer was great. Crowd was descent and the service was attentive. Nothing too crazy, nothing too special. Hit the spot just right.

S-JFtrbrYdhHHeGjlpgWfQ.review_text: Harry's has been my friend group's 'Cheers' for years. Great bartenders and friendly staff.  They've updated the menu a few times (usually for the better) and continue to pour a mean cocktail. Have celebrated the World Cup, engagements, birthdays, and even breakup a here. Come on in and stay a while, you won't be sorry.

y_7-1MVW3y84dsjbrn5oVg.review_text: If you want to meet a future dentist: come here. Well, this only stands until UoP school of dentistry moves downtown. So until 2014, come here if you want to meet a future dentist.  Ok ok... Come for happy hour! The food is decent and the drinks are, too. The hawaiian cocktail they make is also good.

ocDKvJnekL-6LXWF3WJvgA.review_text: This is a swank bar.  Good martinis with a nice selection of gins -- my favorite is still good old Tanqueray (I miss Tony Sinclair... they ought to bring him back) although Hendrick's comes in a close second.    The burgers used to be much better but it's still pretty decent especially when one can take swigs of very cold, very dry Martinis when eating the burger.   I've been going to Harry's for quite a few years now and the waitresses used to be HOT.  Maybe they still are but since getting married, my hot girl radar's been a bit off.  Or maybe it's the economy and the ladies can't afford those expensive creams and lotions... whatever, Harry's Bar is still my favorite place to hang.

1tObli6sTFk4iyAN9A84rA.review_text: We tend to end up here on sunny afternoons mainly due to the outside street seating. Although it can be fun to people watch and absorb sun if it's hitting the right side of the road, I had to recently question why we kept going there. Generally we sit at an outside table watching either a waitress go in and out with no regards or hello to us or we just watch one sitting at the bar inside. I have to say that ONCE you do get their attention they're pretty nice.   I've eaten a lot of food here and most is pretty standard--minus the burger with mushrooms and avocado which pretty much rules. There's good and bad things to every meal I've ordered here but it does usually come out quick.  So if your going for outside seating and not great food or service, go here. If not, the street is FULL of restaurants.  Don't even get me started on the night life. Last time I ran into an old date and didn't even recognize him......

RpV0eXApcSWu1yCmeirn5A.review_text: All of us tolerate the scene(s) in each diverse neighborhood of San Francisco.  Sure, it skews toward "Balboa Cafe" later at night but at least there's no beer pong (Marina), being ridiculed for not looking like you just rolled out of a thrift (a.k.a. "vintage") clothing store (Mission), or B&T hooligans throwing beer bottles (North Beach).  I don't think it's fair to ding a bar based on liking the crowd or not.  It's clean, their food is awesome, many TV's for catching the XYZ game and later in the evening (after 10pm) there's plenty of eye candy for both sexes.  If you don't feel comfortable hanging out with "yuppies" in a "yuppie neighborhood" then don't go there.  You don't hear anyone complaining about "too many gay men in ____ bar in the Castro" do you?

asx4juE5TEE-kJLz55kDUA.review_text: GOD,  I HATE THIS BAR. I mean word really can't cover why it sucks to high heaven. The women who work there make me feel as if they are traitors to the female race. I really hope that they are getting paid well- That is the only excuse for working at a "hooter"-esq place. Personally,  a place of business that makes me wear the name of said business on the poor waitresses asses-makes me feel like crap for even thinking about spending money there. I know, I know, someone  is going to say, " but Shannon, it's all in good fun." Ahhh yes... it usually is all in good fun when women are treated as objects. Lovely.

NRRPUnrCEIjDSt4uGV-rSw.review_text: Good Burgers - Great Pomegranate Martinis. Great enough for me to go back? Only if I happen to be back in the neighborhood. Won't go out of my way though. enough said......

h9unlpk_s18jhml22Jt6aQ.review_text: I remember the days when I used to dance on the bar here and Randy was the bestest bartender in the WORLD. Now? meh, it's just ok...

U1R5x4SpCybNTkUGec5-AQ.review_text: Attention owner of Harry's Bar:  We don't like your generic soda.  If you're going to put coke on the menu, serve coke, not an imitation.

5O8fn99pTl2r72AfySA_9g.review_text: I've been eyeing Harry's Bar for a month or so...I finally decided to make the effort and go since my mom was in town and when we were kids, we used to call her father, "Harry!" It was a very fun setting with a handful of big screen TVs around and true pub feeling. There was outdoor seating but we sat inside. There was a great selection of beer on draft and I found the menu to have plenty of variety. I had a grilled cheese and tomato soup sandwich. It was good - satisfied my needs. My mom had a steak and arugula salad. She ate the whole thing and said it was great. My father had a bison burger and really enjoyed his as well. The only thing we could complain about was the slow service. It wasn't terrible, but there weren't that many people in there for lunch, and it took longer than it should have for us to receive our food. I'm not sure I would go back for lunch, just because there are so many places on Filmore that I love, but I would definitely go back to the bar with a group of friends for some drinks and apps.

pX1uRGn6nVz_L_ZThaKenw.review_text: Came here on a Tuesday night. The bar was 1/4 full so getting a seat was easy.  Bar staff were quick to serve a thirty traveller. My mate joined me after, was served quick and his food was delivered quickly. Prices were reasonable for food and drinks. Only downfall was a lack of selection on the beer taps, but I get the feeling they are going for the cocktail customer.  The bar staff were friendly to chat with. The highlight was they put on Con Air DVD on the TVs. Would have been awesome if they put the sound on, but no biggie was still enjoyable. Music was a good mix also.  All up, not a bad bar to visit for a drink

DAikVU-yTq7nIRZmeR7gwQ.review_text: Decent atmosphere, seemed to have enough seats and it was easy enough to find street parking on a Friday night.

b-GNDMhYcfCMBE-wHZzKpg.review_text: The burgers are not that good and are very overpriced.  I went there i a tee shirt one time, and the wait staff looked at me as if I was some sort of peasant.  Everyone I have met there has bee pretentious and stuck up.  I was the designated driver there one time and the waitress told me how sweet that was...then she proceeded to charge me for $2 for each of my 8 refills of coke.  It's a shame, because the bar is nice and a great layout...but everything else about it sucks

u-cPHKvB6t0Qe9MONolo_w.review_text: Watched the Superbowl here. It is a nice place with a good crowd. The servers are attentive and the bottomless bellini's are awesome. They only give you an hour and a half though. Awesome bloddy mary too! My group had a lot of food while we were there. For brunch we had Harry's breakfast and the egg sandwich. Both were good but would be very easy to recreate at home. Nothing special. For lunch we had the nacho's (awesome!), the chicken tenders (GROSS, dont bother, not worth the calories at all), grilled cheese and tomato soup (good, but also so easy to recreate at home and hard to mess up) and the slider (good). I'd say this place is good for a drink and for food if you arent expecting anything special. Def a good place to watch a game.

xcPYxgAf_a57XouFOATCJQ.review_text: I've had this happen at other bars before, and now it's time to yelp about it.  Women bartenders discriminating against women!  Last night I was told that a drink cost more than it actually did.  I've had bartenders play this trick on me before, thinking that women do not tip.  I wish they knew that I am an excellent tipper, and that honesty goes a long way.  When the female bartender went to the computer to double check the price and ring it up she brought me the receipt, which verified to me I'd been overcharged.  Please don't assume folks won't tip you, it's quite disrespectful!  Other than that, the music was fun and the people nice.

mffp9XwhZ7Aoonfxl_G6EQ.review_text: Ahh yes, Harry's.  This use to be my favorite bar in the city.  Mainly because I use to live right around the corner and every season was cougar season.  Haha, just kidding, I use to live like 6 or 7 blocks from this place.  This place used to be a blast but I noticed things changed for the worse.  They got rid of Happy Hour - and its not like their prices were on the inexpensive side to begin with, the service has become marginal and the cheese factor has increased by a factor of five.  Don't get me wrong, just because I give it 2 stars for these reasons, I will stop going there.  I'll still go, its just that my expectations are lower now.  And I guess with anything else, as long as you have the right expectations, you won't be disappointed.  But on the positive side, their burger and fries are like crack rock and the women can be hot or drunk or both.  Keep in mind, it can be like a sausage fest sometimes.

6XCZoufB_S-sY6vsxMGd8Q.review_text: I love this place.  This experience is from the bar only.  I didn't try any of the food here.  It's really a nice cozy, warm, and chic bar.  It's a block away from my friends house so it was very convenient for us to walk down to grab a drink.  It seems like this place is packed regardless of the day.  I love the diversity of the joint. It's not pretentious and it just seems like every one is welcomed here. You know how you feel like certain bars gives out that, "you don't belong here" vibe.  You will not get that here.  Will come back for sure.

iW5D6zTcFRXfcBk92xoIxQ.review_text: Decent food...service isn't great though.  Plus they charge you for soda refills...which in my opinion is just ridiculous.

sxgasG-8a7RBerMAlOcjsw.review_text: Food: Excellent Fries (with Truffle Oil). Excellent Sliders (Kobe beef and mouth watering). The service was AMAZING! I sat with my friend and we had the most pleasant and curtious waitress (cute too!). Would highly recommend for food.   As a bar: Good neighborhood watering hole for the afterwork/ midweek beers and food crowd. It's a little bit of a pickup scene, though. It's like what the marina crowd looks like 10-15 years older but not really much wiser. Not too packed, but not empty enough.   I'll be a regular.

bXmMXEqgZPfEaYJqPPTs-g.review_text: I can't speak for the bar or nightlife, but I went here for a late Sunday Lunch.    FOOD:  I had the classic burger, which was cooked just the way I asked, Medium-well.  Their shoestring fries were done perfectly.  The orange juice was very fresh....home made?  I'll have to ask next time.  AMBIANCE:  Nice sports bar.  SERVICE:  Medium  OVERALL:  Burgers are Recommended

BPocdupppjxeGFLml0VgLA.review_text: Harry's makes some damn good burgers!  Definitely NOT a dive bar with eats... very chill atmosphere, fun lounge seating and great food and drinks.  Happy hour on Mondays is the best time to drop in - $6 for a burger and draft, not much can beat that!

Lr-B-r-KF80yFy-2u336bw.review_text: A group of Elites Rolled to Harrys after  the YEE at  the Republic . We rolled in and grabbed the front Couch area and Ordered -Calamari ,Nachos and Chicken Wings  . We were chilling out and catching up on Current Events.   The Bar looked very well stocked and was Huge. I was told that the Bar had been opened by SF Legend Harry Denton.  The Food arrived and it seemed alright . Seems like Harrys is a cool Neighborhood Bar.

skjkxo7Ewz3cbxW4TQNK5g.review_text: Why oh why can't we give .5 stars .... If I could, I'd give Harry's 3.5 stars!  On an absolutely magnificent day in SF we landed in Harry's Bar for a mid-day bite and of course some cocktails.  We were trying to find a place on Fillmore with available outdoor seating, but on the nicest day this city has seen yet this year we had no luck.  We settled for a booth in the bar right by the door at Harry's - close enough to feel the fresh air and comfy enough to settle in, grab a drink, chat and watch some basketball.  Harry's touted the BEST Bloody Mary .... I'd have to say "NO" on that front.  Good; yes.  Best; no.  Not quite spicy enough (and this isn't only coming from me, the one that "too spicy" is never uttered, but my friend who has a more realistic palette).  Not a large selection of light whites by the glass - but then again, this really is a down & dirty sports bar ...  I'll let it slide.  Another notable: Harry's Burgers.  I passed on the burger for I had dinner later in the evening.  My buddy quickly ordered up the Kobe Burger with Cajun fries - the fries were to share, of course ... I ordered the spinach salad with blue cheese crumbles, walnuts, dried cranberries and Dijon vinaigrette.  Both the dishes were very yummy!    While the dishes were yummy, the drinks refreshing ... the service was a bit too slow.  Granted it was a hot and somewhat busy Sunday afternoon, but when all we were ordering was a spinach salad and burger, it shouldn't have taken as long as it did.  All in all, not a bad spot to pop in and watch the Warriors shock 'n' awe and grab some drinks!

BAXXJrlGW6o8zWfw47q1Tg.review_text: I'll review Harry's with a story, The story of the Brunch Swap. It was a late Saturday morning and we were headed to watch the PGA at Harding Park. We needed sustenance, and we found it. We got the killer booth up front which is perfect for watching TV, ordering food, and a fresh breeze from the entry way. The only problem is that both of us were torn between two items... Harry's breakfast, and the waffles, guess what came next... THE BRUNCH SWAP.  We ordered both items and split the heck out of them. I would give Harry's breakfast a 4/5 (when split with the waffles) and the waffles a 5/5 (when split with Harry's breakfast), I'm not able to rate either item on their own because I'm unsure what my sentiment would have been. Two mimosas later and we were the happiest people ever.  The food came, we ate it, we went to Harding Park to watch the PGA and got great seats on the 17th hole. Boom.

eut6Kl4Z83CpgbIhmgS0Wg.review_text: Yeah, this spot sucks. As described in several other reviews, the crowd is uber-Yuppie and uninteresting, and the menu is overpriced and underwhelming. I can't give it a one star, because I do go back every once in a while for a drink when I'm in the area, but it's borderline.

2XJXE6aFXUf20n44Hl6GoQ.review_text: ***Brunch Review***  Came here at 1130 on Saturday morning to have brunch with a couple friends. I was hesitant that we didn't have reservations but we were some of the only people there until around 1330, so don't worry about resy's.   Bottomless belini's only last for 1.5 hrs which can be a blessing or a curse depending on what kind of mood you are in.   I got the Chicken Wrap which was very filling and had a healthy "dude" portion of delicious bacon. My gf got the Breakfast burrito with avocado instead of bacon and which she claims (after being there multiple times) is the BEST breakfast burrito in the city!  I highly recommend this place if you want a chill, delicious brunch. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it if you were trying to do an extremely heavy, 4 hour boozey brunch, but that's why god invented Circa and Stock and Trade!  See you again Harry's!

VNkEB5PlrESiPP6-3JR-xg.review_text: We finally tried it, "San Francisco's Best Bloody Mary"... I don't know that it was the BEST but it put a spark in me! YUM!  With all this dreary rain I was in need of a cheerful Bloody Mary and Harry's delivered!

5Z5KUZ15rwWCM0ItYh4mXw.review_text: Yes, I am giving this place four stars.  Why? Do I love the food?  eh Do I love the drinks? eh, not really.  But for some reason this place makes me happy.  Good place to come chill after work, and forget about the day..... :-)

ePB3pBx7eE6ozJ3QHRTxtw.review_text: Not my type of people, not my type of place, small drinks...   BUT THEY PLAYED MUSIC THAT I CAN SING ALONG TO! [That this is a big plus for me, but I'm guessing that it's a huge minus for people who were around me. Oh well! :)]

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: Meh, I've definitely experienced MUCH better.  Douchebag central, but I guess it's nice to have a bar on Fillmore Street, since there aren't many around there.  Fillmore Street is better known for good restaurants, cute fro yo and ice cream shops, clothing boutiques and wine bars.  I came in on Saturday night briefly for a birthday party and immediately noticed the d-bags, cougars, older couples, and couples in general.  The obnoxious music goes along splendidly with the crowd.    Plus one star for the fast, efficient servers/bartenders who seemed to have no problem with splitting the tab, bringing us water, etc.  I also like the tables out front which are ideal for people watching on a nice day for lunch or for the smoker crowd.

dgDwzPNq4SOBJNtmaQZRyA.review_text: Don't you hate it when you go to a Gucci store or a Ferragamo store, the sales assistant acts like they own the store?  Puh leeze, grASShopper, you're MY server as long as I hold the dough.  I think the waitresses and staff could use an attitude adjustment or overhaul.  Just because they- white and beautiful, don't mean they- models or stars.  Anywho, the food is very mediocre bar food.  Well, I've only been here for happy hour and that's what I was served.  The drinks and decor were all good.  But their staff can really put a bad taste in your mouth.  Maybe they spit in my drink.

ttUQuk4ora8cvxlCdH9c9Q.review_text: Harry's is your traditional bar type of food- nothing to write home about.  Fun place to watch a football game or hangout for weekend brunch.  If you start having drinks the bill can get expensive quickly.  Learned this during brunch when we discovered Cajun Bloody Marys (YUM!!)- definitely recommend those even though they are pricey.   Spicy, just the right about of kick, and served with a shrimp instead of a celery stalk. SOLD.

Trf5zXyezOkSR5XamB2QOw.review_text: Just wanted to say thank you to Harry's for making our visit last night picture-perfect.  We arrived at 5 PM. We hadn't seen each other in several months, two dear old friends of 25 years who had a lot of catching up to do.  Our server was great about pointing out specials, the happy hour drink prices and appetizers. She made a point of coming back just before happy hour ended too, to check in and see if we wanted to get another round of drinks before the price went up, ("Absolutely", we said - as the drinks were delicious and we were really enjoying ourselves and relaxing!).   When it was time to order food, our server was totally patient with my request to substitute barbecue sauce instead of the aioli. Everything came out perfect - our two delicious meals just as we'd ordered them.  Toward the end of our stay, our server appeared and ever-so-politely asked us if we'd mind closing out our tab with her 'cause she was going home. She told us we were welcome to stay as long as we liked - she just needed to close up her part of things. We paid her and thanked her and stayed for what we'd thought was 'a little longer', talking. Occasionally, we'd glance around the room to make sure there were empty tables if anyone new wanted them, but since it was a Monday night and not super packed, there were always a few, so we lingered, talking on into the night.  When we finally got up to go, we looked up at the clock and realized we'd been sitting there for FIVE AND A HALF HOURS. Yep. It was nearing 10:30 PM. I guess time flies when you're having a good time!  What was incredible to me was the hospitality that was displayed to us and so I want to say THANK YOU for such graciousness. I think a lesser establishment might have hurried us along or been irritated at a five and a half hour stay. We were both astonished, when we realized how long we'd been there, and both remarked at how kind it was of the server to be so gracious and so welcoming, even in that fifth hour! I think Harry's did a top-notch job here. So, yeah, thank you so very much. It's nights like these that make going out to eat really worthwhile. And on top of that, when the final bill came, it was surprisingly reasonable too, given how much we'd eaten and drank! I chalk it up to those great happy hour prices.

aD-rsDe2S0e7jTkYD6ULaQ.review_text: Fun trendy, busy, but non-pretentious place to hang out for a good time.  Highlights: - Fun atmosphere: always bustling and high on energy with fun music like "Sweet Caroline," Flo Rida's "Low" or Bon Jovi tunes playing loudly.  - Good drinks: cool how they are written in big letters behind the bar -- I had the lychee pineapple martini which was pretty good and loved the garnish with the pineapple on lychee on a stick. Overall taste was a bit more pineapple than lychee, though. - Decent burgers and fries: I wouldn't say they were the best burgers ever, but they are pretty good. I ordered the BBQ one which was satisfying, but I could have used more BBQ sauce.  - Kobe sliders: like this menu options. Mini burgers are always fun! ;-) Only thing was I couldn't tell too much difference between my normal burger and the hub's kobe. :-O  Lowlights (my flip side to highlights): - It's usually super crowded on weekends so it may be hard to get to the bar or get speedy service at your table.  Still love this place. I'm jealous it's one of my friend's neighborhood bar. Atmosphere is the reason you come here and we'll be back!

3rWdCM2_AK7GWQlwzRO99Q.review_text: Sucks that I have to downgrade my review here  But some of the bartenders are straight up wack  As in they are discriminating wack  Oh well... i guess it is inevitable in pac heights

yNZbODsNRbiY4bnZ2-Fl0Q.review_text: This is a place my girlfriend's and I constantly find ourselves at no matter how many times we say we are going to expand our horizons and go "off campus".  Why we don't? It has everything you could want in your local bar: plenty of TV screens, great drinks, good amount of people watching, waiters are always attentive, and great atmosphere.  The only reason I don't give it the full 5 stars is because the food is not that great...Of course, this is a bar, so I expect "bar food", but it's not even good fried food.

jcXPoo3xLK6-ZHtGcHbKiw.review_text: I met a buddy for drink and some dinner here last night. There was only one waitress but she was busting her butt to keep people happy. Spinach deep was good but what made it good was the fresh pita bread that came with it. I ordered the Big Blue Cheese Hamburger and it did not disappoint. After, two well cocktails, splitting an appetizer, and burger I walked out of there spending about $40 bucks. Not bad for the Fillmore area.

34A5VAva1B0FDoKKhRDwHg.review_text: Harrys is simply a great place to hang out....  I've been here 3 times and each time I've been I've had a great experience!    Friendly staff, wonderful people, great music, what more could you ask for. I'll definitely pay another visit soon......   :)

OAkacdYEU2sK2jxrcNoVow.review_text: Thank you for responding to my complaint. It really does help to know someone is listening.

QUw6VXBnl3h7WaTPfMfXLg.review_text: i like this place.    brunch - greyhounds have fresh grapefruit juice - which is an automatic homerun for me.  and you can ask for it with just well vodka to save some dollars.  brunch menu thought is not so great - like 3 things.  but what they do have is good.  love the sliders!!  good beer on tap.  generally a good atmosphere for evenings.

m0ZE-npUuiZilxUCOQUfIQ.review_text: This place is garbage!  Worst service I've had in a LONG time and the food blows.  Sooo embarassed I brought friends visiting from out of town here.  Seems like the last few reviews are from people that either work there or know someone that works there and they may have gotten freebies for writing a positive review for this dump.  Our long-haired brunette waitress with the constant "duh" look on her face was pathetic from the start.  The 7 of us ordered 7 drinks and 7 waters, she stopped in the middle of our order to go say hi to her friends walking by.... yeah seriously she did this, wtf?  15 mins later she comes back and had to ask again what one of us ordered and also forgot another drink as well.  Waters also still hadn't arrived.    Ordered food and it came out half an hour later.  Two orders were wrong and the mac & cheese was beyond bland.  Burgers tasted like leftover McDonald's.  Tomato soup was super thin almost like juice.  Quesadilla tasted decent but came out cold.  Horrible!  We were there for an hour and a half for food and one drink, wow!  There's no excuse for this whatsoever.  It wasn't busy, there were maybe 6 tables total.  Had two servers and a bartender.  Plenty of better places to go on Fillmore, fuck this place.

An77lsFUZebsqbeELGGatA.review_text: It's a good place to hang out, if the focus is hanging out. I've only been here for a post-Bible study birthday celebration, and only had a guiness, so I'll say what I can. The Guiness was good, the service was slow and the waitress seemed overwhelmed and distracted.

0yHBTgFQIKWnqjCAiuNRAA.review_text: Nothing that stands out - it's a pretty OK place. Reasonable food - nothing special. Beer selection is sub-par for this area of town, but they're ok. Atmosphere is slightly loud but not unpleasant. Open late.  Edit: Still overwhelmingly OK a year later. Smells of men, to put it kindly, and always does. The place needs an air upgrade. Good for casual drinks. If Long Bar were still around, this place wouldn't be getting the third star, though.  Edit2 - 2012: Still overwhelmingly OK a couple of years later. Less man-smell around - perhaps the air got upgraded? Still a good casual hang-out, just lacking something to make it a destination rather than somewhere that's conveniently nearby. Still need Long Bar to add some much needed bar competition to the area.

1VPkezVuCdPww26xvqemHQ.review_text: I've been to Harry's a few times by myself and have enjoyed their Bloody Mary.  Last Sunday afternoon my wife, 10 month old son and mini-Aussie saw that the had seating outside an thought, "great, I can enjoy their BM and eat."  I asked inside if I could sit outside with a stroller and a dog and the hostess said yes, it is first come first served. We sat down and five minutes later the waitress came and informed us that because they are a bar they could not serve us with the baby even outside. They would serve us with the dog but not the baby.  That's unfortunate. Maybe they prefer it that way.

FKmVsYtmiT9_cz9VTJ2Luw.review_text: This bar rocks. The thing that makes this place for me is the staff. I live in the pac heights area and the only reason I don't go someplace else is because of the wonderful people who work at Harry's. This includes the guys in back who slave away in scorching temperatures cooking the food and keeping the bar running (how bout some ventilation?). Jesus works his ass off. So what if the management doesn't think having Guinness on tap is important (it is), or if the ordering on a weekly basis is piss poor and they run out of all manner of things (beer, booze, mixers). The people who work at this bar make the bar for me. I like this place because the people who work here on a day to day basis are enjoyable, professional and fun. If I'm at a table, Lauren, Jamie, Lizzie, Taylor and Michel (the blond one) do a killer job, If I am at the bar Gabbie, Cherise, Kelly, Patti and Caitlin make it worth coming in. If you're in pac heights and  want to watch a game, have a drink, or get some food, stop by Harry's. Don't expect Guinness on tap though.

ksvy4MiaTotSmA2KRSJ2xQ.review_text: Harry's is a convenient place of happy hour, but is by no means overly cool or cheap.. They have some decent cocktails.. the mango martini special was delicious lately. the appetizer are also is decent.. If you can snag an area for you and your whole group to sit, its not a bad place for drinks and snacks.. be warned.. It turns pretty singles barish after about 7..

KHe0fDV4UboypNbigURvEg.review_text: Great burgers, pricey drinks, lots of suits. I could do without that crowd. I'm in no hurry to return.

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: Harrys Bar looks nice inside, serves good food, and has a friendly, competent staff.  Harrys Bar also has a mess of pacific heights kids howling and partying. Harrys Bar also has a DJ but no dance floor. This compels drunk girls to dance wherever they're standing, even if it's in the aisle or in front of the bar when you're trying to get a drink or right behind you when you're trying to carry 3 mixed drinks back to your table at once. Harrys Bar is really loud. You'll wonder why you and your friends all decide to meet at a place where no one can have a conversation.  Harrys bar has a decent amount of other eating and drinking establishments nearby.  update: This place is actually pretty cool when it's not too crowded, and the staff is also pretty cool even when you break the rules accidentally, so another star for them. Come here on a weeknight if you're up fillmore for some reason.  update 2: The cobb salad here is so good that when you're sharing a cab home with someone you care about and she forgets to take the leftover box with her when she gets out at her apartment, you might not say anything and eat the salad yourself when you get home. If you're reading this, I love you babe, but I guess I love Harrys cobb salad even more.

6ITGUFWSVb-fDIpfnKMsDg.review_text: I'm LOVING Harry's Bar. Turkey burger is amazing on Monday nights. And the bartenders, don't get me started. Captivating (and hotties). Although the sultry tattooed one has already shot me down twice, I think she'll eventually come around ;) 9492932572 in case your reading Maxine.  Regardless of whether I get a date or not, I'll definitely be back to Harry's Bar regularly, its a great spot with good food, good drinks, and good peoples all around

Xbyf2Dj8B32eO4f2u8yOyg.review_text: Harry's gets one star because it is really the only bar in the hood (I am not counting the jazz places down the street, as they are more focused on the music). It also gets one star because they have outside seating, which means I can bring my pooch when I want to grab something to eat.  The bartenders, when they choose to pay attention to you, are fairly rude. The food is mediocre at best - and not cheap. And the drinks are overpriced and watered-down...when you can get them.  I know they are under new ownership; only time will tell if this improves things.

YFG_qsnCwHTxgPAYYW-YQQ.review_text: It makes me sad that the bar closest to my apartment consistently makes weak drinks (thereby forcing me to walk all the way to Polk St. to get a decent cocktail).  I'm still waiting for someone to open a really great bar on Fillmore.  Until then, I guess Harry's is all we've got....

TlphV6gUvMJbC74pktHVFg.review_text: I can only recommend the hamburger at Harry's. Not the Kobe burger. Any of the others. Even though I hate the atmosphere of the place on a busy day, and the rest of the food is marginal, the hamburgers are the best. The Fillmore Burger said it came with trumpet mushrooms, but unfortunately, they were just plain mushrooms. It was still delicious and huge - I could have split it with my friend. If you pay extra you can get their really delish sweet potato fries.    Oh, good happy hour too, and nice big TVs if you like to watch sports.  Just get out of there before the crowds arrive. Unless you like that scene.

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: Harry's was the first bar I visited after I moved to the city. It is a fun place to go to at night, but I really prefer going there during the day on the weekends. If you order brunch they do a special for $10 bottomless Bellinis. It is a good way to start your Sunday Funday off right...  For brunch I usually get their smoked turkey sandwich that comes with avocado, bacon, lettuce, tomato, mayonnaise on sourdough bread. Served with fries. It is quite tasty.   I also really like bloody marys in general because they come with snacks, and Harry's has a bloody mary that is called The Bloody Bull, that comes with BACON in it. The best snack.  I recommend Harry's Bar if you like brunch and drinking in the morning.

9PnBsWKj1ZrYanL-IbiHQQ.review_text: as it turns out.. i ended up meeting my future husband here on a crowded Saturday night. We were recently married and Harry's will always be a place we'll never forget... oh and the greasy little sliders are awesome.

2oM69jn6-hKjr_IMA7JEgQ.review_text: Three stars because I love their hamburgers.. TO GO. I like there food better when I get it take out and then go up to Anza Vista and eat it.  The Bar patrons there are kinda lame. The staff is super slow and the girls are kinda dumb. They wear those stupid sweat pants with the words "Harry's Bar" printed on them in an arch (like those dumb ass Juicy sweats)...this isn't North Beach, it's Filmore street. The drinks are alright, the atmosphere is classy, but again, they down grade it with the dumb waitresses in stupid outfits.  Go get a hamburger to go though, they are so good!

3gxZfCVPp7HNMutb-eLchQ.review_text: This is a great spot when the weather is warm and you are lucky enough to snag a table outside. The turkey burger is delicious! Probably one of the best I have ever had. The people watching is pretty solid too.  However, if you are in the mood to get dolled up and hang with the cream of the crop in Pac Heights I would say venture inside and you will be satisified.

Z7wYV7NVNAH_B0eE35d2wg.review_text: Is it possible that of all the times I've been here, I've never actually had a total blast?!?!  This seems to be everyone's fav spot, but it really hasn't climbed the charts on my list.  Folks here don't seem too inviting, totally engaged in their own convos.  My favorite thing to do at Harry's is staring at the mirror wall and check out the hundreds of variety of martinis they make.  it's fun trying it all, Hawaiian is my fav so far.   I've hung out here twice and haven't been impressed.  Maybe 3rd time's the charm?

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: If you want ridiculously lame and inattentive servers, Harry's is for you. I was there the other evening (at 6:30pm), and made the mistake of thinking that the girl who took our order would actually place it. After 10 minutes, I went up to the bar and asked and she said something to the effect of "You'll have to wait since some other customers were here first."   Ten more minutes later and still no Sazerac. I actually left before the drink purportedly arrived, but it's quite possible it never did come out. Evidently, Harry's is where good times go to die.

D41pJpZFKQR6Hm9P5sVV0Q.review_text: Tasty food, great mojitos, distractingly hot waitresses.  My only real knock against it is the puny selection of beers on tap.  Otherwise Harry's is a great spot, definitely one of my favorite SF bars.  Oh yeah, and the bloody mary's are amazing for the next morning.  It gets four stars for Sunday through Thursday and three for Friday and Saturday, only because it gets so ridiculously crowded.

zjcN27kCVeK8K2ONe9Qt4g.review_text: Well, it is the neighborhood bar.  If your looking for food, there are better vittles in Pac Heights.  If your looking for a pub, well, get walking if you don't like Harry's.  They only get three stars for having a limited selection of draft beers - I think only about four on draft (maybe three).

wMEMkR6TEgXYYpXUZYFcrA.review_text: Don't listen to the other reviewers! This place rocks. The food is good. The ambiance during games is awesome. If you read the reviews everyone is complaining because they are waiting for tables during the BCS champ game or some other raging sporting event. My advice, find some patience it will help you in all aspects of your life. Harry's is awesome, we have been going there for all the big games and the wait staff love us. Just try a bit harder people and make the best of an awesome place. 5 stars for sure. Not a better place to watch sports in the City. Period!

MEuqcrKst_f6wvIVZVcaeQ.review_text: Great layout, I love the long bar and the tall tables that are lined parallel to the bar.  In my opinion this lends itself to encouraging mingling.  The cliental is all young professionals; typical 9-5 folk, all seemed friendly and engaging.    We sat at the bar so I can't review the level of service provided by the waitstaff, but I can attest to the exceptional service of the bartender, Patty.  She was very attentive and even indulged my constant inquiries into the liquors that were going into the various drinks she was mixing.    The bar missed the mark in the music.  I have an ear for all types of music and can enjoy just about any genre, but in my opinion the place needs to stick to one genre.  I can't quite place my complaint but the music seemed to jump all around with no cohesiveness.  I will however be back...oh yes I will be back.

U8rbIgbHz-1WHaWmotoUWA.review_text: I wonder why this bar gets a 3 star, this is as good as it gets on a Friday night!!  My suggestion, definitely go visit!

X23s6DqfISCa5dCNkrTJdA.review_text: Went with a friend for a quick casual bite on a Monday night (challenging evening in the neighborhood).  It took us 15 minutes to get service and the waitress screwed up our beer order.      The salad part of the steak salad was fine however the steak was all gristle.  The only think that saved them from 1 star were the truffle fries, which were decent.  Harry's fine for watching a game but if you are looking for food (even bar food), go elsewhere!

QkWMqG7hQps6w487TAb35w.review_text: My real review would be a 3.5 but since I've had some pretty good times at Harry's I'll bump it up to 4. The first time I went to the bar it was for the NCAA football championship in 2009 and it was packed. My friends had gotten there early and had a table though and that made things perfect. The waitress was very attentive and friendly while she was wade through a sea of about 1,000 people every time she came to check on us....I went more recently for brunch yesterday morning, the bottomless bellini's were pretty stellar and the chilaquiles I ordered were the perfect blend of spiciness and crunchiness. My only food complaint was that there wasn't much so my Sunday funday of drinking led me to another meal pretty soon after buuuut it also wasn't very expensive so not too much of a complaint. The Sunday crowd was a lot less mello but the waitress wasn't as attentive as my first experience. Maybe crowds make everyone more hopping! All in all it was a fun morning sitting outside people watching!

qQa9J0fXA6E-3JSFNsF7TA.review_text: Eating a Kobe burger (which was damn good) while watching Kobe on the big screen making his case for another MVP...can't beat that.

eAjOp3fTQPFf7FE-H19t4Q.review_text: I've been here both for brunch and, more recently, dinner; while the turkey burger is surprisingly good, I would recommend the majority of other places on Fillmore for a quality meal. On top of a relatively boring menu, pretty slow service for dinner and it wasn't that crowded given it was a Sunday night few tables had more than two or three people.  Brunch, however, is what I would recommend Harry's for - bottomless bellinis for $14 and some great meal choices make this a good Pac Heights weekend go-to especially if there's a game on that you're there to watch. Only complaint (assuming this is still in effect, haven't been for brunch in a while) is that they timestamp when you get started on your first round of bellinis and limit you to exactly  two hours of bottomless - understandable considering how aggressive people can get at bottomless brunches but unnecessary for most people (i.e. adults) who just want to relax for a few hours, watch a game and hang out with friends.

rZRCEAy-xv7TwDstUliTnA.review_text: I like this place.  Decent drinks.  Seating.  90s music.  TVs.  No weirdos. Entertainment: male/female cougars on the prowl Good times. Wow, I'm getting old....the things that excite me.

9fe41Vmw245Eho1PghHHKw.review_text: Great bloody mary selection! Awesome burger. Service is a little off. Loved the tater tots

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: was three stars, but since it was flagged and removed for my original review of "...", my review for this establishment is now two stars, and that's only for the bartenders.

RVKadMPQnfWj7CxyX_gaGQ.review_text: Great local bar.  During the week they have food and drink specials.  Great flat screens for watching sports.  It can also be fun on the weekends if you are looking for something low key but not dive-y.

63RGOpfG38zD1fGBNQ3pZQ.review_text: Good burgers :) Good Mojitos! (Nachos are huge-- but i've had better)

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: I had a hard night this weekend.   So I decided to go out....  Outer Voice: "I need a drink..." Inner Voice: "I need a drink...."  OV:"Seriously...I need booze." IV: "Oooh....there's an impromptu drinks night on Yelp.  Sure, what the hell!! Keane's pretty cool..."  I arrive at Harry's Bar right after work.  There a fucking DJ in the door entry...honestly.  What intelligent human being thought THAT was a good idea?  OV: "Where the fuck is Keane?" IV: AAARRRHHH!!!  WTF ARE ALL THESE BITCHES DOING IN MY WAY!!!!!!  OV: "Excuse me." IV: Bitch OV: "Excuse me..I need to get past you." IV: Bitch OV: (poke on the shoulder) "Look. girly..MOVE!!! I need to get by!"  I find Keane and he looks so very apologetic for the crowd.  I go to get a drink hella quick from the chick bartender. THE ONE AND ONLY STAR.  OV: "Excuse me" IV: Drunk ass frat reject better get the fuck outta my way. OV: "Hey...if you can please move a bit?" IV: Is this STD ridden dickwad deaf? OV: "Fucking A...can you move!? Shit...." (I just barreled though two asshats and spilled their drinks)  OV: "Keane!  Holy shit I almost drop kicked like five bitches just trying to find you!" IV: One drink and I'm gone.  Total time spent in Harry's...15min! A record!!!  Woot! Woot!  Chug my booze, say my goodbyes and sprint out of there to my car. To find two stoned ass fools on my hood.  OV: "Hey..can you guys get off my car" IV: Oh I most definitely WILL run your ass over! No one but Ambercrombie & Fitch will miss you...  I officially hate this place.  Rude ass fucking customers who were raised with NO manners.  HORRID planning of the DJ station...ESPECIALLY since there is NO room to dance.  Also, they have an obvious blind eye to the fire codes since there is no room to move at all.    Actually, maybe if it does go up in flames at least perhaps Harry's Bar will disappear and a Pete's or another Starbucks will take it's place.  Anything would be better than what it is now...

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.review_text: I think you have to be a certain kind of person to appreciate this place.  I'm not that kind of person.    The waitresses are rude and stuck-up.  It's like there's a requirement for them to NOT smile.  This really rubs me the wrong way because I waited tables for many years of my life, and thoroughly enjoyed it.  If waiting tables makes you grumpy, get a different job.  Also, this place attracts a sort of... douche-ey... clientele.  You know, the cocky type, who appear to be on steroids, use way too much self-tanner and cologne, and don't know what 2+2 equals?  I get it, some people like douches!  Otherwise, this place, and many other a places wouldn't be in business.    So if the above is your kind of thing, have at it!

w7dUhk-Dk-klAEpHRn5SLA.review_text: This place kicked us out because we have a baby and they don't allow anyone under the age of 21. My kid was really looking forward to his beer! It was the middle of the day and they serve food, not sure why they don't allow kids.

yA7t1I5Z7-GcJX7NgkgwoA.review_text: B The last great traditional Irish Pub located in the heart of the financial district and still going strong all these years.  Operated by Kathleen Harrington who is proud and an activist in cultivating the best things in the local restaurant scene and also a true Irish maiden, proud and resolute.  Like so many Irish pubs the world over, the staff all speak with a brogue and seem barely able to keep up with the crowded and often rowdy gang that seem to conscientiously avoid The Royal Exchange and Holding Company which are both more upscale and expensive.  The Harrington burger appears to be previously frozen as are the fries, but they do a reasonable job with it and the price is right.  Very straight forward and simple.  A quarter pounder with cheese and fries is usually served hot and they've got catsup and mustard, some sliced mealy tomato, head lettuce at room temperature and pickle chips round out this genuine pub burger.  This joint is a historic Irish pub locked in the center of San Francisco's financial district and hosts the city's largest and loudest St. Patrick's Day celebration among other block party size events and its laid back and a favorite of the broker crowd who are usually done working at the same time most of us are finishing lunch, so there's never a dull moment in this place.  In addition to the burgers, they offer a pretty complete Pub menu including very good corned beef and cabbage and a variety of blue plate specials, salads, sandwiches and lunch type food.  Service is funky and casual with humor taking the place of competence, and you might even wind up doing shooters with your sweet lass or bartender which is casual and cool.  They feature a popular and coveted smoking patio which is legal because the area is self service and only the smokers are theoretically at risk.  The bar gets very crowded in the afternoon and after work with throngs of young urban guys and gals all looking to unwind after a hard day's work.  They sell a lot of Guinness, Harp and Bass Ale here and they also serve a lot of burgers, so they're doing most things right for their customers.  Its loud and raucous but a bargain by today's standards.  This is a place to have fun at lunch and after work, and one of San Francisco's largest St. Patrick's Day celebrations.

G9Vb6yQ047TC3O_-GG4WZA.review_text: Upon entering Harry's Bar, I felt like I was transported back in time to my college days. I think the crowd was mostly Yelpers waiting for the event at IO to begin, so that was cool, but I don't think I'd choose to hang out here next time. The mango mojito was refreshing, though probably the weakest mojito I've had. For $8.50 I was expecting to get some kind of buzz. My friends also got the same drink and they got big chunks of mango, which I didn't, so I felt a bit ripped off. If I should be forced to go to Harry's again, I'll have to try a hamburger and fries, because those looked pretty good.

xgwe2yzjyiVW-yiVL22iYw.review_text: This was a pretty cool bar for Sunday football.  There were 4 of us and we only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table.  The bottomless bellini's are good and our waitress kept them coming.  My hub ordered the mac and cheese and that was by far the best thing any of us ordered. I had the egg sandwich and it was just ok....The toast it came on was soggy and the eggs weren't cooked enough.  The only thing that was a bummer was that we were sitting next to two tv's, one of the tv's was showing the Steelers game (which no one was watching) and they refused to change the channel to the Bears game.  I get it, I used to work in a bar and it is really annoying when people ask you constantly to change the channel, but there was only about 10 minutes left, the Bears were attempting to come back and no one was watching the other game....so come on....change the channel if your paying customers ask you to.  Otherwise, this place was ok to spend a couple hours on a rainy sunday in SF.

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: Fun bar crowd, great location (though parking sucks), but good after a day of hard shopping, lots of drinks (including a mango mojito, yummmmy), and bar snacks for those food urges you have when drinking (smart idea, I always think to have food nearby when drinking)............  Good people watching, great area, and I don't have much else to say.    Had a great buzz so there's no way I can recap the decor or anything more than what I've already said.    I think I had several Chinese Hawaiian, or something martinis.  Good, not overly strong, but sweet enough to go down super quickly before knowing you are wasted.  Just how I like it.

D1Wbw8tlt8sNCq049No5pA.review_text: Four star kobe burgers here... much better than just your average bar food.  Service is great during dinner time.  They have plenty of nice screens.  Harry's succeeds at being what it it tries to be.  I recommend it for nights when you just need a quick dinner and a drink or two.

NfsBfTFLhmLfYh8M6rMRcw.review_text: 2.5  A convenient location for meeting friends before dinner or catching a glimpse of a major when you get off work late and you can't wait to get home (US Open Agassi vs. Bagdadis, thank you Harry!). The food ain't spectacular, but whatdoya expect right? and that's probably not the reason you're here. It gets amazingly crowded quick - 'cause there is no where else to go? - during predictable rush hour, but if you come slightly early, you can score yourselves a table. The staff's booty pants are certainly working as advertising ploy since we're all talking about 'em but it's ass if they're desperately trying to burn themselves into our memories... Way to make use of  social psych.

y3Gb0zhTZQO1SMS8xluoxA.review_text: I would give this 4 stars but the drinks are a ripoff.  $12 for a wimpy glass of mediocre wine?!  But I understand, they do it because they can.  I prefer this place as a late afternoon drink and snack stop, it is too ridiculous later in the evening because they are the only game in the neighborhood.

_E3yaczgef7enusOIf7Jug.review_text: They make Hot Toddies: Whiskey or brandy served hot With some sweet honey  hello Truffle Fries: Perfect texture and flavor. Please enter my mouth.  ---- Overall a spacious sports bar that has a nice touch of class.  Probably the best place for large groups in the PacHeights / Fillmore street area. ----

6ybp1lO5UkyqDHWL0bEOJA.review_text: I walked in last THURS night and almost felt compelled to say...  I am the last barman poet I see America drinking the fabulous cocktails I make  Americans getting stinky on something I stir or shake The sex on the beach  The schnapps made from peach  The velvet hammer  The Alabama slammer I make things with juice and froth  The pink squirrel  The three-toed sloth I make drinks so sweet and snazzy The iced tea  The kamakazi  The orgasm  The death spasm  The Singapore sling  The dingaling America you've just been devoted to every flavor I got  But if you want to got loaded  Why don't you just order a (fernet) shot?  Bar is open.  Atmosphere was good, service was fine, and surprised with the relative ease in finding parking.

fqfROIXNBnIOvMkp2We-Fg.review_text: One of my fave bars in the city. Primo location, and always a good crowd...a little bit of Marina, local regulars, and young professionals. I have to say, everytime I've been there, even if the experience wasn't perfect, I have a good time.  I really haven't found a bar that's quite like it here in the city.  My friends have likened it to an "upscale sports bar"...great on game day, but Fri/Sat nights it's a solid scene: crowd, music, etc.  The staff is friendly, the bartenders know how to make solid cocktails, and there's a great food menu that runs late (burgers are solid and I can't resist a menu with tater tots!), and a brunch version offshoot. The $14 bottomless bellinis special is a nice twist/spin on typical mimosas you see at other places, yum.  Come early as when we swung by there this past Sunday it was BUSY because of football.

IYmw8q8C-lTb3kMucoHy4Q.review_text: I went twice in a row last week - the first time just for drinks. It's nice, a good crowd, not fratty as I'd heard, not a meat market either, nice sophisticated, not stuffy. Raspberry mojitos are refreshing. Caesar salad was disappointing - I wanted a big bowl of the stuff, not a plate of a couple gigantic romaine lettuce leaves, and the mac & cheese reminded me of the kind I used to get in a cafeteria when I was young. That isn't necessarily saying it's good or bad...just reminiscent.  Small bar so if you want a table, wait a while, it will happen.  Update: I went again yesterday, post Saturday night partying...nothing cures a hangover like a good bloody Mary, burger and fries. Amazing. The bloody Mary was spectacular. The burger sooo soo good, the bun is probably one of the best I've experienced.  Update 2: I'm hooked on their Monday night specials, burger, friends, drink = $8. Mmm, mmm, good.

Hhm03kZbKuJl1n6khcqKLA.review_text: When I first moved into the neighborhood, I thought it was a cool bar. Monday burger special was cool. Stella and Guiness on tap.  Fast forward 2 years later. Service is horrible!!!!! Looks like they only hire bartenders and servers that are females. Don't get me wrong, that's all good, but man, they can be Bitchy!  Scenerio #1: Me: Can I get another Stella? Server: Um....I'm not your server, you should ask her over there.  Scenerio #2: Ordered a burger. Table next to me orders a burger too, after me. He gets his burger first. 10 mins past, still no burger.  Me: Where's my order? Server: Oh, looks like he took your burger. (blaming it on the other guy!) FInally get my burger, which is different from what I ordered. Ends up being the burger the other guy ordered!!!!  Scenerio #3: my friend JT: Is the pomogrante martini sweet? If so, I don't want it. Server: No it's not, it's very tasty. Drink comes.  JT: It tastes like fruit punch. This sh!t is weak! Me: (LOL!)  Better service when you are at the bar, when it's not crowded. I think the best bartender there is Patty.  Not sure if she's still working there.  Oh well, it's still a spot to get a drink, but I would only go there sparingly now.

Q4RsL67tkjfRclgTfTPUdA.review_text: Came here during the Fillmore Street Jazz Festival and it was actually pretty cracking (which is a given I guess, because it's one of the few bars in that hood).  Not giving them one star for the vibe, I'm giving them one star because when I was getting a beer I saw a roach behind the bar, and I'm not talking a blunt roach baby, I'm taking the nasty ass little bugs that our amigos south of the border refer to as "la cucaracha".  Where there's one roach there's usually more.  Step your cleaning game up you nasty motherfuckers, having roaches crawling around behind the bar is unacceptable, and for that reason I would never eat here.  I don't even want to think about how gross there kitchen probably is.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text:
stiff drinks at stiff prices (mostly $9 or $10)...small..but packs a punch......"can i get some pretzels or nuts?"....$2.12 for a cup of nuts....ouch~!.....dos cadillac margaritas had me buzzzzzin'...talk about stiff drinks.....fiesta en mi cabeza...
  large dive looking bar...seems to be a popular watering hole on fillmore street....armed with martinis, margaritas, beers, cocktails and more....burgers and bar food galore....

5iCzdzUFqbwwjgYkfr2nhA.review_text: Came here to pre-drink before moving over to Mighty during the SFIAAFF.   This spot is an ok spot, if you are looking for a place to go for a happy hour drink after work.  It's probably a good spot to start the night before going somewhere else in the area, but that's all its worth, unless what you are looking is the former.  The place doesn't really come off with a vibe of good times, it really seems more like a place of just sitting around and killing time.  The music they play while you drink doesn't really fit the ambience of the room either.  The place is just as plain as the name, which is unfortunate because it would have been dope to go to a plain named place and have been wow'd.

HgPv_guwzkuHbxz3xZE2jQ.review_text: Every time I come here, I keep thinking this place will improve but it never does. Isn't that the definition of insanity? Anyways, the only reason I go there now is if a friend is having a birthday party or social gathering to support a cause. The bartenders just aren't that nice, and they act like it's a bother to get your drink order. The crowd is pretty lame with everyone scoping each other out. Every time I go I get hit on by douchebag patrons. The bar is super narrow, and there just isn't a lot of room to maneuver. I'd rather spend my time elsewhere and actually enjoy where I'm at.

MjCIBCRp7p4B_ITMWDpKzQ.review_text: This is definitely the go-to bar on Fillmore (probably because there aren't a lot of bars to choose from on this street anyways). I always have an enjoyable time at Harry's. I've been here on numerous amounts of bar trips, and have tried both brunch and lunch here. Everything's good. The staff is awesome, friendly, and humorous. The food is delicious and priced fairly (they have really good sandwiches, an amazing waffle dish and egg breakfast dish). Good to note-- the bartenders are usually pretty heavy pour-ers here.

jKjTC8f0sXiSaRt9qELVGg.review_text: Harry's was pretty poppin' for a Thursday night but our big group still managed to snag a table in the back of the bar. Service was quick as we kept the orders of shots coming. A whopping $600.00 later, our group was happily drunk and on our merry way. Good times!

_Xt-1-GcOYJ8SaOrCGKxyg.review_text: This place can get ridiculously loud.  The food is really grubbin bar food.  The mango mojitos are good.  I think I would give it 4 stars if it wasnt so damn loud.  The conversations around 1:30 here are ridiculous.  Its better to just shut up and dance.  Or get the person whose trying to talk to you to shut up.

iuksdLDzaWBbFLf0acnR4Q.review_text:
I think when the frat boys and sorority girls at Berkeley graduate and move across the bay to work in marketing, they gravitate towards Harry's; the name sounds kind of like Henry's, and they're not much for reading. 
  A bit harsh, perhaps, but the thirty minutes I spent at Harry's were pretty awful. 
  ...I went to Harry's for a friend's co-worker's birthday party. 
  I said hi to the birthday guy, and then went to get a drink -- and ten feet from the bar, I noticed the row of asses from the women standing there looked exactly the same. I don't mean to say that Pac Heights chicks are all in great shape and have the same ass -- but, rather, that they were all wearing exactly the same pair of Seven Jeans.  
  It's time to branch out, dears. 
  But I made my way to the bar, and patiently waited for a drink. For ten minutes, without even a bartender wave. Apparently the rule is, girls ordering fruity blue drinks get served first. I contemplated reaching over the bar to grab the beer myself. 
  A guy in a button down shirt with multicolored stripes asked if my hair was, like, punk or something, because he was cool with that. Did I like Good Charlotte? It's hard to tell from the front, but I think he might have been wearing Seven jeans as well. 
  It says a lot that I was actually relieved when the booze cruise bus showed up; drunken kids spilled into the bar and demanded drinks. They were as ignored as I was, despite their wristbands, but their exuberance was refreshing. 
  Yeah, ok, the bar itself is gorgeous; but if it's mahogany you're after, head for House of Shields or Hotel Utah.

04KTwRYw1cFu0L4EfaYajw.review_text: i'm a little biased since i bartend at a competing bar in pac heights... but i went to harry's last night to see what all of the fuss was about. i've heard their mojitos rival those at the lion pub... so i tried one (my soul died a little because of my betrayal). i've become quite the mojito snob since i make so many and have perfected the art of muddling. anyway, i tried the raspberry mojito. first and foremost, it came in a tiny glass. bah... give me my drink and make it large, especially if i'm paying 8-9 dollars for it. it was good, couldn't really taste any alcohol which is pretty lame, but the raspberries were refreshing. harry's gets one star for playing the soft core porn movie "summer of love". nothing like boobies and bare ass to make your night more interesting. it helped me stop staring at the crowd of douchey patrons. the sea of pink shirts, $100 t-shirts and fake (or heavily pushed up) boobs can be GREAT fodder for a night of being judgemental and talking crap all night long... however the fact that the bar was smotheringly hot, i had to go. i stayed for one round and two shots... but i had to move on. been there, done that. i'm going back to the lion pub.

H1pOm3aWRvYoQXmfLnRlXQ.review_text: I like this neighborhood and I love the vibe at Harry's Bar but I noticed women were outnumbered by bromances.  LOL... Just observe when you're there and you'll see what I mean. Makes people watching so much more interesting.    The food was okay.  I love the truffle fries, sweet potato fries, and calamari. The steak salad and kobe sliders failed.  The steak were tough and the sliders were dried.    Service was good given that it was so busy but this place is always packed whether it's lunch time or dinner.

Ct456aEICzDfn03MHZCzsw.review_text: American Kobe ground beef hamburger, medium with fries and a beer for LUNCH. Sit outside.  Often obnoxious crowd at night. Big screen tvs to watch sports, but too many bridge and tunnel faux tweenies sometimes.

fN_7N7YSHH8uXhq1UhP65w.review_text: Great Happy Hour spot.  Met friends for a quick drink and apps.  Had great great great service and the drinks and apps were delish!  I give it four stars!

aEKUC4oQg2CokbwyW_CXSg.review_text: Harry's totally does the trick in a neighborhood with zero bar scene. What is it with Fillmore? Thank god for Lion Pub or we'd have no where to go within walking distance. Anyway, I've been a couple times for lunch, or for drinks before a show at The Fillmore, and went in again last Friday for drinks and dinner. The kobe sliders hit the spot on a hungover drinking night. Just had wine, but I've had other drinks here before, mojito's not bad. Funny scene, lots of picking up here, but good spot to grab a few drinks in the hood.

Hguq_kinc5yQb7SeLdAM5A.review_text: Awesome food.  The Cajun fries are a must!  Creative, good, and stiff drinks.  Outdoor seating with great people watching.  Where could you find a better place for lunch?  I haven't been here at night so can't really comment on the bar scene though.

E_1rVCWq4NgbXhEjMC651Q.review_text: There are so many other great bars in San Francisco that warrants the two-star review for this one. I just don't really get the vibe here. Random old grainy movies played in the background with spotty service and a tad pricey drinks (when not on happy hour).  You can throw a baseball and hit much better bars.

0ApIoyM76fcYHcdDEgzAxQ.review_text: I really liked the feel of this place on the first Sunday of the 2011 NFL season.  Good looking women in gaggles of 3 and 4, plenty of TVs, open windows out to the street for people watching and they even play hip hop music.  Service and food were both a little lacking however.  Waited roughly 45 minutes for a table for 5, would not recommend this place for large groups on a Sunday.  Food came out staggered, with some people getting their add-ons ahead of their main dish.  The Egg Sandwich disappointed, wilted lettuce and a massive clump of mayonnaise on one piece of bread.  Breakfast potatoes were bland and uninspired.  The bottomless Bellini's were tasty, and new carafes came at a steady stream with out having to request.  By far the highlight of this visit.  Props - Cool atmosphere, attractive crowd and bottomless Bellini's  Cons - Mediocre food and service

FydMpekx_qUrri5BA7UnPw.review_text: Ahh Harry's Bar (which used to be Marron's Creamery back in the day {which was a Wednesday, btw}).  We all have some infamous stories about this place but right now it's all about Monday nights @ 5pm:  Ariel (who is awesome!) and her team serve up $5 Stella's and one of the best burger specials town. Mmm... Buuurrgerrrrssss....

WqFO9ApUbeThw5jpTfNfPg.review_text: I can't say anything about Harry's night life because I've only been there during the day.  I can say, however, that Harry's has great burgers, a good selection of beers, and the Bloody Marys are served with an Old Bay rim!  That was a first for me, and I must say that I loved it!

DtZvv0jwG2Op2ZDTCoq8Tg.review_text: This is my spot for hungover outdoor brunches on Saturdays or Sundays!  I'm NOT KIDDING!  You know when you've had a night out drinking and wake up the following day craving grease, fries, and everything that is just so bad for you?? (I know you do!)   The bloody-marys (extra spicey) are scrumptuous! I think they're turkey burger is the best I've ever had in my life!  I order it with gruyere, grilled onions and sauteed mushroom! (OMG, I think i just drooled!) Ahem, needless to say, I uh really like Harry's bar. heehee!  Oh and there's prime real estate seating outside for your people-watching enjoyment! haha!

Vm7KmgkN8xCnXn9pSVPo0A.review_text: If you have any soul at all or beleive in respecting people or the community DONT go to Harrys If you are a marina dweller or a white collar white person you will absolutly love it If that is the case   RELISH in it    its exists for you

5msVLaeY1yFqs6KQNHjyyA.review_text: no one was more shocked than me to realize that harry's club sandwich is the best in the city. they serve it with tasty chicken and green, delicious avocado. the fries are a nice compliment, too. harry's the bar is another sotry - it's fun and all but the club sandwich is the reason d'etre.

zyNGr5Tlg1rK1frevXCx2g.review_text: This is a before or after spot on a night out. You either start your night at Harry's with a drink OR you end your night at Harry's with a drink.  During the day, if you're in the area and craving a burger get it here. The burgers are really good. (but not as good as chez mama's in pot hill)  UPDATE: 5/18/07 So I went to Harry's a few weeks back at about 11pm to meet some friends. Low and behold there was a DJ AND PEOPLE! A good mix of people at that! I was shocked. The DJ makes a difference in how long you can spend at Harry's on a Saturday night. Not to say that I'd be there all night, it's still a starter or ender place, but you could add an hour to the beginning or end with the DJ and some friends there. :)

56vERWd2VPTfjytCQlSc6g.review_text: I think from now on anyone who's in the neighborhood of Harrys should order up a PBR, and then walk out disgusted when they say they dont have it, just to annoy the crap out of them  :)

5rK8eYZHUvugbVoAjvUX0g.review_text: i came here with a group of 18 on saturday and had a great time. Since there was such a huge group Harrys was perfect cause they took reservations and we got sat right away. i never would have thought of Harrys as a brunch spot but they actually have quite the spread :) Pros: $10 bottomless belinis that kept refilling, yummy food, the ability to get us all together so well for brunch, and we were able to be loud!! Cons: our food came out maybe 45 mins after we ordered and not all at once (their kitchen im sure was not prepared for such a large order at 1 time, totally understandable)

Op1d1btEf1B8RokwZLBZvQ.review_text: You may look at this place and say..."huh, looks like a pretty average  Joe Shmoe bar," but the burger special can turn your Manic Monday to Magnificent.  It helps anyway.  Monday nights until 7 you can get a burger, fries, and a draught pint for $7...and the burgers are actually very tasty!  I left very happy!

cqJ1s8WPm7asYW_I4tfXxg.review_text: As good as it gets for a sports bar. The food ingredients are fresh and the service is just fine. Solid, as long as you know what you're looking for, i.e. an all-American sports bar.

icdFgEhfphV49wauh0tLPA.review_text: Drinks were good...appetizers were yummy....crowd was meh... i went with my office, Harry's is close to my office, so we decided to go there  I did have a great time because of the company....not because of the atmosphere.  And all the great people watching. ALthough I must say, my mojito was very yummy...but this isnt the place I would choose to go to. It seems as if all the scummy douches of the summer were hogging the bar.   Note to anyone(man) going out for the evening: Sandals DO NOT go with jeans and a dress shirt. Sandals are for the beach, for vacation, or maybe for a trip to the local safeway, but most DEFINATELY not for a nite out.  IF you do choose to wear sandals, for the love of all things holy, CUT YOUR TOENAILS.

_lDnL_xzBFVSEOQr_KAfWA.review_text: Love love love this place! I just moved to the area 2 months ago and have already made it to Harry's a dozen times. I love going during their happy hour because a Stella is only three bucks and they actually serve it in the right glass, making it taste just right. There food is amazing, especially for bar food. Everytime i go i get something new and havent been dissapointed yet. They also make a great bloody mary!

L2ffiznMDwF2qUrX5y02AA.review_text: I have heard many good things about Harry's.  And then, I went there.  Sports Bar I hear -- always playing the game.  So my brother and friend met there on a recent Tuesday night.  Prices a bit expensive, and the fries accompanying the burger were cold.  Also, be sure not to order a PBR, because (1.) they dont have that there.  And, (2) the pretentious bartendress may look you straight in the eye and ask why the hell you would order such a drink like.  I mean, dont you, like, totally realize where you are.  Um (twirls hair and cocks head), you are like, totally in, um, Pacific Heights.  Nevermind that in place of PBR, they have such stellar brews as Coors Light and Budweiser.  Thanks for pointing that out.  Just keep in mind Harry's as velvet rope and cush as it is, lies blocks away from Western Addition, where I am sure the PBR flows.  Keep Rockin' Harry's.  (cough, cough)

F4YITLZuNvNDTklMrHkjYg.review_text: When it's not crowded, I love the atmosphere in this place!  Beautiful wooden bar, a retrospective walk in San Francisco time.  Too bad it becomes a zoo at night.  I've had too many random alcoholic beverages spilled on me by drunk people.    And as much as I'd like to say otherwise, their burgers are just o.k.  If I'm having a hankering for a good burger, I'm better off at Johnny Rockets on the next block over.

8_Hs9Bh5tgFdc_1ycxHChg.review_text: WOW, IT HAPPENED!!! THE NINERS ARE GOING TO THE SUPER BOWL!  I was here watching the niners beat the falcons. The bar was packed! like I could not even move in the slightest. The energy was amazing.   Drinks: I ordered a well greyhound and a jack/coke which totaled to about $20 with tip.  Service: When it's crowded, and I mean jam packed, it's better to not keep an open tab. The waitresses were coming by and would not take my order because my tab was not with them. I would have tipped them in cash anyway, but the bar lost my next couple orders and I decided to stay sober (mostly a good decision). It's impossible to weed through the crowd to get to the bar to order the second drink so when i finally got there, I just closed my tab out of frustration. Can't stay mad for too long when those 9ers are doing work :) I was drunk off of that win alone.

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: Two girls walk into a bar...  (stop me if you've heard this one)  ...they look around, take eye candy inventory, arrive at a score of 0 and turn the hell around and walk out. Yep, that was how appealing this place was to my friend and I on Friday night.   I guess preppy sports bar would be the best way to describe this place. Thing is, I don't really fancy myself a sports lover, nor do I particularly care for preppy people, so the most I can give this place and sleep at night is a 2. Sorry, but this place was L-A-M-E.

xqe8QcpRryKuK2wn5TZJYg.review_text: YUM.  Good mac and cheese.  I have to say, it was one of the better that I've had - and a nice, healthy portion at that!  The kobe slider was pretty good too.  A juicy piece of beef with caramelized onions on a tiny toasted bun that isn't dry?  Sure beats a mini sirloin burger from a cracked out clown.  As far as the drinks go, they were OK for specialty cocktails - good for $5 during happy hour.  The pineapple lychee martini was tasty and the wildberry cosmo was alright.  The first round we had was actually quite delicious but the second was downright disgusting.  I don't know if they switched up bartenders or what but we could have set ourselves on fire with the amount of cheap liquor that was in that drink.

bWxxfPP08zWJuM5wKG0LvQ.review_text: Update: Ok plus one more star for having an EXCELLENT burger. I had two bites of the fiancee's burger and was just about ready to risk ending our relationship so I could steal the rest of his burger. YUM.  This place is ok, the drinks are good and it's a Notre Dame bar which is cool but the crowd can get tiring, but if you like yuppies pretending to be hipsters then it's all good.

OaJlwMnbJwHmMjlmgX6jmg.review_text: This net of a bar catches the Marina overflow. Slummin' it, fellas?

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: I haven't dined here in a while, but on a busy Friday night, I was annoyed by the waitress who couldn't seem to get my order right. I ordered a margarita with no salt...and got a margarita with salt. I ordered a chicken sandwich with mayo on the side....not so much.  But the food and drinks are solid, and the burger and beer deal on Monday nights is pretty good.

sZCLIvqhKPXZimcpey5p7g.review_text: Buffalo Chicken Sandwich with Blue Cheese Dressing= Heart Attack on a Plate.  Good thing I have health insurance. Bring it, Harry.  Good place for burgers and spirits.

5_PGn2aBh69kXUTs01yjRQ.review_text: I've been coming to this bar on and off for over 12 years.  I like the atmosphere and the food is decent.  There are only a hand full of bartenders who really pay attention and go the extra mile though which is why I'm only giving these guys 4 stars.  I'll sometimes sit at the bar for over 10 minutes at a time waiting to get someones attention and it can be pretty annoying, especially when there are 2 bartenders at peak times.  The servers for table service are excellent though.  I still go and enjoy myself their though.

XJDTpVQk68l8ZAp5vhbRWA.review_text: I like this place. Great drinks, and kewl inner layout. The bartenders are friendly.

BxMeAsKt9jy6jAbfp-5c_A.review_text: The 2 hour wait for a table at Dosa on Fillmore was the only reason my date and I stepped foot into Harry's.  It  seemed crowded and noisy from the sidewalk but we both really wanted a cocktail after a long week.  Upon entering, I wondered if this location was modeled after the original Harry's in Venice (Italy) given the decor and the overall theme, but then I saw a DJ setting up his turntables. Probably not the same Harry's. She and I both noticed the inconspicuous special drink menu that was plastered on the mirror behind the bar. There were some interesting choices that gave this place some potential until...  1. Pineapple lychee martini - meh.  Their martini glasses are small to begin with.
