It's served with a garnish of a single lychee and a HUGE chunk of pineapple offsetting the volume of the liquid for a total of 3 mediocre tasting sips.  2. Mango mojito -  Waaaay too sweet.  A glass full of simple syrup would have been better.   3. Hendricks cucumber gimlet - tasty.  This would be a perfect summer drink with a great balance of tart and cucumber mixed with my favorite gin.  I think it would be better served in a highball glass on the rocks but what do I know?   The atmosphere wasn't bad for a sports bar on a Friday night - pretty good looking 20-30 something crowd with some random older bar flies and dare I say, cougars scattered throughout.  An older Caucasian gentleman sitting next to us at the bar struck up conversation by asking me about my ethnicity:  Older man: "Are you Chinese?" Me: "No, I'm Korean".  Older man: "Well I grew up in Chinatown" Me: "???" Older man: "All my friends are Chinese" Me: "That's great - is anyone sitting in this stool?" Older man: "People used to be very racist back in the day" Me: "I bet.  I remember getting teased when I was in grade school." Older man: "I once told an Irish man to go f**k himself for calling my best friend a chink..." Me (smiling): "That was, uh, nice of you" Older man: "You're welcome." My date: "Can we go back to Dosa now?" Me: "Absolutely, without a doubt, yes."  *sigh* Aside from the awkward conversation, it wasn't too bad...1 star docked for expensive drinks served in miniature glassware.  The kobe burger and fries with truffle oil sounds compelling enough for me to return to give the food a try sometime.

whfjd0gIdtPXLTZKmNYqZQ.review_text: I've never eaten at Harry's, but I do like the drinks, and the old school clubby feel. Mind you, I'm not a big fan of being felt up by the old school boys club who tend to congregate here.

c30-x5Hvn-XIccgiKO0QJw.review_text: This is a good place have food and drinks with a few friends in a cozy and casual environment. I wouldn't make it an end of the night destination but rather use it as a spot to meet and hangout with a group before moving on to more bars or dancing. I found the staff to be very friendly and attentive.

gbY1cIV7spGsKFbXHPNwGQ.review_text: This is definately a place to go if you just wanna chill and grab a quick bite.  I only came because the restaurant that we were eating had an hour wait, Harry's Bar wasn't too far, we came and sat down ourselves, we only wanted to order drinks but got tempted to order their snacks.  1. GARLIC FRIES are bomb! just like the ones from at&t park but thinner and crispier with extra garlic! 2.  Hot wings were juicy ozzing perfect, X the celery, never liked it  I woiuld most DEF come back for a girls night out, best part, you don't even have to dress up =)

CeLsdyLb8Z6NbdtMdTC4UQ.review_text: It had been over a year since I was last here, and I couldn't remember why each time I walked past the place, I'd always look upon it as being so mediocre and undesirable. Tonight served as the perfect reminder.  Four of us walked in for the BCS Championship game. All the tables were taken, but there were a few open spots at the bar. We left our name and headed over for a few drinks. Bar service was quick and painless, although the tap options were limited and the cocktails a bit overpriced for the caliber of the place. Overall, okay.  1.5 hours later, we were next on the list, and a table was clearing out. That's when I watched the hostess guide a completely different group of 4 to the table we should've been given. She then came and told us that "people will probably leave after the game's over," and that we should just grab a table if we see one. Clearly we were also there for the game, and also had little interest in being there once the game was over. By some stroke of luck, a table emptied on our way out, and we took it.  The $11 burger+pint special looked best. Unfortunately, once we managed to get the waitress' attention and began to place our orders, she told us they weren't honoring the special due to the game. That's the kind of nickel-and-diming, baiting-and-switching behavior that comes from only the most dishonest businesses.  And that was the last straw.  We left immediately, and I have no intention of ever going back.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: This bar is like having sex with a really hot guy only to find out he is dumb as a rock and totally sucks in bed.   When you see the decor you think "cool". It is old school dark wood all nicely polished with brass pole accents to divide the bar area from the raised platform of low cocktail tables behind it. The bar is stocked with beautifully presented shelves of booze and they have those great hard cover bar menus with some eats and creative cocktails that are, surprisingly, not too terribly expensive for this sort of place. That is where the initial attraction begins, but then when you peel away the layers you realize this bar just isn't worth your time.   Just like with dumb hot guy it is nearly impossible to have a meaningful conversation. The DJ is pumping the music so loud you feel dumb yourself by the time you leave. For what? They don't even have a dance floor....unless you ask the ditsy girls dancing on the cocktail tables. They seem to think any wood surface is a dance floor, which works out well for the guys who think a line about cooking you breakfast is the golden key into your pants for the evening.   Harrys, you seem to have such potential, but I left feeling so unsatisfied, which is really too bad since you otherwise could be another place in our circulation of bottomless mimosa brunches. Yet, even this is not enough to draw me back here.

QcPN-Dee_dU2IWno-f2oYA.review_text: i like the bar but i don't like the douchebag that called me a fat turd as I was leaving.  well you're a bald headed drunk that's not going home with anyone tonight because you're an a**hole.

ghost_id_1.review_text: Not my type of people, not my type of place, small drinks   BUT THEY PLAYED MUSIC THAT I CAN SING ALONG TO! [That this is a big plus for me, but I'm guessing that it's a huge minus for people who were around me. Oh well! :)]

9-GvWmtgo_n_n6E0V85X6w.review_text: Came here on football sunday to a room full of testorone filled men shouting obscenities endlessly at multiple television screens. That's a football sunday for ya. I went with a group of guy friends, had a couple of drinks  didn't' eat the food so can't comment on that but the drinks were well made and the atmosphere was that of a brunch sports bar. That's the new term I'm coining, brunch sports bar. yeah.

mul5X8OwCAlYBSAJE5GIdw.review_text: We actually got a table right before the kick-off of of the AFC wild-card game, so I was immediately impressed.  Though the kobe burger i had was good, it was a little overcooked for 'medium'.  Our waitress was great though and very attentive.

x0eZZGweZDM_6P0yjV6uPw.review_text: I came here St. Patrick's Day 2007.  They made pretty good Bloody Mary's, and my burger was really good.  The bartender was really sweet and attentive.  The drinks were cheap.  We were here for a really long time, and I plan on coming back.

OlElQy5Cpe076eenlqEsbA.review_text: Nice bar scene to catch up with a friend. Lots of older crowds nothing you'll find in the college areas. The bartenders are nice and the bathrooms are clean. Drinks are like any other bar nothing cheap. Cool place, find a seat when you can or else it gets crowded! Seatings are first come first serve.

aqQ0MR0a9Ht9srz7PTRE3g.review_text: I like Harry's...the menu is simple but good. The service is nice. The ambiance is sort of clubby, but not fussy or pretentious. It's dark and relaxed. The drink selection is a standout. But just FYI...don't come here if you're under 21. Apparently they have a Cabaret license? Well basically, they won't even serve you food if you can't buy alcohol.  Harry's may not always be my scene, but if I'm in the area, I'd definitely come back.

2hyjCUmJ0MRNEJJTSqY_6g.review_text: 3 words - truffle parmesan fries! The best truffle fries I've tasted is still at Maxfield's but this was a close second. The cocktails are really good - surprising to see those types of concoctions at a sports bar. I would categorize this as a more upscale sport bar. Decor had character to it.

8_APo4b5Y2lDlP681zvROA.review_text: I was skeptical coming to this bar becuase of the reviews from the catty girls who can't handle other girls being present apparently.  Well, I give this establishment 5 stars because our waitress, Shannon, was awesome!  Service with a smile and didn't mess up a single order.  We only had drinks so I can't really rate the food but the drinks were great.  My favorite drink, Tom Collins, was just ok.  I've had better.  Also, this place needs to get an air conditioning unit becuase it was so stuffy in that place (maybe it was because we were sitting in the back corner).  But, nevertheless, Shannon, was awesome enough that I'm rating it 5 stars.

On12yRT-2yqqHNgDHBSfBA.review_text: Ugh. Is there anything worse than an aging frat boy? Yes - 50 of them at the same place. What's worse than that? Aging frat girls, too drunk to notice the aging frat boys groping their bums. Add to this wonderful equation an inattentive staff, less than mediocre food and you've got yourself...well, what do you have?   For those with any kind of dignity, taste buds, and decent thirst palate, do yourself a favor - move on, ain't nothin to see here.

-eRfdiI6gmGyKYvckXxvhA.review_text: Good ole Harry's, never been here at night, but during the day and happy hourish is my fav. time.  Young prof, etc, just hanging out after work.  Decent food and plenty of drinks.  Good for groups, although it might be a lil tricky snatching a table.

WJIEdPeGjP35RScfyRr01w.review_text: Hmm. I came here because the wait for dinner at another restaurant was insanely long and thanks to the drinks listed on the mirror included a lychee martini. So to make a couple of hours go by quickly why not hang out, have a couple of drinks and a few laughs with some friends.  Not so much, well the laughs yes that is always going to happen but this bar reminds me of being that piece of fresh meat out in the African safari and some ravage beast always seems to smell it from miles away. Why am I thinking of animal planet of all things? Because it's the animal planet for singledom, seriously. Put a single gal or guy in this joint and they're going home with a one night stand.   Being single that does not really bother me but being surrounded by typical asshats does so I stuck to my drink and my laughs with a good friend and we sipped away 2 hours. The lychee martini was meh, but filled the much needed craving that has been sitting for weeks on the backburner.

K1NLdTfT1IizE-6smhsSug.review_text: I don't even know why I actually walked in here this past Wednesday on my way home from work, but was hoping, praying wishing that SOMEONE would have the damn Red Sox game on so I can watch the last few innings.  SHOCKING, the retards that run this place, the patrons who drink at this place and think they are cool cause they are rocking out to Vanilla Ice and Milli Vanilli, and the idiots who think this may be a tasty choice for a restaurant, were all sitting like dumb-asses watching poker or some shit on 2 tvs and the Chicago White Sox game on the remaining 3.  REALLY?!?!?!?!    Ever since I moved down the street on Divis and CA almost 2 years ago, I have disliked this place for so many reasons.  The female bartenders/servers suck major ass and will ignore anyone else who walks in with boobs but will give the weenies tons of attention which only boost up their egos and make them even more unattractive to the sober eye.  It's pathetic, not worth the money, your ear drums, taste buds (for food or drink) and will only leave you sitting next to some fool in a blazer, sandals, and a popped up collar who will try to talk some mad shit to impress you, but if you are smart...you will walk out ASAP.

n-LZIcHGmWfRl1GwdNlFzQ.review_text: Should be 3.5 stars. Inside is nice layout. It has on open feel and descent mingling room which I've always found important. Few beers on tap and in a not so good location. Nothing really special about it, but if your already in the, not a bad stop.

LVcbO8YWYz9WjHLBXN6jpQ.review_text: Two of my favorite bitches wanted to go here for drinks and dinner.  They are two of the most sassy girls you will ever meet.  FYI-bitches is used in the nicest way possible.   So they brought me out to Harry's.  I was skeptical at first.  We got there at 7 and it was already packed.  I mean, no seats except at the bar.  We hussle up to the bar and order some drinks while we wait.  My friend is scoping the bar for a table like a vicious cougar.  She eyes some dudes with popped collars that are about to leave.   On a side note, why do all these guys pop the necks on their shirts?  I can't imagine why anyone would think this is a good look.  I think its even more disturbing when they have two dress shirts on and pop both the necks. I just dont get it. So we are at the bar and ready to pounce on a table. There is a group of about 8 people in the back who are taking up three seperate booths and no one is  using one of the booths.  We asked the waitress if we can sit there and she says they are using it but no one is sitting there.  Well, that was not what we wanted to hear.  If they are using it, shouldnt they be sitting there?  Weird.  The dudes across the room finally get up and my friend makes a run for it and completely leaves her purse at the bar with me because she fears it might slow her down in her pursuits.  The two of us are watiting at the bar while Wonder Woman attacks the natives.  It was actually quite funny.  I close out my bar tab and we head over to the table where my friend tells us that she almost had a knock down fight with some woman who was trying to get a 4 person table for a party of two, she said she had more people coming later.   Well, we were all there now so we took the table.  I have never actually been in  a place where you had to fight for a table.  I really dont think drinks and dinner are as much fun when you have to get your table american gladiators style.  We order some more drinks and food and they were really good.  I give the place props for the food, it was well done.  However, the waitress had the personality of a snail.  We kept trying to be social with her but she was like a robot.  I get that servers are busy but I loved it when people were friendly to me when I served back in college.  It reminded me that I existed when most people are just a-holes.  So I took off two stars for the bad service and the lack of seating.  By the time we left, there were people standing up in the front waiting for seats and this is a small place.  I guess my best advise would be to get there early enough to secure a table or you will be fighting gladiator style.

IJABCqLsGgT8DxqujUQmiA.review_text: Brunch here was pretty good and fairly cheap. I asked for the Bloody Mary to be extra spicy and they did indeed make it extra spicy! Yeah! The frittata was pretty good, though the nachos were just average. Outdoor seating and room for the puppy are bonuses!

57qfUVoU8cJaGSgVH0Z53Q.review_text: Ducked in real quick for an update of the SC/Stanford game on Saturday night. They were pretty accomodating with our party of five. Thumbs up for not kicking us out since we didn't order anything. It was stand room only at that point. We weren't there for very long, but definitely got a good vibe.

F-1Sjy1xOk0UIvXpCgiGgA.user_location: Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco, CA
F-1Sjy1xOk0UIvXpCgiGgA.review_text: Now that I have been living in SF for some time I would definitely not say that Harry's is exceptionally expensive. Although the consistency of drinks sometimes wavers in my opinion, it is nonetheless my go to bar in Pac Heights. The ambiance and drink selection make it a great place for happy hour before dinner on Filmore.

fIfKT5J7OWnr_sNP7VKkAw.review_text: I've been to Harry's too many times to count as alas, it was the only bar within a block of my old apartment. OK for Sunday football watchin', but the night time scene is.... well I'll get to that. The prices on the drinks are a bit high, but it is Pac Heights so I guess that's to be expected.  In my opinion the bartenders are very nice, there have been one or two that were boring but never mean or bitchy. They're all females, I hear rumor that there was a guy bartender once in a time long long ago, but I've never seen anything but ladies.  The portion of this bar that makes me shudder is the crowd. I don't need to get too detailed, it's summed up here already. If you're the guy type to try to get noticed by frantically strutting your stuff in that newly purchased $250 collared/striped shirt then by all means, enjoy. And don't you fret, there are plenty of over-dressed, over make-uped women who have been drinking fruity cocktails all day that will be more than happy to have you drape yourself on them. Same goes for the "aging frat boy" comments, I couldn't say it better myself.  Anyway, if you are stuck in the neighborhood and need some booze then by all means, Harry's has booze. During the early times on Sunday for sports it's fine, just expect the sports crowd. But on a Saturday night? If only I knew how to scare away half the people I'm sure it would be much better.

bAfWWyTTd3zl4gXWBWt-Zg.review_text: Well of course I have to review Harry's since it is walking distance from my house and I am practically here every Sunday! LOVE LOVE LOVE their burgers (try the Fillmore burger, it is fab!) and fries with beer...and its a great place to drink your Sunday hangover away while watching sports and catching up with friends about the weekend shananigans. Superbowl and March madness were off the hook, def a great place to go to watch the big games. Sometimes we go on Friday nights, which is not so impressive...think older not so attractive crowd, but the pomergranite martinis and goose greyhounds are yummy and it is a low key place if you just want somewhere closeby to drink thats not so Marina-ey. Overall, one of my local faves!!

yN3cBeSdhtFRcFPdLgDlbw.review_text:
Located in the heart of Pac Heights on Fillmore, this is one of my favorite places to grab a burger and a beer. It is low key, sports are always on, and the cocktails are pretty tasty. Their burgers are HUGE and fries extra crispy. 
 The crowd is a mix of the young professionals with some of the older locals. 
 It can get crowded in the evenings on the weekends, but if you want good food, then head on over to Harrys. And for you boys out there, the waitresses are pretty darn cute, so shamelsssly flirt, they like it.HA!

dmyZ4TDN18z1-mRRdzY_8A.review_text: Cool place. Great liquor selection - love all the whiskey and bourbon options they have. Their beer selection was great too. Lagunitas IPA on tap... and in Lagunitas mason jars??? Awesome!  Bartenders were pretty chill too. If only the gal I took there was as cool. Shoulda left her at home.

p-GsrmGjWyk-27o1B8LSOA.review_text: avoid this place if you can.  we waiting literally for 1 hour to sit down for their "bottomless bellini" just to learn that they had skipped over us and let 4 people go ahead.  we were finally seated and had to wait another 15/20 minutes just to get our order taken in.  the food was horrible.  it was obvious that they were cooking the waffles on the same grill as the onions/peppers... you could taste it in the waffles.  disgusting.  there are a TON of better options for places to eat or watch the game.  skip this place and do yourself a favor.

bw3gOUlsSFVbcf9kaH7fQA.review_text: Go here Mondays for the burger special.  The Kobe burger is pretty good.    I have only been here once at night and it wasn't that great.  Not a huge selection of beer on tap.  The good thing about this place is the huge TV's.

5vod9_lAYmbOFPwN6iLrvg.review_text: What a sorry excuse for a place to drink. There is no difference between their cocktails and  juice/ice, except it's cheaper to buy juice/ice at a supermarket. I'm convinced they didn't put any alcohol into my drinks at all but had the audacity to charge $8 for each one. What a total rip-off. The service was completely negligent. We had to flag down the waitress every time we wanted anything because she never bothered to check on us. I wouldn't return to this place for any reason, and I'm shocked they have any business.

NALHOp0E1RcJSeeklLHacA.review_text: Food ehh - the Pisco Mule however..... yes please.

9IYZc_sX7v939OhRGDjj-g.review_text: When I worked in the neighborhood we would stop buy every sunday after our brunch shift, and sit around sippin' on suds and taking shots of fernet.  This was fun, but the crowds were not.  The staff is easy on the eyes which is always a bonus, the ex frat guy's who are shamelessly holding on to there colleges is not.  Overall it is ok, but even after going for two or three months staight we still wern't reconized and I find this to be dissapointing, I mean I reconize people after there second visit to my resteraunt.  Is this asking to much, I don't know.

DGlEpdOgkK8B4bJ3QUtd1A.review_text: Walking into Harry's Bar during the torrential rain this afternoon, I felt like I was walking into a frat-party, and that's not a good thing in my book.   Next to us was a group of men in their late 20s acting like they were in their late teens - hitting each other in the arm, commenting about their sexual conquests and loudly proclaiming that "they are so drunk", followed by group hi-fiving. I know, it's that bad.  To top it off, the Mojito one friend had was sub par as was my irish coffee. For the prices they charge, I expected much better.  Needless to say, I won't be back.

kSq6apUHB3UXRxw6sjNjfg.review_text: Great happy hour and nice neighborhood feel

SugBpEEljOdljAOX2eIbLQ.review_text: Good spot to meet friends and grab a casual dinner/drinks and watch a sporting event.  Gets too crowded in the evening and would be helpful to have the sound on the tvs for big games instead of dj music..

uZg1FZbO99YnX61Hw3fd3Q.review_text: This place is great when its NOT packed.  Semi packed is ok but for some reason when it gets full the douche bags seem to appear out of nowhere.  I got luck tonight because the only douche bag was my friend Peter.  LOL!  Met up with a group former classmates and I have to say its located in a nice part of Pac Heights.  Although some will say otherwise I happen to like it.  Plus my friends live close by so parking wasn't a problem for me. Although street parking might be a challenge.  For some reason I automatically thought of "Cheers" when I stepped inside. Oddly enough there was a heavyset guy sitting at the end of the bar having a beer.  So far so good.  Its too early in the week to dive into the hard stuff so we decided to stick with beer and lighter cocktails.  Their mango mojito wasn't the greatest.  Too sweet and I could barely taste the mango, which I assumed was probably the flash frozen type that was left the thaw.  The only reason I ordered this drink was because the boobs....uh I mean the bartender recommended it.  Stella on tap, which is the only way to have it.  Their burger was pretty good but I'd stay away from the Kobe.  I wasnt wowed by it.  When it comes to burgers, ground chuck 80/20 is the way to go.  Besides, for $3 more do you think you're getting 100% Kobe?  Its most likely a blend.  All things considered I would still come back.  Their brunch menu seems interesting.  Ok, I lied. I also bought a round of goose. =P

KOWl_ZhqhYqY33-CbaJubw.review_text: When I think of places to go to in Pacific Heights, only a few places come to mind.  Harry's tops the list.  Yes, they do get crowded (and loud), even moreso on days like Valentine's.  Although, they do offer great specials on these days.    On a normal day I tend to show up late and I get seated fairly quick.  I dig the old school music playing in the background, and sometimes those funny soft-core porn movies they play on their flat-screens.   When they're busy, of course service will be slower, but they do check on us quite frequently...with a smile.  You can't go wrong with their calamari and sweet potato fries.  Mac and Cheese was slightly better than average, but their serving size was perfect!  Steak salad and Kobe sliders were just okay.  I finally had their burger during my last visit, and yes...I was more than satisfied.    What drives me back the most are their amazing truffle fries.  Paired with any of their finest liquid concoctions...I'm in bar heaven!!

5GBSaRen9WepaKYTmqH7RA.review_text: 4 stars for their kick ass pomegranate martini, and rowdy masculine atmosphere.  Somehow, the two went perfectly hand in hand.  Unlike most sports bars I've experienced thus far in my 21+ life, the service was impeccable--even at peak hours on a Saturday night.  I didn't try the food, but I'll undoubtedly be back.

yIhNnoEpKVOE_9cKUJAG8g.review_text: Harry's Haiku:  I am man, pound beer. Do you like my popped collar? Damn, he has one too.

eqwjvhOSjLPiUUCTamzMAQ.review_text: I have been here a number of times and this place is great for a bite to eat. My only complaint is that the service can be horrible at times. I even had to leave after having drinks once because I was completely ignored.

7L6yO3NuDEZ3xqdx8dMkfw.review_text: With a couple exceptions, the staff here is incredibly rude.

V8OucGMQcsAQSXBMwBgwDA.review_text: Rude, rude, rude, rude, rude service.  I'll never go there again.  This place is a waste of space and a desecration of the name "Harry's Bar".  I've been to the real Harry's Bar, in Venice, and all I can say is that Harry must be rolling over in his grave and cursing his descendants for allowing the name of his wonderful, wonderful bar being used for this tasteless hellhole.

s6Bh-pvs9hX_MilCmCrwYQ.review_text: Just ventured over to Harry's this weekend on a whim and was satisfied with both the service and the food-this is probably due to the fact that it was lunchtime..and gorgeous outside so we got peachy seats and insta-service.   Usually on the weekend eves Harry's is a painful crush- if you dare hazard a visit during the crush-one look at the side walk (from a block away) and you know you will never be able to sardine yourself between the glossy lips, blonde hair and primadonnas to even find a seat. Might as well keep walkin'...  The bar fare is simple and pleasing..the Greek salad is a mainstay and yes they serve it with kalamata olives (not black California olives as some restaurants do)...and holey tamales, they are PITTED! (so they get a gold star for that) The lemon drop martini still can't beat the Ritz...but its tasty and after a few, who the heck cares that it isn't that tart...  The battered fish and chips is delish and I recommend it highly, as well as the calamari with that kick ass aioli (spicy-savoury). All in all, we had a great view, nice atmosphere and attentive help. Definitely will go back (only at lunchtime)

iiytiZKqlnwdE_9YjwIlGw.review_text: Crowded, but cute. The bathrooms need to be renovated, as they don't match the rest of the place at all - they look like the bathrooms at a bad night club.  I would not recommend the crispy chicken burger. I ordered it imagining a gourmet version of the ones in the KFC commercials. What I received was a soggy mess. It was just about the least crispy thing ever, saturated in Buffalo sauce which had seeped into the bun as well. Fries were mediocre. My friend's sandwich looked good, though.  Service was friendly but not very efficient - it was a hot day and I had to ask for more water even when they weren't busy.

zlyKmaUcKVM3dc3lQQjfjQ.review_text: I'm not really a big fan of this place, the typical crowd and the service leave a lot to be desired.  I've never eaten here so I can't comment on the food.  It used to be better when I first moved in around the corner, they had a good beer special that I would take full advantage of whenever posible.  I haven't been there in a while so maybe it's different but I doubt I'll be treking over there anytime soon to see if it is.

ixO9IshGOARbc73ZyvpNfQ.review_text: One of my go-to bars in the city when I want a casual (but not at all grungey) evening out with great people-watching. Very East Coast.   Decent cocktails and wine selection, although their happy hour specials ($4 for well drinks) are pretty watered-down.  Good bar food: thin and crispy sweet potato fries with aioli, and saucy fish tacos.  I have a feeling that you could come here in any condition (either famished or just slightly hungry; either looking to really liquor up or sip on some light bellinis) and walk away quite satisfied.

U2OjEYbTvsyWxendWBFg5w.review_text: Come on, you gotta love Harrys!  Dark, crowded and good pub grub.  It is just a great casual place where you can just hang out - I think they card for posers.

Ovf0_IR8oexOE2u4UeDlTw.review_text: The food is good.  The people are not.  But I didn't come to eat the people.  This time.

SW-U6u1gbCD2XctrW9L3QQ.review_text: Cougar Central.  I expect to be one someday, so I really like this place.

DH7ABAMHvl6IQfJ_yK7x5Q.review_text: Somehow I've made it into Harry's quite a few times... even though it isn't my crowd.  This is probably because there really aren't any other bars on Fillmore.  It did surprise me this weekend though... me and the bf went to watch the Yankee/ Red Sox series, prepared to deal with the Boston riff raff.  Much to our delight, there were a handful of Yankee fans and no Sox to be found.  They have a couple fruit infused vodkas behind the bar... the pineapple & lychee is stellar but the raspberry & cranberry is super bitter.  The bar food is also pretty decent... I had the tuna melt on a sourdough baguette and the side salad.  And they have entertainment!  Forty-something mom's getting wasted on martinis, frat boy reunions, obviously uncomfortable first dates, old guys hitting on the bartenders.  Not really my cup of tea but I guess Harry's has a special place in my heart because it encouraged some sparks for me and the bf back in the days of non-coupledom.  I'd go back for baseball and booze... that's about that.

F8_IBcJEwePwiFV2jCx2Sg.review_text: We tried watching the Giants game here during the World Series. This place held my attention for about ten minutes before I became unintere

-Qf4ffBkhYailgZ57ZenOA.review_text: Mmm Mmm Mango Mojito! I update my stars from 3 to 4 just for the mango mojito. I had the chicken sandwich this time as well and it was okay, but it was a little dry. Maybe add some mayo?

It7zQSShdiJ6A_zjSLzurA.review_text: I went to Harry's Bar with some co-workers on a Friday for Happy Hour. For some reason, I was expecting an older run down type of bar from the previous reviews. The place had a slightly older "Cheers" type decor, but the tables, chairs, and stools were very comfortable and pretty new; I liked it a lot. The waitresses here are great eye candy so that for me is worth a return trip in the near future. I'm not sure the drinks were discounted, so I don't know how good a happy hour place it really is for cheap drinks. I spent $13 on a Manhattan and Fat Tire. But the food is darn good. I had the best Mozzarella cheese sticks I've tried in a long time. They are big and cheesy served with a real tasty sauce. Once again for all you fellas out there, GREAT LOOKING WAITRESSES!!!  I took away a star because the service was a little shaky and there was a mix-up with the checks. Also, it's not that big, so not a great place for sports games.

vASaF47nWvCHEEDA8nfCVw.review_text: Huge determining factor for the favorable rating is our lovely server Shannon.  She lets us stand around this little table for 2 because both the dining area and bar was jam-packed with your typical Saturday night Fillmore St crowd.  She brought us all the drinks without ever messing up on order once.  AND she posed on some of our pictures in a way that made me want to extend our invitation to the karaoke joint which was our next stop for the night.  One let down is the absinthe - it is not the 180-proof variety with hallucinogenic effect.  Despite the recent lift of 95-year-old ban in the US, I guess it would take some time before you can find that drink in SF bars.  And oh, music, while v v interesting, was a tad loud and, without a dance floor it becomes a bit of a waste.

aFrzrUVHkIzHu9DDvF8nHA.review_text: It's the only bar near my work, which makes it the de facto spot for happy hours and such, but somehow it never fails to disappoint.  I think it's the crowd mostly, which I can never get drunk enough to ignore.  A lot of after-work upper chest gets shown off here, and usually it's not for the best.  The food is pretty standard pub grub, and I've had a decent burger here.   Otherwise, I would say farewell to your office mates and move along.

x3JcGJ0FdEEnFqM2GeU9mQ.review_text: Last night we went for a drink after work at Harry's Bar. The whole place was cluttered with a crowd of late20 to 30+ patrons drinking, talking, and having a good time. The vibe was definitely holiday and there were some people getting together to have a drink and open packages before heading off to wherever their headed to be with their family & friends for the holidays.   I had a couple of pomegranate martinis which were simply delish. Then we split the Kobe Beef Burger appetizer which had this fantastic melt in your mouth flavor accented by a little Swiss cheese and some thin cut crispy salt sprinkled french fries on the side. It was pretty loud in the bar so we weren't able to talk much but, that was fine because we watched an old Sean Connery James Bond film on the flat screens that are mounted on the surrounding walls.  If we go again we are going on Monday because its a buger, fries and a  beer for 7 bucks.

J6VhxG9cLqn2VX-8vheNZg.review_text: I like this place in the afternoon and early evening, before the sharks arrive. And that fresh mango mojito, yummity-yum-yum. Love it. C

9Cwz26G8LHg6kv7ncHSi5Q.review_text: I've been to Harry's a few times now over the years, and it definitely has a certain charm about it.    The space is laid out in a way that allows people to see and be seen very easily, and it always seems people are introducing themselves to strangers (even more so that other Marina-type places, and while sober).   Was there the other night for their burger night special and wasn't disappointed with my meal.  I did think our server was a bit aloof, and she stepped on my foot probably 4 times.    There was a man at the bar that was getting awkwardly unruly, and I thought the staff was very patient with him, handled the situation professionally, and turned it into a non-issue quickly.

A9RKvWz-as6hzSKS_xwVrw.review_text: the three stars is for being walkable distance while under the influence from my place.  i've picked up this bad new habit of drunk emailing people.  nothing sleazy thank goodness.  just lots of random non-sensical symbols like @ or $ sprinkled in.  speaking of drinking, it's that time of year again, and i have to think of a costume for hallowe'en.  i can go in my usual slutty sequin red dress with red sequin horns or the tried and true japanese school girl.  maybe i should go against the grain and just be anti-sexual as a tootsie roll.  last year, some of the girls at harry's were super sexy contruction workers - that or cut off denim shorts and hard hats were in fashion.  it was a mad house there that hallowe'en night but it's a mad house there every weekend.  yeah, it's crowded with people milling and looking.  don't kid yourself that you are just going there for a relaxing drink since the music is usually pretty loud on the weekend.  but it's a little spot to grab a drink and you can decide to watch a little action or be part of it.

x3sWIDL6zJgGHMTfpwi3YQ.review_text: This place is often overrun by loud, obnoxious drunkards who stumble out onto the streets of Pacific Heights hollering all kinds of things nobody cares about and often keeping/waking up the local yocals. Damn you all!

Y5EGRVUhbU8ZsN2xDIsOQw.review_text: Thumbs up:  Monday night burger/drink special.  Fun place to watch a game  Thumbs down: Extremely slow service Way too loud (to Harry's defense, it is a bar, but I hate screaming through dinner on a Monday night)

-ro7OG3jjCSKnF6OJinKjg.review_text: A descent spot for a quick bite.  Friends got the mini-burgers or sliders that were descent. I got the chicken sandwich which was medicore; the fries were delicious and out of this world - killer!  The beer selection of tap was not impressive. I may visit again since there is a killer restaurant opposite the street that serves great steaks.

2ojO4ZImtGy71cMqoKgOQw.review_text: I went here for a happy hour with some friends so I don't know what it is like on the weekends, but I thought it was a decent happy hour choice.  The food looked good and there was plenty of seating.  My mojito, though pricey, were very well made.

a_LyOZavIZzvXrX04Fy4Hw.review_text: Unless you are intimidated by "yuppies", this is one of the top ten bars in the city.  The place has a cool vibe, the food is served til almost two, they play cool movies, there is a good crowd almost every day of the week, and they make good mango mojitos.  You won't find many bars better than this one in san francisco.

KJuTXBW-yET1YwCT-KqgqA.review_text: Limited happy hour selection of beers but the food was good and the service was excellent.   Def will come back some time.

pqymOCOaRwa3Kjh5SGiYXQ.review_text: Come here often with my friends after work or on weekends when our favorite sports teams after playing on TV. There is a wide variety of drinks and beers at moderate prices. It's a casual place and you get to meet interesting people there. Very nice neighborhood bar to hang out.

TppZ9nrqpH3Y9NHmP_8Bbg.review_text: Not bad but not great either.  What can I say... came here last Friday after dinner.  I definitely like this part of Fillmore and Harry's is probably your best bet fo a relatively positive bar experience.  The bartenders are grumpy but service is OK.  The ratio was good the night I was there so definitely some eye candy all around.  The DJ started spinning later on and before long there were a bunch of hot and awkward looking girls gyrating on the teeney tiny dance floor.

zO9Z4y6JbyiMYDplbmUc8Q.review_text: This is one of my favorite neighborhood bars.  Yes it's in Pac Heights but it's absolutely not uptight and snobby.  The crowed is always great, and so are the drinks, the service on the other hand isn't so I would suggest just ordering at the bar.  But I think I have been to this place on every night of the week and during the day and night and it's been great.  The food isn't bad either, they have the regular bar menu, but they also have great burgers and a decent brunch.

fnLwNfsN0MTb87xOquka0Q.review_text: Soul-less bar with above average mac and cheese. Unfortunately, the best among bad options on upper Fillmore.

tIRh_AmxJhUgzoHUBMPnlA.review_text: The first time, I was @ Harry's Bar was last year during the March Madness. I remember it was packed and everyone seems having an awesome time. Rcvd great service & they even let us change the channel.  2 weeks ago, we decided to go to Harry's bar since it is in our neighborhood & they are open on Sunday night (Levende Lounge was closed).   The waitress was pleasant but a bit annoying, she kept butting in abt the bills for our drinks that we have not rcvd yet, that we just literally order. Mr's friend actually grab the bill so she can leave us in peace for 5 min. It was funny, go Justin!  The doorman was good, music wasn't blaring that we can hear other. They have pretty good beer selection & I like their Raspberry Mojito.

zpswu_OyqtF4ib1ydsCR3Q.review_text: Beautiful day and every outside seating is packed except Harrys. Personally I have only been here to drink but they had an open table in the sunshine for us to enjoy. With a crossword puzzle and a diet coke I ordered my lunch.  I got some crazy spicy chicken sandwich thing that was pretty good but fell apart on my about half way through it. Fries OK, but a little cold. Not a bad place to enjoy some greasy food on a sunny day while nursing a hang over from the night before.

mrLLK_E1IXH27EmiAH-iow.review_text: The bartenders were rude jerks! The first drink  i ordered was yummy -a gunpowder martini. But the 2nd one - a cajun martini -was gross.  Bartender was very pissed that I complained - perhaps I am not a cool enough chick to serve. Whatever - for those prices, he should at least have attitude BEHIND my back!

QA5mELGtQwQv78jWlKJ4Iw.review_text: WHAT KIND of sports bar shows a run-of-the-mill 49ers game on it's plasma big screens and then the olympics on it's antiquated small screens?   WHAT KIND of sports bar shows womens olympic marathon running on said small screens when Michael Phelps is about to make HISTORY with his 8th medal at the Beijing games?    WHAT KIND of sports bar tells it's patrons after they specifically ask that it will be showing said competition and then let's it's program director sh*t-the-bed and let it's customers down?    A sports bar like Harry's. That's who.

8bxzx7uNkTKtWu3ZnOdVwA.review_text:
this is the best bar in the world.
  that is, if you enjoy...
  1. waiting on line to get in.
 2. not being able to walk around when you are.
 3. hobnobbing with the finest sheep in the city.
 4. waiting on an even longer line for a beer.
 5. overpaying for it.
 6. not being able to hear the person next to you.
 7. accidentally bump into everyone on the way back to your pack.
 8. eating supbar food.
  like i said, it's the greatest bar in the world.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: they serve beer and alcohol, that's about the only thing this place has going for it on a weekend night. Might be nice during the week, but wouldn't go out of my way to find out...

V0Eq6ZduSgwY0f9Zq0Kvkg.review_text: I have been to Harry's twice. Most recently on New Years Day. They have the BEST bloody marys ever! They will make them as spicy or mild as you want. There bloody mary is perfect was a perfect pick me up appetizer (especially after NYE). This place definitely has the typical bar vibe: loud and crowded. We waited 20 minutes to get seated when we went in for lunch. The food was great. I ordered a mushroom burger with the garlic fries. I've ordered the truffle fries in the past and those are good too. The Macaroni & Cheese was especially yummy. It tasted like the baked type which I LOVE. The cheese was not to cheesy which is always a plus. Just the right amount of pepper. After I finished my bloody mary I got a Mimosa which was made with fresh orange juice. YUM!   The food was not ridiculously expensive and the drinks were great. Would definitly go back.

ApVHbSAnTHvyaqIlvjLreQ.review_text: To be honest, I wanted to walk out as soon as I walked in this place and saw the big Patron Chillin' machine but then I thought to myself, I've been looking to balance out my yelp reviews. Aside from my traumatic bee sting, I've been having a pretty good time  going out these days. And then I walked into Harry's and it was if a star and a half were shining down from heaven and the Yelp angels were softly singing to me. I really had no choice.   First of all, I want to know who decides something on your menu is  World Famous. Because, I'm sorry to say, I highly doubt there is some guy in Italy telling all his friends, "La maria sanguinante alla barra del Harry a San Francisco  e il la cosa migliore nel mondo!" Because I live here and I've had the Harry's "World Famous Bloody Mary".  Let me just say, it wasn't bad but I've certainly had better. Umm - Zeitgeist, The Little Shamrock, Solstice, Ti Cous, my kitchen . . .   The food I had was blah but the eye candy I had wasn't bad. I especially like the touch of the address of the bar branded on our waitresses ass. And the bartender- slash- ballerina- who- ran- out- of material- when- making- her- black tu-tu-so- she - had- to- come- to- work- only- partially- dressed. Well worth the $21 dollars of my hard earned money I spent. No not really, but I got to yelp it so for that alone I give Harry's a star. Since there are no half stars I decided to split the second star between the bloody mary and the staff. I did enjoy myself while I was thinking of all the rude things I could write about them. So that's got to count for something, right?

PMWNrwuvrTwb4robAfoUhw.review_text: Don't know if it was because it was St. Pattie's and the place was busy, but even so that should be no excuse for making the worst cocktails in San Francisco.  I felt sorry for the waitress who dutifully took our drinks back to be remade, and it wasn't her fault so we tipped her.  But, people, how can you screw up a Patron margarita?  And make a Cosmopolitan as syrupy as cough mixture?  Well, the folks at Harry's have it down pat... they've gone a long way (down) since it was our local hot spot back in the '80s.

XCsZ3hWa_6oP1WkWvK7pmg.review_text: Definitely THE BEST Hamburger in SF...I've tried Burger Meister, Burger Joint, Gourmet Burger and Bistro Burger (not all in one week, I promise)...nothing impressed me more than the burgers here.  Harry's is also a fun place to go from work to happy hour...good drinks, fun Fillmore location and great eye candy.  For the ladies, lots of cute, young, financial district yuppies (if you like that type) and for the guys, the cocktail waitresses are smoking hot.

4uUspdcp3TZhIGcD5xHQgg.review_text: I came here for drinks with friends on a Thursday night and had a good time.  Aside from the limited seating area for bar patrons, it was a clean venue with a pleasant crowd.  The deejay was playing radio hits and the bartenders were efficient (I likes).  The drinks were strong and decently priced.  We ordered truffle fries and sweet potato fries - both were delicious.  And, parking in the Fillmore on weeknights is easy!  Great place for drinks, snacks, and hanging out.   Try the fruit martinis!

J3GhokDy-I4GHvpHebc-Eg.review_text: I was expecting some kind of obnoxious frat scene when I visited Harry's, just based on some of these reviews.  What I found was a nice bar with a neighborhood feel to it....on a Sunday night.  What it's like on any other night I can't vouch for.  But this was a nice place to meet up with a "friend" and have a good conversation.  Best black and tan I've had in the city btw.

44c0SsYBiYrI9wORvae2Qg.review_text: Very rood service by the doorman. He insulted my British who was visiting.  We won't be back.

msMZZdFU-ehbvuVPFNXMCA.review_text: Harry's is one of those classic bar/nightclubs that San Francisco severely lacks. It's got great food (Kobe burgers, parmesean truffle fries, big delicious cobb salad), strong classy drinks (infusions, blood orange martinis, fresh fruit mojitos etc.), flat screen TVs and great, loud, classic music.  During the week, Harry's is a perfect neighborhood bar, busy but not packed and a lot of fun. On the weekends it transforms into a bumping nightclub atmosphere where you mingle with attractive people while listening to tunes from the 1950s, 60s, 70s, 80s, 90s and today blasted out of their ridiculous stereo system.   It may not be the best place for artists, hipsters, hippies or anarchists, but if you're young, normal and prefer quality over weirdness, there isn't another bar in San Francisco that is more classic.

60iCXLkb9xqhe5cvEun0kg.review_text: I'm grumbling under my breath as I sit down to write this review.  Grr.  "I can't believe I have to say this AGAIN!", shouts the voice inside my head.  *sigh*  "Alright, dude.  Let's just say it and be done."  ...  This would be a fine upscale joint if it weren't for the clientele.

5cMKYc5kWaZwBgu-PAP48g.review_text: This place is one of the best bars on Fillmore. The bartenders are always friendly and attentive. Food is good bar style food that comes out fast. Good happy hour deals, with great atmosphere.

50W6VKW498OCuH2itdEbfw.review_text: A nice place to grab drinks with friends. They often show movies on their big screens at night. The drinks are generally pretty good. There are comfy bench seats at the tables in the back. It seemed to be louder the last time we went, so it was a bit difficult to have a conversation without shouting into someone's ear.  It was fairly crowded when we arrived, but we got lucky and another group left so we took over their table. They have good french fries and good service.

tQytKpK50qLb5TDZ4qc6HQ.review_text: Cool location.  Bar was clean.  Food was good.  Seating was a little odd.  Drinks not bad.  A little pricey for what it was.  Would return for apps and cocktails only.  Our server was very good.

ZRgVAH3Md-eC2WCJ85C7eg.review_text: Good place to watch a game, or a get a drink earlier in the night.   It gets a bit too loud in here for my personal preference, but it's always crowded so that's just kinda going to be a given.   Drinks are good, and the venue has lots of energy. Given it's close by, I will be back again.

uPqIt_HOnS1itDBt7VolVw.review_text: Refreshing mango mojitos gets 4-stars! Cozy little bar on Fillmore street.  Rather than a place to hang out at all night, it's a good place to end at after a night of bar hopping with friends.  It's relaxing, yet upbeat.

EhIolH5byA5_IO7VVZyAPQ.review_text: Decent bar with a good selection of drinks and food. Nothing special, but good for a quick drink if you're in the neighborhood, I suppose.

i0sCinT5tsi0fgZ7_vF1tQ.review_text: Harry's is pretty nice.  When it's slow...

2ZVl7FC76GUAP3LIGJhP5Q.review_text: It's the dead of winter and you're wandering aimlessly on the Fillmore? Pop into Harry's! You'll warm RIGHT up and when I say right up, I mean damn! Body heat.   The bar is super crowded. I'm petite, so always afraid that people will just step right over me. Haha. Kind of a wait to order anything really. You'll be lucky if there's a seat or better yet, table, open.   The crowd here is a bit older. I'd say the majority of patrons are in their late 20s and up. Lots of "socializing" going on :)  Pretty cool neighborhood bar!

YeHEaQ9GNs2d6FHu93t-sw.review_text: I go here a lot.  Mostly because it's close to work and an easy place to meet up for drinks in the late afternoon.  If you go early you can be lucky enough to get a couch seat by the window and the attention of the waitresses before it starts to get crowded.  But later on, it gets pretty bustling and you might have to wait a while.  Good food, decent wines on the list, and some good cocktails.

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: Love the Burger here. Its one of my favs in the city. I used to love the soups when Chris Provo owned it. Just amazing. I would come just for the soups. But... everything else i have is just down the middle. Nothing to write home about (when there are 2000 other places and 500 do it better). But i do love Harry's on Fillmore, and i really have never had a bad experience here.   Tables are a little small, service is always great. I've never had a bad server here.

m5ssxEA0FTwYpGKi646Rjg.review_text: The place is perfectly acceptable place for happy hour with your co-workers, but not much else.  The food is pretty bland.  Their sliders consist of meat, bread, a slice of lettuce, and a few caramelized onions. Also, they seemed to have somehow missed the fact that nachos should have cheese on them. The gorgeous, but extremely slow bartenders and the bros in checkered shirts ordering expensive drinks while discussing IPOs, can get a bit annoying too. I'd rather go to Toronado and get an awesome local beer than go here again and order an $8 vodka/diet.

disS5oye86976awyFa4Tsw.review_text: Thumbs down.  The crowd is uber-yuppie.  Plus, the place is packed to the brim!  Their decent drinks do not make up for the movie theater-style fake nacho cheese.  When is that okay?!?!  I'll tell you when: never.

0Pd-LScDP0zLf4ShnV8L0Q.review_text: Came here for happy hour and dinner. Not a lot of seating area and service was pretty slow. There was only 2 waitress serving the entire seated section. The burger I got actually came out better than I expected, though still overpriced at $12... $3 draft beers is alright. But 50 cents to refill diet coke? Yikes...

NEOSYsubf7SVeVm8RytxYA.review_text: Luckily for me my friend lives right around the corner to Harry's.  The obvious choice was to go here to have a drink.  Everyone was dressed well.  My friend said she loved their option to have bottomless bellinis so I would suggest going for that.  This place is also great if you want to go on game days.  It's packed! (well...if you like an over-packed and crowded small space)  The sweet potato fries were decent.  I will probably go back again to try the other bar food.  For me, the best part was the alcohol selection.  My two favorite drinks were a raspberrytini( I think it was called this) and a mango mojito! SO GOOD!  Overall,  I just like the vibe of this place.  You can relax on the benches sip on your drink and enjoy some good conversation with friends.  There is a small area in front where you can dance although there aren't too many people that do that.  A downside to this place is the groups of people here seem to only stick with their group.

3vt7CVf2BGd8LJK28qnf1w.review_text: Let's go out after work...and stay all night!  I love coming here in plans of having A drink, but I always end up loving it so much that I stay for 3 or 4 (or 5) drinks.  Positives: + laid back environment with pretty people to look at + several TVs playing sports (no volume) + great music with a good mix of those fun '90s songs we all forget about, but immediately shazam (an app that figures out what song is playing, saves it to your phone, and recommends similar songs) it in order to download later! + decent priced drinks + great food that is perfect for a late night bite  Negatives: - sometimes the music can get really loud which is great for dancing (they have no room for dancing), but not great for conversation - the place gets really packed sometimes and then other times it is extremely dead.  I haven't quite figured out the situation yet!  I went on a Saturday and there were very few people there.  This is definitely a great weekday place to go to when you are looking for a spot to have fun without dancing 'till the sun comes up.

LNRxTQ1-yLdgkBERpP39Vw.review_text: I love Harry's on Fillmore, it's my favorite sports bar and hangout in San Francisco and will always have a special place in my heart. Great place for happy hours, weeknight dinners with friends, and first dates. The crowd is yuppity and sports fanatic - FiDi / Marina / Pac Heights rolled into one.   For years Harry's was the go-to bar and hangout the Wednesday night before Thanksgiving for my group of friends - mostly out of state transplants who don't get to go home.   Their Mango Mojitos are incredibly delicious.

Y-xLcheooB8iOT-Cn6cS0w.review_text: Biggest let down ever. I've heard great things - and yeah, not so much.  The Mango Mojito was the only thing good going on here. My girlfriend and I were not so impressed - the food was awful.   My suggestion - come here for the happy hour drinks only, go somewhere more formidable for food.  EDIT: yeah, after some thought and more discussion, friend & I said, nay...one star.

ZwajQ8J4F2lHR8Wqa1wPWg.review_text: This is a pretty cool bar. I went there with a few friends. We were pretty boozed up when we got there but had a great time. Nice bar for a  few drinks. Not much of an ass-factory. But a chill place to have a few drinks and bullshit around.

h5rNyEHyQnqS9EEf2-jHMg.review_text: Service is atrocious. It is so bad that it is truly not worth going here.   Appetizers and bar food (burgers, fries, etc) are good, but with how long you have to wait for everything, its not worth it.  They keep changing the beers on tap, too, so you can't rely on this bar to have what you want.   I would not return here

Ha4mOL_9JtmYgn7NvrAu6A.review_text: Only 4 beers on tap. Lots of brahs. Loud as fuck.  I think I would have probably liked this place better if I was out with my friend Lana. She is a loud bitch. I think she would have fit right in. Especially if she was wasted. And I was wasted.  This place, while has that solid wood decor that I love so much, has little to no character to carry it into the fame it seems to have.  +1 star for the burger. That WAS a tasty burger

rH-vpn7e0_JUNMR06JfolQ.review_text: Great place for drinks and food!  Always a fun atmosphere.  Always packed with people and they offer a dj on some nights.  Mostly female bartender staff with the exception of one guy.  Gotta Try: Nachos Kobe Burgers Buffalo wings  Cons: Parking!!!!  But once found, let the fun begin.

6a8XHypxGwNTRWqtqQsylQ.review_text: What a great place to end up with a large group of friends! After receiving a noise complaint due to our housewarming party, we were forced to take our party elsewhere at 1AM. Fortunately, Harry's Bar is only three blocks from our place. Nice! Came here to dance and drink with close friends - success was met. Drinks can get pricey, but our low calorie vodka soda for $6.50 was totally worth it. Good times!

KqWg7ANbB3QKkNXM4lVA-Q.review_text: Kick ass french fries. The best I've had. 'Nuff said. I didn't even know this was a bar. Those fries mesmerized me....

qZmAcUcbp4Q9l7NO4IcGSw.review_text: i actually ate at harry's last night right after watching the OT saints vs.  vikings game.  this place gets crowded, esp. around game time.  the food is decent.  organic mac and cheese with bacon is pretty good.  the burger was OK, nothing special about it.  they have the regular bottles and beers on tap.  i usually go for a mango mojito...they don't really muddle the fruit and mint, so i dont know if it's authentic.    it was surprising to find acme bread buns and other organic items on the menu.  that was a plus...

eCcjxh8zjAqn-kZVWZ_HJQ.review_text: Good place for mojitos and hitting on older doctor men who frequent this place after work at one of the many medical buildings in pac heights.  The staff is attentive, but in a way that would be annoyingly perky if you weren't so hammered off of their $8-10 drinks.

smopSnmeEzhRU34cans8Cg.review_text: Had a good previous experience so we came back with the whole family for some food and football..  Yes I understand it is a Sunday and is busy but there is really no reason to be straight up rude to customers- unwelcoming.   Went with the grilled cheese and tomato soup which sounded really appealing. Except that my grilled cheese looked like it was from Friendly's/a snack bar and was bland. My sisters thought the soup lacked flavor also.  Sister and dad really liked the French toast and bellini's...  May be back for football/drinks but not food.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: I love this place. They have THE BEST cocktails aka what I call the "non-alcoholic alcoholic drinks". They are well known for their burgers. Unfortunately I can only vouch for the veggie burger, which was mighty tasty due to the fact that their bun is what makes the burger...THE burger. Their shoe string fries that come on the side are perfect. We split a Cesar salad which could have been great other than the fact that the lettuce was brown and yellow and looked like it was sitting out for 4 days.   Come here on a week night when its semi-slow to enjoy cocktails. Come here after the brunch/lunch crowd and enjoy their food. Parking is tough since its all metered on Fillmore, but try the side streets.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: I've loved Harry's since way back when Harry Denton still actually owned it. It can get pretty packed, and that can slow down the table service, but it's still a great place for throwing down a few drinks in a conversation-friendly setting.

U3kGnWVUF4ToTtWqILKj_g.review_text: Had soo much fun at Harry's watching our San Francisco Giants glide into the World Series.  The place was PACKED! I don't know how she did it by my cocktail waitress was awesome!! I never had an empty drink. I was also able to chow down on some of there buffalo wings. yum yum soo delicious! I will for sure be back there this week for the World Series.

kxfER3_UPODx2k2XvdpHUQ.review_text: ok, how hard is it to get staff that dont think they are better than everyone else and can actually do their job? my wife and i went for lunch yesterday, we didnt see our waitress for 15 minutes. when she arrived she had the "what now?" expression on her face. we ordered drinks and didnt see those or her again for another 15 minutes. then she left without taking our food order. 10 minutes later ( she was talking to some friends by the bathroom) she walked past and we asked if we could order, again the "what now?"  look. the soup (chicken was great, big lumps of meat, the chicken quesadilla was ok, and the caesar salad was terrible. we tried to get out asap but couldnt track down our server for another 10 minutes, talking with friends again. she walked around with such an attitude and false sense of superiority that you can expect from a marina /pac heights wannabe. get over yourself bitch.

vWpe19iYR30nE8JvBtjwKg.review_text: Cheapest and best spot to get a burger on Monday nights.  That's all folks.

Nc4uWHBuFF407t3MzX0tOg.review_text: Definitely a fun bar... but nothing else. The food is preeettty poor -(I have recently been disappointed with the food on Filmore street in general).  Anyway, a good spot for March Madness right now, lively crowd.

ljDGi7gFqD3BZ6dVGleULw.review_text: Just go straight to the truffle fries.  They are crispy, salty and amazingly delicious!

muPKUHFQnK5_G55k48Avkw.review_text: Simply judging based on the bar and the clientele they are catering to, Harry's Bar succeeds wildly.   I've never gone inside at night, but it's a great spot during the day for an overpriced burger and a cold beer. The day bartenders are sweethearts, too.

ZX6c8p2IlbdhdNnM-vREJQ.review_text: Beautiful,classy, old school bar without attitude or being stuffy.  Hood used to be part of Fillmore now called "Lower Pac Heights"  Through all the gentrification this has been here and I can always find it busy with friendly cool staff. Perfect Monday,a kick-ass burger,french fries and a cold Stella draft all for 8 bucks!!! And that was 11pm where most of the city is closed.  Weekends are crowded and jumpin' like a good bar should. Don't think I'm a yuppie and I know I ain't white, but I feel comfortable and have a good time here.  Like any place I hang I find a lot of very cool people and a few I  avoid.

x6Ovhm9vHlFI_WYXttaBww.review_text: I have a friend who lives nearby so he always wants to meet here.  I'm not a fan, especially on weekends because it gets crowded and there always seems to be lots of dudes...older dudes.  Wait, maybe we're becoming those dudes.  I also dislike the layout.  There's a big wall and an elevated section for dining.  I guess people also dine here during the day but the place is too narrow to be set up that way.  Anyway, it's not all bad.  We've caught a few games here and the drinks are stiff.  I just hope he eventually moves.  Maybe next time I'll suggest we go old school and just buy 40s and drink behind the 7-11.

_A1j_dfBlJw7i9uGz3zdQQ.review_text: Lost:  Marina bar.  Known to be very confused and could be wandering the streets of any neighborhood, trying its best to find a home.  Answers to "Harry".  Favors your business, but would never, ever comp you a round, and is armed with a solar-powered perpetual employee filtration system to ensure you'll never learn the name or face of it's servers.      Harry's preferred company includes frat boys, loudmouth bitches, and general street trash.  The confusion that has resulted from aimless wandering has provoked weekly assaults of awful freestyle rap.  If you get close to Harry on a Thursday night, be cautious and always protect your ears.  Do not approach Harry alone, as you may experience drunk text messages, booty calls, icky rashes, or mojito vomits.      Last seen taking drinks from patrons at 5 minutes to two in a low-cut shirt.    If seen, please return directly to the Marina.  Drop entire bar and its contents in water at Pier 39 and back up slowly.   Dust palms with anti-microbial gel and bust a reach-around.  Pat yourself on the back.     That is your reward.

Zm_rwvcqZTlAupUBI7lctw.review_text: Spent Happy hour here yesterday.  Ordered slider burgers, Nachos, Sweet Potato fries and chicken tacos.  All were pretty good.  Selection of draft beer is on the weak side.  Atmosphere was comfortable.

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: We came here on new years day and managed to still pick up some douche bag from the night before who wouldn't stop waving at us and offering to buy us shots at 10 am...ON NEW YEARS DAY!! The thought alone made me want to hurl, any who....  OK back to Harry's...Harry's was super crowded and after about two hours of waiting we never got a table, but we did get some pretty kick ass Bloody Marys. The Bloody Mary had just the right amount of spice and pickled veggies to aid in the hangover from the night before, despite the douche bag guy next to me trying to throw tequila shots down my throat.  I have to try Harry's again when it is not New Years day and hopefully I will get seated.

FgBx3WFYm7R-T_sSp2XK7g.review_text: this place only gets 2 stars because it has some sort of alcohol and its in a decent neighborhood.  i did order a shot of jwb, and it was a good size pour.  other than that avoid at all cost because:  1. 'fool' of tools 2. the food they sell is overpriced, and its comparable to cafeteria sludge 3. 1 effen toilet, and men if there is one toilet, please dont leave the toilet seat down, thats fucken disgusting (and im a guy) 4. and for jebus' sake this is san francisco, you can find a better bar than harrys at any stone throw away

wb7dTyHrAWDKve5uQigEig.review_text: I had a  weekday lunch there. The prices seemed reasonable and it has a very cozy atmosphere. I ordered the Kobe burger, which came with fries and a drink. Unfortunately my hamburger tasted like it was cooked the day before and warmed up for me. It was dry and tasteless. I haven't been back.

svc3God_xoH4C1Yfpyvc9g.review_text: I have been to Harry's bar several times on weekends and it is always packed. The crowd waiting outside speaks about the bar. My favorite time is to go here for brunch on Sundays (I have never been here on a night so I will save that review for later). The atmosphere is great. Waiter/ waitress are nice. I forgot the name of the bartender with tattoos but she is funny, in a good way.  Their bloody marys are awesome. You can order regular or spicy and get exactly what you want (I mean literally. I prefer regular). The other drinks are okay to try, they have specials. The food is great too. You may bump into some wasted girls, but after a few bloody marys whom do you blame.  Overall I give four stars for this place, only cas there is always a wait time on weekends.

K5as-hBg2K4oAP-J54iX3w.review_text: Pacific Heights meets sports bar: white table cloths, good food, good looking patrons (of the pacific heights set), even better drinks and big T.V.s.

vsSzUpUa6PuMfzL8LgVDNA.review_text: Short n  sweet. Pretty dope little place. Went there on a Friday and it got pretty packed.  Have a decent happy hour although I arrived to late for that and food is amazing.  Got to try some nachos and the mozzarella sticks are happiness!  Its basically eating a grilled cheese in fried stick form with a creamy tomato soup dipping sauce. But this should also tell you something about the bar that I was more stoked on the food than it being a bar.

IcgPERDRsDNn0wZsOkGvcQ.review_text: Yay! I'm a fan. But only because of the bottomless bellinis on Sunday while watching football. It's not really a sportsbar but they get all the NFL games on Sunday and get a majority of sports on other days/nights.   The food is pretty good, but the prices aren't cheap enough to where it is any kind of a deal. I've ordered burgers mainly, which are good, and came here on a Saturday morning all hungover and got the waffles which hit the spot with a nice fat screwdriver straight to my dome.   They have bottomless bellinis most sundays, but if you stop ordering food they will cut you off. Once you are cut off, you are normally drunk enough that you will fly into a fit of rage and curse Harry's Bar. I will still come back once football season comes around though.  The bartenders and servers are usually pretty pleasant, and one of the bartenders makes for good conversation, mostly between yourselves when you debate whether her boobs are real or not. Clearly they are not real, and my friend tom is an idiot for thinking they are. If they were real, I possibly would have given this place 5-stars, but sadly it is destined for 4.   Oh yeah and I destroyed their toilet, went back in an hour or two later to destroy it again, and it was clean. So the janitorial crew is top notch.

RFuMyqihKYlTKx8SNAjrVw.review_text: Got here as the meeting point before deciding what to do for dinner.  Based on the fact that it was 7pm and PACKED, I can only come up with these reasons as to why that might be the case:  a. Everyone else had the same idea we had, and that was to treat the place as the go-to before the evening's REAL go-to;  b. People really go here as a destination of absolute fantasticness on a Saturday night and we were just 1. too early tor 2. too lame to see that the potential for a fist-bumping night of Jersey Shore sweat-dancing was yet to rear its ugly head; or  c. The March Madness madness on the boob tube was enough to get people there in droves on an otherwise slow Saturday night.  One drink guzzled and we were on to the next.  I likely would not seek it out again unless I lacked ingenuity and needed a likely before...the after.

eZbcmXsKnruoFmUdsMi8gg.review_text: Four stars for half bottles of wine on Tuesday!   Other than that, I have no idea.

Whwoc85UbMy0NqyhNl5nfQ.review_text: I gave this place two chances - I have officially declared it rife with douchebaggery.  Between the frazzled bar and waitstaff, the lackluster food and the general 'dude-bro' sentiment of the clientele, I don't think I'll be going again.

i6VsRRDAGf7323VW0BUx-A.review_text: Sorry, Harry's but only one star.  Many that talk about your poor customer service are right...  A frequent visitor in SFO I was looking for a comfortable bar to watch a monday night football game.  But my experience was... well strange.  After reading the reviews on YELP I walked the mile up Pine to Filmore and found Harry's to be a nice, clean bar with a nice crowd.   However I spent 30 minutes in the bar area, and was unable to order a drink!   Finally I got a waitress to stop and asked her, what is the secret to ordering a beer here?  I was just across from the bar area.  She said she could not help me, I needed to get the Bartender.  Well I had been staring at the bar tender, no drink in hand, for over 15 minutes.  She saw me but would not come over.  I asked the waitress if she could summon a manager, so I could politely explain the difficulties I was experiencing, but she said there was no manager available.  I stood around for around 5 more minutes, then walked to the end of the bar.  Flagged down the bartender who had been ignoring me, expressed my displeasure (politely) and left.  No drink, no hamburgers, nothing but a two mile walk.  Luckily Harry's is not the only bar in town and I found another spot to enjoy the game.

UDDAYVY1Iif10lpogHB_SQ.review_text: So Cookie, the roomie, has been raving non-stop about this "neighborhood bar" that he loves so much. So on St. Patty's Day we decide to stop in on our way home from the rowdy crowd at the FiDi block party.   We walk in, it's a dimlit bar with The Big Lebowski playing on the flat screen TVs. Hmm...that should say enough. I'm not a Big Lebowski fan and as I looked around, people were quoting the movie all around me. DEFINITELY not my scene.   They DID however have an eccletic mix on the music, mixing between Kenny Rogers one second and moving onto a little Ludacris or 50 cent the next minute...Hmm...interesting. I guess it's got a little for everyone, eh?  It's fun to people watch there. They have these great little booths along the walls so you can face the people and just watch, point, laugh, criticize, do whatever the hell you damn well please.   I saw some people getting served up some food but I wasn't really close enough to see what they got or if it looked delectable or not. *shrug*  Maybe next time. Yeah, it's a cool watering hole , but I'll definitely leave this one to Cookie....it's ALL yours buddy!  3 Yummerz stars...

ml3vS1NZTMeXTuxamvAZgw.review_text: This is my neighborhood bar.  I drop in anywhere from 1-3x/month.   The food is decent (Good burger; decent cobb salad).  The drinks are 50/50 ("That's alot of ice in my small glass missy.")  The service is average, but easy on the eye.  Prices are about 15% too high.  The management is making a killing and has weird rules pertaining to weight, attire, and various other policies for the staff.  If you're looking for a good hangout spot to watch some sports, this will suffice.  They also show movies with naked boobies every now and then, giving the place a HS teenager feel.  Personally,  I prefer the '60s surfer, classic James Bond or Elvis movies.  And my favorite bartender just moved over to Solstice Restaurant and Lounge (which is a crappy bar, but OK restaurant).  Damn.  Overall, I wish my neighborhood had more bars.

eBnToKDLoXxQvpwY6s5UdQ.review_text: only been on a Monday  for their burger deal...great Monday deal....burger...fries...and a drink...woo hoo!   boo..on charging for diet coke refills....

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: This bar just looks like a "Harry's". It doesn't really deserve the crowd it gets, and I'm intrigued by all the reviews that say 'ex frat boys' patronize the place. When you think about it seriously, Frat is for life, sort of like herpes. I don't mind it though, I've been here on unemployed sunny weekdays when I'm shopping on Fillmo for sexy underpants and stinky soap. Perfect  for an afternoon lunch & a beer or glass of wine.

C7OKvBYjMzEr81l1u2drYg.review_text: This is the best bar for Niner games in the area, but all of it has to do with the crowd and very little to do with the bar.  Their biggest tv isn't in HD (first world problem, I know, but it's a bar, c'mon), and of the few good seats in the place you'll have a creak in your neck by halftime.  The food is ok (my kobe sliders were raw in the middle, not pink, but raw), except for maybe the truffle fries.  The service is also pretty good for the amount of people and the number of servers they had. Back to my original point, this is an awesome place for a Niner game, everyone is so pumped about every play and most people here don't seem like bandwagon fans, like other sports teams in the area.    Check it out if you're a Niner fan, but make sure to show up early, since seats are limited.  Also, don't bring your kids, there's a 21 and up sign at the door and some people swear like sailors there.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: I've finally figured it out.    It only took me a couple of visits to realize that this is my fave bar in Pac Heights.    Harry's doesn't EVER have a cover, even on Friday and Saturday nights when they have  a DJ spinning a mix of Top 40's, 80's, house, etc.   Parking is so easy to find, there's usually a couple of spots open right in front of the bar or a block away.  Taxis pass by here all the time.    Their drinks are on the pricey side between $8-$10 for cocktails.  You get a better deal on weekdays with their $5 cocktail specials.  (usually the lychee-pineapple martinis or a cosmo). The bartenders are quick on their feet.  It's poppin here on Saturday nights but on Fridays, you can actually snag a seat and have room to move around.   Harry's is not the type of bar you'd go to pick up girls.  (believe me, our friend tried his hardest!)   The chill vibe with its wooden bar and old charm makes this a tried and true gathering spot for friends who you've known for a long time. Whether it's for a birthday happy hour or boy issues my girls and I need to bitch about, Harry's will continue to be my go to watering hole.

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: I love Harry's simply because it's an institution.  It's a great place to grab a drink before dinner in the neighborhood.  And apparently it's also a favorite hangout to watch sports in the eve...    Friendly-looking yuppies.  And no stripey shirts as far as I saw.  More suits and baseball caps.  :)

MFsVuyCATawEvqyBk5zzng.review_text: Yucky nachos with that Taco Bell fake Velveeta cheese.  For 9 bucks you would think they could spring for cheddar.

TMWgq3KNRDaESXs8ZCrRtA.review_text: I've been here several times on several separate occasions.  Its ALWAYS packed.  They have pretty yummy cocktails and pretty good burgers.  I'd say 3 stars for that.    However its always packed and most of the time I'm not into that.  There are a lot of good looking people too, but its a bit scene-y.  I took my recently single girlfriend here and that was perfect for her.    However, I'm not looking for that so most times its not number one on my list.

H-SorZ3paKxfZhWSygfk7Q.review_text: Ugh, should have read and believed the reviews about the douchebaggery in here. Calling all douche bags?!! Yea tried getting a table for three of us for about 40 minutes, sat another 30 without a waiter in sight. Left and went down the street to Roam for some good food but had to inhale it to make it to our concert at the Fillmore.  Never again, oblivious staff, horrible environment of people and lots of crazy drunk girls at 6pm. Not my scene

BBSYyLG824fZjP-kulhLgw.review_text: Food is great, service isn't.   Waitress wasn't friendly and took forever to take our orders, bring (1) drink over, bring the food, check on us, and bring the bill. She didn't even pretend to care.

AHz3sGxkZjAzv8uu0Q9hqg.review_text: On July 30th, 2009, my girlfriend and I decided to share some drinks.  Overall, I don't think that I'll ever go back.   We decided to skip the food, as most of the menu options was akin to greasy pub-food and a bit overpriced in my opinion.    The atmosphere isn't anything really special.  It is loud and I must admit that the clientele is college/immediately post college crowd.  There is nothing really sophisticated about this bar..and it isn't exactly divey and it isn't necessarily a sports bar...SO CONFUSING...It is what it is and admittedly, it isn't my type of place.  What really disappointed me was the service. We went right after work and pre-cinema to grab a QUICK drink and the place was not full and there seemed to be a few waitresses standing around, but it took us 20 minutes to get served.  No thanks.  Not again.
