fneHq3SU3qu0JKzwfKtt7A.review_text: In years gone by, true lovers of drinking and dining had to make an arduous decision of whether they would spend the evening watching football in the dive sports bar with the Coors Light flags hanging from the ceiling or seek true ambiance in a classic saloon with a great mirror behind the bar engulfed in the richest of dark woods.  Here at Harry's you have the best of both worlds; a classic style set up that reminds us of the days of your when San Francisco was the beacon under the Golden Gate with a modern accent of flat screen plasmas to enjoy age-old physical competition.  We sat at the bar and capitalized on the Monday night special of a burger and a beer for $9, which is a steal in this day and age.  The bartenders were beautiful and accommodating women and I was happy throughout my experience.  Although I might be able to see how service can get difficult in such crowds at times, I am incredibly easy to please.  So as long as there is good food and beer complemented by basic amenities such as dark woods and plasma screens, what's not to be happy about?

1Idc35tGsgkB3G2ntig0LA.review_text: Still somewhat buzzed from my two Fat Tires, here is what I think:  Mac and cheese was a little too soupy, but otherwise tasted good.    Bartenders were great!  Despite the other reviews, there were no date prospects for my friend.

BGHdDra4uLCpIqTLOorNRw.review_text: Ah, Harry's. I actually no longer know Harry's as "Harry's" per se, now it's just the "meat market." The meat market is good for a Saturday afternoon cocktail and burger. And that's it. Unless you want to get picked up on by some guy in a cheesy shirt from Wisconsin who has recently relocated to the Marina.

Zl1fJNTzNULZiqBRShxUYA.review_text: I started coming to this place to watch Notre Dame football games when they're on cable only (I don't have cable).  Then my roommate took the TV with him, so I had to go somewhere to watch every Notre Dame game.  It was a horrible season, and I would go directly to Harry's after working my twelve-hour overnight shift, but the bartenders at Harry's made everything a little less painful.  The food is pretty good, especially for a bar.  I would not dream of stepping foot in here during a weekend night, but it's a decent place to watch a college football game.  All of the Saturday-morning bartenders are super friendly, and I've really got to hand it to them because if I were a girl and worked here I wouldn't be nice to anyone, especially the seventeen guys an hour who try to be subtle in hitting on them.  Oh, and I almost snagged a free TV and DVD player out of all of this too; the nicest bartender was getting rid of hers and offered to give them to me for free.  My roommate ended up procuring a TV, but I owe a lot to Harry's anyway.

83rE2clgBCRWx1trtlaong.review_text: The Mac and Cheese is beyond amazing. The DJ is always willing to play whatever music is requested, the drink specials are killer and the enviornment is always full of fun people, and a great place to people watch. Regular drinks are a little pricey, but the specials they run are worth it. I love their martini's because they use real fruit when mixing.  Their kitched closes at midnight, but really they start closing it down at 11:30 - so make sure you're there before to order. I swear by their Mac and Cheese

ubbh74uR_FVEEcr3I6gpdw.review_text: love the music at this place. no dancing though. i wish there was a dance floor. i don't think the mojitos are strong at all and a lil too sweet and i LOVE sweet drinks. the pineapple lychee martini is yum. sound familiar? very familiar to Bruno's in the Mission cause this place is by the same people, but very different scene.  thumbs up: seating areas, great music, friendly staff thumbs down: drinks are $$$

Nq6IDrsjcwAZTB0SPp7K9A.review_text: I dig this bar. Always an interesting crowd. Thursdays is a great night to go because its not to crowded but its packed enough to be entertaining and to possibly meet someone knew...or find a table for you and your friends.   You'll see the locals....regulars...newbies....and it has a casual vibe, yet you won't feel weird if you just busted in from work in your suit and tie either.

DTuIKc9P8kLpOwqlaj9nEg.review_text: I think I might just be getting old - but this place is way too loud for me!

aOxFSXUEvy1cuSw7wfiJwA.review_text: Dude, I can't believe I've eaten and drank here umpteen times and still had not bothered to Yelp it.  Well, folks, here I am.  And yes - it's a solid 5 stars.  Yes, there are times when it gets crowded, rowdy, and 17-yr-old-little-brother annoying.  BUT if you're in the right mood, it works!  (It better work...it's the only bar we are currently graced with in the immediate hood.)  But I want to focus this review on the burgers, though.  Especially on Mondays.  These are some of the best burgers in the city, let alone in the neighborhood.  Always fresh, always statisfying, always perfect.  The fries are great too.  Go on a Monday...burger and a beer for $9; it's a perfect deal.  Can't go wrong with the Route 66 (bacon, cheese, BBQ sauce), the Killer Kobe or the Fillmore.  Hell, you can't go wrong with any of them (Jason B. loved his turkey burger).  This is a very common meeting spot for catching up with old friends.

tDWr9QfVH1-phUEjCGYglA.review_text: I loved this place. Great for a friday night or happy hour. .

LKcFo8BfF0EyrhP6wb5Uow.review_text: Hold a beer in your hand or cocktail or else the waitress will ask you to leave.   I explained to her that I tried getting a drink at the crowded bar, then I ask her if I can order one from her, she told me to get it at the bar.

ZSuJDWTYHlbiD5vdPhJEzg.review_text: Nice, reliable place to go with a group - food is decent.

L2uIVVgoODNLj16V2U1eCg.review_text: The price list is laughable, and the crowd is all 21-23 it seems. Mixed drinks are bad, music is sub-par (but MUCH better on weekends with the DJ than similar-feel Elixir).  On the plus side, good menu (but the idea of Kobe Beef sliders is just too precious for any amount of respect regardess of how good they might be) and a nice tap selection. Also, it's usually possible to find a place to sit even when busy in a short amount of time (maybe people are wising up?)  It gets a little personal extra star from me though because the back bar, a Brunswick I think, is a mass produced model that was also installed (without the painting on the mirrors) at Henry's, the only decent bar in the entirety of my home town.

vsaHsatoJrQjChsprt4Kxg.review_text: why is this poser place always so crowded; and they don't even have guiness!  if they do, i don't see the tap.  whole lot of yuppie posers and wannabe cool hipsters--so fake; to put it kindly. LOL.  Bubble Lounge would be a better place for these phonies.  Go to Irish Bank or Royal Exchange where the crowd is better and the bartenders/wait staff are actually decent human beings; unlike Harry's where the wait staff can take a puff of my chinese sausage.

A6QxREcT6k2goutnVemBpA.review_text: This bar is the only bar that is walking distance from my apt, so i am a bit biased.  I think the Kobe burgers are the fajita chicken sandwich are excellent.  Everything else on the food menu is kind of mediocre.  The drinks are a bit overpriced, but what do you expect in Pacific Heights.  I only order beer when i go here, so the overpriced drinks don't affect me that much.  However,  they do make good mojitos and a good sidecar.  The reason I give this bar 4 stars instead of 3 is because the service is great.   The bartenders and waitstaff are super friendly and very efficient (especially considering the non-ideal layout of the restaurant).  If you go in more than twice, they will know your name and remember your drink.  The decor is nice with a large mirror over the long mahogany bar.  They also have 5 large flatscreens for watching sports.  Great for MNF.  This is a great bar for 30 somethings, a little more sophisticated than other pubs and definitely not the Marina.

FAeIsKkBeXvpQpj6Zc29iQ.review_text: i came here *just* so i could yelp it ... kidding ... or am i? anyway, while i was expecting to have a one or two star experience here, i ended up having a great three star one on a thursday night with coworkers.  i'm usually not one for bars and this sounded like it might be similar to the royal oak or something so i didn't go in with high expectations.  but four mango mojitos into the night, i was all about harry's  our server girl did a great job of keeping the drinks coming and she had on cute pants to boot.  although i suspect she padded that thing (to avoid getting her real butt pinched by drunken pervs) because i've never seen a white girl with such a bulbous bootie (bulbous in a good way).

6Sh7IvHpEeR48MZ4dhqysg.review_text: Stumbled across Harry's looking for a good Bloody Mary. Had the Hot Cajun and it was absolutely amazing. Brunch was good as well. I had the chilaquiles and they were pretty filling. The place was packed (people were packing the place to watch the Niner game) so there was no place to sit inside so we settled outside. There were 4 of us. It was not very comfortable, but understandable. My only complaint is that I asked for something to wipe down the table before our food came, not once, not twice, but three times and the waitress never brought anything so I had to wipe it down as best as I could with my napkin.

TMLVzNYs-zwwREudyvI08A.review_text:
So this bar is in my 'hood, yet I had never checked it out until last night (wed).
  Disclaimer: I must preface this short review by saying that I was already feeling pretttty good from an extended happy hour by the time that I made it over there. Perhaps this skewed my impression, heh.
  First, the food was good, solid bar food. No complaints.
  The service was fantastic.  The drinks and food came out fast and the bartender was very friendly. On a side note, I believe I now have a huge crush on the blonde bartender with black glasses. Note: see above disclaimer.
  The crowd was good as well. I was surprised to see so many people out on a wed.
  Seeing as though this place is walking distance from my house, shame on me for not going sooner.
  I'm not sure how it is on the weekends, but I would recommend to anyone who lives in the area for an after work drink.

lVx8RemQeZRIqme6NPPaJw.review_text: Music too loud. That's why people leave.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Good burgers, crappy fried mozzella, and mediocre beers on tap.  This place is always packed every night.  Why?  No idea.  Everyone here is 40 years old.

sbgQVK0ObJtxJ5BZOceHfg.review_text: Oh Harry's, what can I say? I've blacked out at your place, been to multiple Niners/Giants games here, have had Sunday fundays here, done champagne brunches here, have come here for drinks before and after dinner, have come here when I'm in a bad mood, etc etc etc. Harry's never fails in any aspect. Honestly, you won't go wrong. It's a very great go-to bar located on the Fillmore, and it stays open till 2 am. I've literally been here on Monday nights till the very end and have had a blast. The drinks are reasonably priced (it's a full bar), and there's a ton of comfortable boothes/couches all throughout the place. For Sunday champagne brunch, you can get unlimited bellinis flowing in till 3pm I believe, and the menu is yummy, especially the mac n cheese. The baked chilaquiles is probably my favorite brunch menu - very very good. It gets pretty packed on game days and during brunch, so make sure you come early or make a reservation. I love this place!!

ZRvPkOOMp0pjM07ICKQswA.review_text: i finally found my blue cheese stuffed olives to make the perfect dirty martini!!!   usually when i ask the bartender for said olives i get a strange look in return, but with out batting an eye the bartender said "yep- you want a martini?" so awesome   the scene was casual, typical bar food menu, looked good but we didn't order.. the martini was a good appetizer.  I will definitely be returning for my martini and food soon!

CCXniyeQdXOTw-_rda_skQ.review_text: From the outside it looks like just another bar, but inside it's plush and inviting.  The best times to come are right after work and during the middle of the day.  When it's crowded in here it's not that great because the area in front of the bar is too narrow and there isn't anywhere to really stand.  It can also get extremely noisy inside.  The hamburgers are good and the servers are quick and cheerful.  The outside tables are great for a sunny day of beer and people watching in the Fillmore.  Can't wait to come back to try their bloody mary.

UVxY0iyPaqY7s4BSFtt-xA.review_text: This is my old watering hole, when I used to live 3 blocks away off California several years ago. Been here many times back then and revisit it occasionally, even recently.   You'd think it might be a touristy bar, or daytrippers from the bridge and tunnel crowd, what with the many restaurants in the FIlmore corridor and the little shops nearby. Or at least filled with lovely hotties since Betsy Johnson is across the street, and the Shu Uemura salon down the block.  But it is really mostly a neighborhood bar, and mostly a sausage fest.  The crowd is mostly 30 somethings, with a sprinkle of 20 something drunk dickheads in suits about 5 years out of college time wise, but still in the Fraternity behavior wise. And there is a smattering of 40, even 50 somethings, even a couple of older people who hopped across the street from The Elite cafe, or the Grove next door, or Jackson Filmore up the street. The crowd is mixed but mostly White, mostly relaxed, and usually friendly.  The bar is a great, grand wood bar, related to the famous Harry's Bar in Italy. Harry Denton opened this place decades ago, back when he was the hottest thing in SF bar making, with Harry Denton's Club and the Starlight Room in addition to this place.  They have added several large flatscreens for sports. They used to squeeze in a jazz trio on the weekends, not sure if they still do. They offer some exotic Martinis, and they do serve food. But most people come here only for the meat market aspects of the place, not the meat on a platter.   They still have the elevated table seats for dining, and the classic long counter between the tables and the bar, which is the optimal place to walk through on a busy night to get maximum Eyeball time and Tactile feedback from the crowd seated and standing in the narrow ally.  Service people are friendly and professional. Drinks aren't a complete rip-off. Bartenders are efficient and hustle.   Come here some time and you might get lucky. I know I have.

vhTeEFTQdMiY-bC13v-C8w.review_text: Believe me, I'm not looking for another frat party, but this place has awesome burgers, and I happen to be a connoiseur.  It has nothing on In N Out, but their pre-5:00 burger, fries, and drink is quite a steal for this self-described "posh" neighborhood (puhlease).  Their bar is pretty to look at, but the drinks leave much to be desired....i.e. alcohol.

ak3rCvTc6zjQXUhHMvBS6w.review_text: There are two places I go for Bloody Marys in the City, and Harry's is one of them.  In 2006 when I lived in the neighborhood I got to know Harry's because this is where I watched the World Cup.  The servers are so friendly, down to earth despite how crazy, crowded this place gets on weekends.  The food is consistently awesome...especially Kobe! sliders and fries.

d9-gK7AZJSh-G1wVa9WOwA.review_text: not my scene.   especially on a friday night when it was packed  & so loud i had to talk a couple of decibals higher!  like it much more earlier in the day like 2pm - 5pm, when there's less people.  its much mellower.  but still not my scene.......  do like to come here once in awhile for some mango mojito or some flavored martini (chinese hawaiian martini).  fun, sweet cocktails & pretty good reasonably priced pub faire (burgers, fish 'n chips, fries). like the nice comfy bench seating along the wall.     initially fell in love w/ their mango mojito (last year).  they had huge chunks of mangos -- YUMMEE!!! but just went there last week & the mango pieces are so much smaller.  so am disappointed w/ my last mango mojito.  so i just ask my hub to make one for me when i'm craving a fruit mojito.  my hub makes an AMAZING, hands down THE BEST mango mojito or peach/nectarine mojito w/ huge sweet juicy fruit chunks inspired by harry's bar mango mojito from last year.  will need to try a different cocktail next time.

nmt15twJ_mWvC5brJpswPw.review_text: Douche central. Went on a Friday night and it was a lot of SoCal looking bros in Hollister hoodies and big tables of falling down drunk girls. Waitresses were pretty unfriendly and we got bumped into a few times by people who literally needed to be helped to walk. Miss!!! Random combo of sports bar and pick up scene. I don't get what all the fuss is about.

aoTnCXg4_sllZxNJeTDHAA.review_text: I can't speak for the food at Harry's Bar, as I was too busy drinking their tasty cocktails to even think of ordering any.  The bar itself is like an upscale sports bar - dark wood, low lights, tastefully placed flat screens. As for the cocktails, here are some recommendations: - The Chinese Hawaiian  - Cucumber Gin Gimlet.  - Barbary Bourbon Iced Tea  - Harry's Bar Bellini

5XO4iBD2JlZIoym9fDMV6A.review_text: Sunday Funday afte a rough basketball game. Was tired and wanted t grab a drink with some friends.   Started with some goose chilled and calamari. Split the club, and mac and cheese and washed down with a greyhound.   The food was good. Calamari was ok, but the mac and club were delish and well sized.They greyhound was perfect and fresh squeezed.... yahoo.   Lots of TVs to check out the playoff games and the Giants games

wbXvcHxzSPnbndUVz3jXwg.review_text: My good buddy had his birthday party at Harry's and it was a great time as usual.  Its a great atmosphere and great drinks but even better service.   We had Michelle wait on our party of about 25 and one of my friends joked at one point, 'Why don't you just start tabs for all of us?'  She did - and then proceeded to remember everyone's name and drink the rest of the night and kept them flowing.  Blown away with such amazing service, will definitely be back!

xf_vN-BJHNccH8iUhPu4yg.review_text: I'm a prude. *fan count decreases by 69%.*  And a Republican. *remaining fans receive charity stipend of $5000, which they'll later be taxed on.*  There you go.  The two biggest things that I try to hide from prospective suitors.  Last week, I watched the VP debate at Slide, and felt like I had a scarlet "R" emblazoned on my ample-thanks-to-Charmin chest.  Especially when I asked a volunteer for a receipt for my $10 mandatory Obama donation.  So yesterday, looking for a slightly darker, less obtrusive Happy Hour spot to don my little suit and matching scarlet letter whilst watching the Presidential debate, my co-worker suggested Harry's.  In Pac Heights.   Since I've dated half of the neighborhood with less than stellar results,  I almost wore a disguise, but decided to suck it up and hold my head high.  And I had a terrific time.  Harry's is certainly worth the risk of being seen by former love interest a-hole brokers.  In fact, isn't that their slogan?    Great place with plenty of large screens to watch a debate or sports.  Tons of seats to sit back and drink your feelings.  The food, and people, smelled great.  The crowd was nice and no one judged me for going against the SF norm.  In fact, I think there were even a few McCain supporters there.  I've not yet decided for whom I'll vote, but I'm sure that Harry's is a winner.

Z4SJfcKfnJfJzIdegIV_gA.review_text: Ah Harry's.  Good ol Harry's.  It seems like a lot of people want to hate on this place, but it's actually not that bad.   The food is good 'pub grub' type stuff and they serve it late.   They make a killer burger.   Drinks are a bit on the pricey side, but this is Pacific Heights, so what are ya gonna do.  For the price you do get a pretty stiff drink.  Okay, so the service can be a bit spotty (although at lunch I've always had good luck), and sometimes it can be eye-wateringly slow, but I don't think it's as bad as some people here have made it out to be.  If you need your drink quick, then sit at the bar.  Overall, Harry's is a fun place to hang, they play good music at a volume that allows you to have a conversation with your friends and there's usually a place to sit (a convenience that is becoming more and more important to me as I get older).  So thumbs up to Harry's.

T1kRNW8UyZkcs1K1O0Gb_A.review_text: Let's just discuss lunch as dinner is never as good here.  The lunch special of the burger and a beer for $6-$7.  Awesome!! Killer fries or salad either way the burgers are great not crowed.  At night it is a whole different story, but during the day it is great.  Sit inside or outside, either way great place to go for a quick Fillmore lunch.

v9RMfviYHZO4esxPNmI4PA.review_text: This is a great place on Fillmore. The food is good and not terribly expensive. They don't have a huge selection of beers on tap, but what they offer is pretty decent. This is a great place to come for lunch or early in the evening. I definitely don't recommend this when it's crowded because the service is slow and it's nearly impossible to move because the space is so narrow. This is not the type of place to spend the night, but is a great place to start.

JQ472bHDvtNQLTKVzuswcw.review_text: Cool bar with the two musts. Beers and musics. Also food. A great starting point for any night.

_n-kr9A6r7F_Pr4hv9yXtQ.review_text: The fact that they serve food here is completely irrelevant.   Drinks: good, strong and cheap.  Music: possibly a ghetto-ish dj, but plenty of fun either way. many a pants off dance off to be had!  Company: always classy.  I may be drunk as a skunk every time I come here, but it only makes me love it more!

W5cwxNwGiZJd393PCDQEvA.review_text: Most of this 4-star review is based on one reason...$10 bottomless Bellini's on the weekends (in my case I was here on Sunday for NFL football) 'til 2 pm. That's not to say I wouldn't like Harry's if it wasn't for this deal, but it certainly doesn't hurt there cause!   As far as the bar itself, I like it. It's basically just an old school sports bar, but it's clean, there's nice TVs & the waitresses/bar tenders are nice & personable! Our waitress was a complete doll this past Sunday. We showed up here at about 1:40 and two of us decided to take advantage of the $10 Bellini deal. Knowing that we were pushing it with time, our waitress brought us TWO additional carafe's right before 2:00! I will say that service was a bit slow at times, but the place was packed for football & things certainly could have been worst.   We ordered quite a bit of food as well, including truffle/romano fries, sweet potato fries, nachos, mac & cheese, and mozzarella sticks. The sweet potato fries & mozzarella sticks (they didn't taste too heavy) were particularly tasty. I wasn't a huge fan of the nachos (too much red/taco sauce), but they're hard to mess up entirely and were still decent. Our non-Bellini drinker had Bloody Mary (which she's somewhat a connoisseur of) and said it was tasty!   This was my first time at Henry's and I'll definitely be back (if nothing else for $10 Bellini weekends), but after looking over the menu I'm also impressed with the number of specials during the week. They seem to change things up from day to day & there's a lot of variety as far as both food & drink specials go (there's more than just two or three options). I'm a fan of Harry's!

0lDl1Jg1Qz2KhvkfJKk6fw.review_text: The beer was cold (Anchor Steam was in bottles not on tap. What's up with the city? It happens more and more. It's SF beer damn it. Put the Fat Tire in bottles and free the tap!) and there were plenty of TVs of every shape and size to watch Monday Night Football.   My only small beef is how the front bar area is laid out. It's a terrible waste of space. It seemed like there would be room for our party of 4 but there wasn't. It was the way the tables were spaced. There must be a better way. Also, there are some tables out front but not nearly enough chairs.

qUg4PXAT42bxV48CqPaUwQ.review_text: If one has to do a Harry D "extablishment" then this be it. Searching out a place on the Fillmo to have a nighty cap, we hit Harrys. The place was packed with sports aficionados. The Greyhound Sea Breeze mashup  I had was a little weak. Hard to have a convo after 8pm because everyone is chatterin' or cheering to touchdowns.  Crowd is fratsority all grown up and released to society with Crazy Town's "Come My Lady" looped in their brains. Lot of energy in the bar and one of the better places to go in the upper Fillmo after hours. Otherwise, make the effort to go elsewhere.

x2yZn2ulPfd4dMA2OiW-vA.review_text: Nice Cozy Bar with outside seating and several table seating inside which is always a +! Friendly bartenders and the crowd is a bit PREPPY but at least you know the patrons have J.O.B's! Definitely Recommend..Thanx Harry's!

qr868FvLd5fOSaJiE8Y_JQ.review_text: The service made the difference. For me, Harry's could have easily been chalked up as another typical douchey/fratastic sf bar, but no. On a Friday afternoon no less, the service was very prompt, meals were fresh off the grill and my drink was always full. That is all I could've asked for from a place like Harry's. I'll certainly be back.

Pmmhf8v8teg1MeoBom_d4A.review_text: This bar a cauldron of tools who drink very slowly, talk in very short sentences very loudly, and are always staring over each others shoulders whilst pretending to listen to each other. Why do American bars only have one toilet?

o-xZQj8RXx8TeLQ0WpWxoA.review_text: I like this place. Delicious truffle and romano fries. The calamari is also good. The prices are decent. There always seems to be large groups of white men...so if you're into that..

UYcmreQEOoetia4JokElFw.review_text: $5 Lychee Pineapple Martini, awful.  Tasted like vodka and random juice.  Nachos. Forgetable.  Would only come back because of its prime location in the Fillmore and the decor is not bad, B-grade  - sent from iPhone

-0Nvk7jIo79LaxChQtDyLA.review_text: Man did this bar SUCK. It's completely devoid of any atmosphere, it has mediocre/terrible waitstaff/service, far too many arrogant female bartenders (who aren't even attractive, which is the point in even going to Pac Heights in the first place) that play a shitty recycled mix cd containing way too much Guns N Roses, Coldplay and AC/DC- and that was AFTER they bitched at us for having the balls to ask for a Pabst Blue Ribbon. Sure, they sell a classier domestic, maybe you've heard of it, it's called lukewarm piss-water swill, a.k.a Budwieser. The only entertainment of the evening was watching two meathead tools approach a couple of (tallish, semi-attractive, yet with some sagging features and far too much eye shadow) girls next to us and completely strike out cold. Nothing like desperation to lighten the air! The only reason you might want to go there is to drop too much money on a watered-down rail vodka mixer, while staring lustfully at a pack of ugly nurses, while rockin' out to classic rock hits from the 70s. If that's your scene, then I probably saw you last night.

-40hChgdlI5clkagmyoh5g.review_text: I think it's about time I update my review about Harry's, since I've had a change of heart since my first experience that led to the poor review in the first place.  I always seem to end up here whenever I'm in the city.  Friends and I tend to just go and do our thing on the dance floor and the DJ has always been willing to appease our musical desires/requests.  The drinks are always good, BUT PRICEY, and as of late, the service has been friendly and fun.    SO, I've had a change of heart!

0DAJCCZcwsftU0gX5C0P7A.review_text: I've since been back, and this place is all right.  The initial experience was terrible, but service level has improved.  ***********************  this place is whack.  extremely weak pours.  bartenders are biatches, and ugly too.

tlmv_89ARqCtJhqt0_6dAQ.review_text: My girlfriends and I went  for drinks at Harry's Bar last night.  We were mingling and having a good time.  The drinks were good as usual. II ordered a Mandarin vodka soda from bartender Kaitlyn, I  asked the cost she said $13 which I thought was overpriced, but whatever I paid got my change back and moved on.  I then ordered the same drink from another bartender and paid $8. I thought that was different.  After I  told my girlfriends about it.  We looked at the bill from Kaithlyn and discovered she charged me $8 but took $13. very shady.  I did not confront her.  Just figured I would tell everyone else.  Stay away from the dirty blonde bartender Kaitlyn.  She takes half the bill for her tip.  Shady, shady

DOLmXzZLGc3GnPQVnZm2Tw.review_text: i wasn't really that hungry, but my boyfriend was so we went here for a bite and even though all i ordered was an organic salad and a small order of the black truffle fries, it was DELISH!!!! the truffle fries alone deserve the 4 stars! my bf ordered a burger, which i had a bite and that was pretty good too. our server was really sweet, and the service was in a timely manner even though the place was packed. the only complaint i would have was that where we sat in the back was kinda hot, but other than that it was a laid back atmosphere, good food, good service, and i would go back again. :)

I0KA1puYFNaAIQo28VEbYg.review_text: This is a great place to grab a beer, get some greasy food, and watch the Warriors kick some playoff butt!  Very crowded though, but I'm ok with sharing my personal space.

YaS3LMly8LeveGRYazRgPQ.review_text: Good vibe, decently priced drinks. Got a lavender flavored vodka drink I really enjoyed for $9. Crowd wasn't too intense on a Friday night. They have tables to sit too so if you're not feeling the bar/dancing crowd. Large screen TVs with movies playing. This night it was Napolean Dynamite. Good times all around.

GVUnShMpw45LIDmNl6KzkQ.review_text: Watched the awful BCS championship game here.  Usually a bar plays music while a game is going on but they had the commentary blaring out the speakers = a star.  Had the monday night special of a burger and a beer.  It was very tasty.  The place was packed but I still got good service.  Cute waitresses, plenty of t.v.s, and not too expensive.  I got stuck on a chair w/ no back and spent 3 hours with my neck cranked back watching the game but that was my fault.  Wish the seats had backs tho.  I'll definitely go back here for a drink or 4.

1a5CmjHm-acnUPKwmwA-mQ.review_text: lunch outdoors on a sunny afternoon was ideal. can't complain about the food. the bloody mary was good too.

ufr3dj5vEZLU5Q3bZWgi9g.review_text: Harry's bar is more than just a bar. It's an experience. The food is consistently delicious. Sweet potato fries and Kobe Sliders are my staple, although I'm sure over time I've nibbled off the entire menu and it's all bomb.   The staff is awesome. All the girls seem to genuinely enjoy themselves which is a total plus. When you go to a bar you don't want to feel like you're at someones work. . .you want to feel like you've been exclusively invited to their party. Believe me the Harry's girls know how to throw a hell of a party and everyone picks up on that vibe and has an awesome time.  Thursdays are clearly the new Friday with their DDD Party. DJ Dhru (1st&3rd) and DJ 2degrees(2nd&4th) spinning all the jams for those who like to get down and if liquid courage is all you need to get movin' they have a $5 DonQ rum special ALL NIGHT LONG!

rwNO7Ru33qDe-7FNQhs2Hg.review_text: 5 star blood orange margarita!!! tangy and not too sweet... soo delicious! Overall good bar with comfy seating for groups on the sides and a charming wooden decor. It's a cool neighborhood type of place, but the neighborhood happens to be pretty yuppie. Haha, but I liked my margarita so I didn't care!

9jpfKbCg4t2c80aNJ4Ix1g.review_text: I live in the area, so this is my staple happy hour or a couple drinks within walking distance, place. Its really quite nice for a 'sportsy' type of bar and the kobe sliders are always a must and the mac & cheese is good. I usually get some sort of fruity cocktail i.e. lychee is good, grape is my favorite (see: dimetapp deliciousness), and the wildberry cosmo (the first one) was totally great tasting. (the second) was absolutely disgusting and undrinkable. It tasted and smelt like vodka brand vodka and they didn't even have a freaking martini glass, which made it even worse. I'll still go back because I believe it was a bartender switch that caused the undrinkable drink....

nq6t85S6Obxbbe2syWPRgw.review_text: Going to Harrys is like going to a friend's bar, where everyone knows your name. Kinda like Cheers, only with better burgers. Lots of plasma TVs too... great for catching a game with the fellas on a Saturday afternoon. Hook em' Horns!

Lon1F9vnI1vPkeWmlPqebQ.review_text: Harry's Bar is my neighborhood favorite for hanging out and enjoying the weekend. Why, do you ask? Well, for one, there are the bottomless bellinis, which is a good excuse for anyone to have champagne at 10am. Secondly, the food is pretty good, especially for a sports-bar atmosphere (during game days, of course). I would recommend the mac and cheese to anyone (except lame lactose intolerant folk) because of how well the buttery, creamy goodness of the cheese complements the al dente pasta. Yummmmm. The nachos are also pretty good, but opt for the mac and cheese or homemade cheese sticks if you're looking to fill a major cheese-craving. The cheese sticks come with a wonderfully spicy marina sauce too, so you can't go wrong with that. Oh right, you want to know about the real entrees like sandwiches and burgers? They're all good. Seriously. I'm not a huge burger fan but the harry's bar burger is quite yummy. I'd suggest coughing up the extra chump change for the sweet potato fries instead of the regular ones - the sweet potato fries are always the first to go at a table, no matter what.  Overall, the atmosphere is great - a real neighborhood place with nice servers and bartenders who clearly know the regulars. They have the full nfl season package and 5(I believe) big flat screens to fulfill your every game need. Oh, and this was an amazing place to be when watching the Giants - especially during post-season. It was so awesome seeing the place packed with orange and black and having the people gather on the sidewalk outside to join in watching the last few outs of every game.  AS for the service - I've been here too many times to count, but really only had 'meh' service maybe a handful of times - and every time was on a crowded evening. Overall, they're really nice at remembering you so they can find you when you're table is ready, and the only people I've seen them be somewhat curt to were loud, obnoxious jerks who had clearly overstayed their welcome on the "bottomless bellinis."

Ku_WB7DnHaTfXrXwkhF6hA.review_text: Harry's was accommodating to our group of 7 people (sort of) but the place was SO LOUD!  There was an eclectic array of beer offerings and a good mix of your typical bar food fare.

0dkMypvRRlUJVivQcodzyA.review_text: $3 beers from 4-6pm and some tasty happy hour snacks as well - the mozzarella sticks and truffle fries are bomb. Sliders are just so-so.

9jZAXnAaulEC40wtEZK6Fw.review_text: Good: Environment and some selection of food. Bad: Service and delivery. Drinks are overpriced in this yuppy area. Over-rated. Wait-staff is slow and don't anticipate guest's needs. All wait staff are girls who can't get a job at Hooter's so they come here.

9JuhNhybzEsRb_iHmed9jw.review_text: i really, really, really don't know why so many of my friends love this place.  i mean, it's ok.  but that's it.  i really don't want to push my way through dbs, get drinks spilled on me, order food and then have it get mis-directed to another table.

kCX4KpifkCvbtjksFWIGog.review_text: At first, my friends and I wanted to go to the Grove for an early dinner but it was jam packed so we settled for Harry's Bar.  Maybe we should have went somewhere else?   Our waitress---pardon my french, was a B-I-T-C-H. Her name was Anna something.  She was not nice, she spilled drinks, she forgot to give us our to-go boxes, she made our friend drive home to get an ID (which I understand, you have to be 21 to enter the place) but all of us had IDs and were of proper age.  The potato leek soup was simply just that---cubes of potato with leeks mixed with watery cream soup. I'm a big fan of Potato Leek Soup and this has to be rated 2 out of 10.  I ordered the kobe burger, it was good, it did its job while I was craving some meat. I had way better though.  The one plus side of this horrible experience was the black truffle and romano fries. Dip that in ketchup, mustard, or ranch and you are golden.  Maybe the waitress was having an off day, but she treated us like children and did not make our dinner pleasant.

FVbtQgcCmWmQ-D6IR5BfZg.review_text: So, this place is average.  Large selection of alcoholic beverages and specialty drinks.  Food is ok - I think only the burgers are good.   DO NOT get the fancy fries - they are totally not worth it. Also the mac and cheese is good but watery. I had a bite of the chicken sandwich and it was good as well.  At night this place is PACKED - to the point where it is hot and smelly and drunk Marina-esque people bump into you. Not fun. BUT if you started here early, say during the day bc of a festival or something, and you have your territory marked, and your drunk friends are talking to cute guys... well it just may be worth staying then.  Bonus star for being open for lunch on the weekends and having a popular Bloody Mary!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Eh.  Came to Harry's last night for a coworkers going away party. Apparently it's the only bar within walking distance of this part of town, so I guess one can't be too picky, right?  Harry's is a sports bar from yesteryear. It's old school with an interesting mix of people eating and drinking. On on end of the room, there was a table full of old dudes swapping stories about their glory days, and on the other end of the bar, youngsters were doing shots and spilling drinks on people. Definitely a generational clash, but it takes all kinds to make a bar tick.  One of my default drinks is always a greyhound. You know when you're just approaching a bar, and you get caught off guard by the bartender when you're not quite ready to order? Those are the situations where I just blurt out 'whiskey/soda,' or 'greyhound.' In this instance, I'm beyond stoked that I went for the 'hound, because they use a juicer to squeeze fresh grapefruit juice into the drink. It was, hands down, the best greyhound I've ever had in my life. I'd go back just for that alone!  I sure hope I don't come across as sexist or something, but I've never understood why bar owners choose to put under-skilled, female bartenders with giant boobs wearing next to nothing behind the bar, instead of stocking the place with people who can actually sling a drink. It happens all the time at flashy clubs and sports bars. I mean, I 'get' why it happens... but it just seems counterproductive to me.  I'd rather get a great drink from a quality bartender than a mediocre cocktail while perving out on some half-dressed college girl any day.  Would love to come back to scope out a football game someday. Looks like it could be a cool spot to enjoy sports on a Sunday, but that's yet to be seen.

eWxlAWaCyHS9IGupFTjsXw.review_text: Was vacationing in SF with my sister and brother-in-law. They wanted to take me to this bar that their friends had taken them too. We walked all the way from our hotel, St. Regis. Finally got to the place.  Had a lot of fun, and the bartender (she's probably gone now) but was so friendly! She even remembered my sister/brother-inlaw. While the siblings drank their bloody mary's (apparently they're the BEST ever) I drank my mimosas. It was only 11am!  The nachos were bomb, and my nephew KILLED them. Would totally go back there!  After an hour of walking this mimosa is delish!! And awesome bartender from Seattle!!!

nlOxarS20luHkAloH5YyzA.review_text: I like this bar.  It's sort of like a mini slice of the Marina, but it's not the Marina.  But that is what makes it a good place.  It has the same appeal as a Marina bar, but you don't have to actually be in the Marina.  Does that make sense?  Yummy drinks and appetizers.  Also, they played my favorite Gipsy Kings song "Volare" to which I proceded to dance to nonetheless at a bar where there is no dancing.   No one seemed to mind.

1VwFLAb_vq1R1Q3VdMw5-Q.review_text: I love this place! Their truffle fries must be the best in my life. Happy hour menu available on mon is burger and it is also good! Like to go to this place and hang out!!!

Xorep_PXj9XQH3UVquaZAA.review_text: I've been trying to spend more time on Fillmore as opposed to Polk and now I can't figure out why I haven't before. The service here is friendly and the food is good. The crowd doesn't get on my nerves and I've had a good time every time I've been here, day or night. This is one of my new hangout spots.

2uM3O9Qy4vxvITAfke7_4g.review_text: This bar is alright, depending on what night you go it could be hit or miss depending on what kind of person you are.  I hate the marina, I hate douchebags & trashy women. This place is as Marina-like on weekends (Friday & Saturday) as any real-marina bar can be, but when you go in any other day (or for lunch) it actually is a nice chill bar.   Food is good. Service is alright. A side of fries will feed 4 people!   Good cocktails.

w384nx9AmloYLpFYEC8WWQ.review_text: Decent place to watch games. Food is not particularly good. Just had terrible chilaquiles.

GMiMXVIv9y5gpF95WCBZEQ.review_text: I have always loved Harry's. A great place to grab some drinks and eat after work and to watch games on the weekend.   I will NO LONGER patronize Harry's after what happened last week.    My friend just had a baby. I thought it would be nice for her to get out of the house and have lunch. Harry's is both close to her house and my work so it was an easy choice.  We sat at an outside table to enjoy the beautiful day ( It was a Fri about 1)We had the little one with us. He was perfectly asleep in his little stroller. We waited about 5 minutes until the waitress came out. She said," We can't serve you." We have a Cabaret License and therefor we can't have anyone under 21." WHAT!!!!!!!!! ( maybe in my more cynical, I really don't want or like kids time I would be okay with this.)   This is a Freakin' baby. I was pissed and I really couldn't believe it. My poor friend was so beside herself we ended up at Curbside.     I am really like what the fuck? A cabaret license is for establishments that serve food, drink and entertainment. Not, there can be no babies on the premises.   I am DONE with you!

QktYsZz_UjevtPjHfFj2aA.review_text:
Harry's is a great Pac Heignts treat!  Great place to get a quick bite or to meet up with friends for a drink.  Good mix of people in their 20's and 30's; most live in the neighborhood but on Thursdays through Saturdays, the place can get jumping as people from all over will stop by.  
  If you haven't ever stopped by, its worth checking out.  The burgers and fries are truly top-rate and you can't beat the price of $7.  For the ladies, try a raspberry mojito and for the guys, there are 4 flatscreens up on the walls in case you want to catch the Giants game.  Oh and the waitresses that work there are pretty hot as well.

TgdXZPZil1hIJbEwBOnnnQ.review_text: When I think of Harry's I always think of their martini.    Not necessarily always having a good time while I'm there, but its a damn good martini

1TgdIxSSbB2Vyb-UKeTDZg.review_text: Walked in just after happy hour and sat at the long bar across from the stools. It took about 15 minutes to get the bartender to even acknowledge us to take our order - and yes we stood AT the bar to place it. During that time she managed to mess up one drink. My friend asked if she (the bartender) wanted a credit card to keep the tab open and was greeted with a blank stare and a "huh?" response. From the looks and sound of things, she had been partying quite hard the night before and stumbled from bed into the bar. She had zero personality and clearly couldn't take care of her patrons. All I can think if that she slept with someone to get the job. Since we wanted to have some food and a table opened up, we decided to move to the raised seating area as we couldn't take much more of the vacant bartender.   The food... we ordered the mozzarella sticks and chicken quesadilla. The mozzarella sticks were pretty standard... that is until you tried it with the marinara sauce. There was something odd about it and my friend pointed out it was cinnamon. Who puts cinnamon in marinara sauce???  I couldn't even taste the tomatoes and that should be the primary ingredient. The chicken quesadilla was pretty basic. Nothing special about it, but when you're intoxicated it does the job.   Another irritating factor was that clearly Lin-sanity took over the bar as 4 out of 6 tvs were on the Knicks/Heat game. Clearly they didn't realize that there were any other sport or games on. Unfortunately, I got the feeling that if I asked for a channel change it would take 15 minutes to get the bartender or waitress' attention, another 5 minutes to request it, another 20 minutes for them to look for the channel and by that time the game I wanted to watch would probably be over.

Rck2SlB6b-6APVKs5v5_ZQ.review_text: Harry's was one of the spots I frequented long before I moved to Pacific Heights.  Their amazing brunch specials ($10 bottomless bellinis anyone?) have enticed me for way too long.  I have a major sweet tooth, but it is hard even for me to turn down the baked chilaquiles or the pressed ham and cheese sandwich for their (nothing short of fantastic) cinnamon waffle.  Yes, it is sometime a bit fratty, but it is worth it.  Hell, I'd go just for their sweet potato fries - best I've had in SF!

ym6lisvhlI9UrE5JSoXQ8w.review_text: Never been here at night and hear the crowd is lousy after about 9pm but before that it is a nice spot to grab a beer and some grub.  The used to have fried chicken (maybe they still do) that I think was made with that cornflake crust and was super tasty, IMO better than Q's which folks seem to like so much.   During the day the people watching is consistently entertaining, watching all the pacheights/marina girls shopping for atrociously overpriced goods while they mean mug/stare each other down-- damn funny!

QTghtKziGXyAoP2NobMTRw.review_text: Peach mojito!!! Lots of mint & peach bits, I liiiiikey.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Gotta love the Monday special - $8 for a tasty burger, fries and a beer!  Not sure if it's my scene on the weekends but on this lazy Monday afternoon Harry's really hit the spot.

yK8lb7eBwKI56hvyVmDUKA.review_text: The burgers are good. The drinks are meh. The service is the kind where you have to hassle them to get anything (with the exception of a couple bartenders, who seem to know what's up)

tFhFI6giHEOGbn-w9diZyw.review_text: Don't order the organic field greens salad here.  You may not even get the chance to order anything depending on where you choose to sit in Harry's.  After playing a game of musical chairs to position myself in front of one of the stationary waitstaff I was finally able to get an order in.  I was in the mood to eat healthy tonight and thought I couldn't go wrong with grilled chicken added to the house salad.  Looking back I would have done things much differently.  I would have ordered cheese fries, wings, and mozzarella sticks and left equally disgusted; only with myself and not the restaurant.  I've had better quality chicken and salads in the penal system.  Yes, I was locked up at one point.  I'll go back to Harry's, but probably only to watch games or bring people I don't like and tell them to order the organic field greens salad with chicken.

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: Went here to wait the wait out at SPQR. I ordered the Chinese Hawaiian (or something like that) martini which had lychee and pineapple. It was more pineapple than lychee and you could hardly taste the alcohol. Then I ordered their raspberry lemondrop and it was far too sweet and cold syrupie.  I had just had Houston's version the night before, which was way better. At least it was cheaper than at Houston's, only $8.50 per drink.  The vibe is great, kinda chill, sports-bar like. There were a lot of diners and their sliders looked yummy.

yc2ducLbcCedo31Hd_TFlw.review_text: im really surprised that this place only has 3 stars, i know its a popular place, so sometimes you have to wait a bit for a table or drink, but its a bar with hamburgers how can you go wrong?  looks great inside, and i think the food is good and drinks...also i would recommend it to anyone from outside the US to go to see a nice American bar

iAgeUjprA28AQDa80mDuTg.review_text: ok, after seriously considering gary k's pm to me, i give it one more star... it is, after all, supposed to be just a bar, no matter what the hype.   food is good, though not awesome. service is not bad at all. price is to be expected for pac heights. bottom line: DECENT.  i honestly only come here to people-watch, have a drink with buds and order a BLT, which no one can really frak up.

Fqau2I3qar-6AesW2rm7ZQ.review_text: Used to be my neighborhood bar, decent place.  A few specialty drinks done well.  Typical Pacific Heights crowd-- if you like that, you'll like this.

rNbX2MdVf07a37YKNezAcQ.review_text: Some friends and I went here after a movie a few weeks back and it was alright. Average food, average service. Typical bar, what is there to say.

LkdQzmGlgR_7pr0gKWKZjQ.review_text: Um, didn't I leave you people back at college? Okay, it's a scene, we all know this, but the drinks were good, and the bartendress was fabulous. Just be nice to her or you'll get iced. With plenty enough time to hang out with the pop yo' collar frat guys.

c-N3P3iEJdE9J0cxE99ScA.review_text: NOTHING SPECIAL... Kobe Beef Burgers - I came mouth-salivating, ready to enjoy a nice, filling burger and was quite disappointed.  Nothing really special, my friends!  Alcoholic beverages - Suggest you bring a flask of your own fave liquor.  Sure the bartenders are very nice people, but give a girl a mojito worth drinking and don't make me out to be an alchy when I have to kindly request MORE ALCOHOL.  Yes, I requested more alcohol in my drink.  (Really hope no one spit in my drink!)  REDEEMING QUALITIES... Soundtracks - Our group of 8 definitely enjoyed some of the 'ol school throwbacks being sprinkled throughout the mix.  Crowd - While we were comfortably seated at a table, it was nice to enjoy people-watching those crammed like sardines at the bar.  Besos,

g7z-cs4Jp9MQyfIl0OIXAQ.review_text: This place sux.  I must have been feeling generous the last time I was here.  Gave it an extra star for not being a total disaster.

lZEW6RBz_BL7OyQPuWEHnw.review_text: They have a Jager-rator and a Patron-ator. Scary... depending on what kind of night you want to have. Booby and fratty, just what you'd expect.

68hwnz-mvN3fKYWkyfIhXA.review_text: I was hanging with my friend Laura on a Sunday afternoon, a foodie who absolutely loves Tuna Melts, and since we couldn't decide on where to eat we drove from South Beach to Pac Heights.    We parked the car and walked down the street hoping to find something appealing.  We passed by Harry's looked at the menu, noticed the simple selection and our choice was made.  She immediately zeroed in on the Tuna Melt, I on the Harry's burger, and the "World Famous Bloody Mary's."    It was about 3:30 PM on a Sunday afternoon, the place was busy but we were able to find a table immediately.  The crowd was definitely late 20's to 50's, a good mix of people.    One nice touch which I admired were the mirrors, they were everywhere and gave the room a much larger feel.  Bonus points in my book.  The food was fine, not outstanding, but what do you expect for bar food.  We shared some chicken wings which were too damn hot, not hot as in spicy but too hot to even hold.  Not cool.  I had to wait until I was halfway through my burger before I even ate one.    We had a couple of cocktails with our meal and found ourselves sufficiently full and a little buzzed.  Perfect for a Sunday afternoon.    I'm intrigued with the whole cougar phenomenon...I may have to come here on a weekend night.

LdWIjNvjdaAoAfpQhT6F9w.review_text: When you are wandering around the Fillmore on Thanksgiving Day, wondering what's open for a snack in the afternoon before the big feast, pick Harry's. Well, the other place is open next door, but the boys in the group will have their eyes glued to the football playing on the television screens at Harry's, so you might as well go there.  Get the artichoke dip. It's got a nice little kick to it, and you can taste all the artichoke goodness they put into it. It goes very well with the pita bread!   Skip the grilled cheese. I hear it wasn't anything spectacular. The tacos appetizer are okay too.  The Kobe beef sliders are good. They come with a side of fries. The fries at Harry's are extra crispy and actually quite tasty. I'm a little annoyed that the server didn't remind us that the sliders came with fries because we also ordered a giant side of fries with some powdered flavoring on top. I never thought I would say this, but TOO MANY CRISPY POTATOES!  3 "A-OK" stars for the food and mid-day experience. I would come again for a drink, some bar food, and a game, but probably not for a late evening party that I've walked by on many occasions.

8Lc3-TTHjExd79GSQIHnAw.review_text: the gimlet was good, the garlic fries were great, i was happy.  I've had dinner here before too and enjoyed it.  definitely worth checking out.

aRU6pjjLwYuTyhLMz1iNKQ.review_text: I had a bar tender just charge me 11 for a Moscow mule without the Moscow. When I asked wtf happened the bartender threw more vodka in my cup and acted like everything was okay.this is the staging area for marina douchery.

r4m3F6H2AFC6f3Vtb1xzLg.review_text: 3.5 - cool joint to hang out for a drink or burger.   didn't take my zantac so I ordered a virgin mojito......my friend ordered a regular one. after she finished her drink in 5 secs, I took one sip of mine and turned red......eh, I think the waitress switched our drinks.  it was exceptionally loud last night and I had to scream at the top of my lung just to be heard. I sounded almost like a man when I walked out of there.

sR0I3N5q58Ne5EysyvZkPw.review_text: I will only come to this place if the girl (she's got to be a ten) convinces me to come here.  Otherwise, if you see me here, put me out of my misery!

GoAQCvu0E9vQjJjoMb91eg.review_text: My favorite bar in the city by default. It's my go to bar, when i feel like going out and can't think of any other place. It gets really loud, they have an awesome DJ on some nights, they make decent (strong) drinks and the service is efficient. Like most places on Fillmore, the crowd does get a little "Douchy" occasionally, but just look away and you'll have a blast. It does get crowded on the weekends so try and come early if you want a table. On the whole, an awesome group spot.

IXAYirFUR2Gs0zNkJi0rXA.review_text: I 've been to Harry's several times in the five years I've lived here .....  So... Harry's promises all these things...  Very good french fries .  And not bad burgers especially with the works.  Calamari is pretty good too.  Sitting at the bar on a October afternoon watching everyone running willy nilly among the doggies outside was cool...especially since a Great Dane stole the show today.  It's a simple place that is what you make of it.

XqTF2kngx9tIGj60QRmB0w.review_text: We all want to hate on the Marina, especially when it's not in the Marina.  But this place keeps Fillmore and California busy 7 nights a week, with a juicy burger, being the official spot to meet a blind date, outdoor seating, random reunions with long lost high school firends, and a hint of talent lying around...

5UDpc2CMOgbf3GePS6SGVA.review_text: Can't go wrong with any bar that makes mojitos for a decent price.  Most places won't have the mint available...perishable.  The crowd is pleasing, not too old & not too young - just right.  They at least look like they have jobs and some class :-)  The calamari is delicious and served hot.  Great spot to watch a game on any of their big screens!  The bartender was friendly, smiling all the time while she hustled.

A5Ss7ycTDSqAG43PQrBGyg.review_text: I'm not a huge fan of being told "no" and not getting my way at Harry's was no exception.  While waiting for a table on a Sunday to enjoy "Bottomless Mimosa's for 10$" I went to the bar after waiting 35 minutes and asked for 3 mimosas.  She said "26.00"  I said no I want the all you can drink deal for 10 each. She said no, you can buy these separately then buy the deal when you sit down.  That annoyed me, so I stuck with water.  I saw the hostess give favoritism to a group of girls who were further down than us on the list.  Maybe she was annoyed with me b/c when it asks for a physical description on the waitlist, i put "Girl with really cute green pants"  20 minutes more passed and I was tired of waiting and thirsty so I said just give us what you got.  So we got a small table against the backside which is half booth/half chairs and squeezed in.  The hostess turned out not to be a hostess but a waitress too but she took on a different personality when serving.  She was attentive with the mimosa pours and quick with the order skills.  We ended up combining forces with the boys seated next to us and had one giant table/party in the back.  Harry's wasn't so bad after all.  I probably will come back at some point.  Won't go out of my way, but if we happen to be looking for a brunch/football combo in the area...

NmIOrfB-C5DmMDefL9bx4w.review_text: I came here to get drinks with a friend after dinner on a Saturday night. It's an OK bar, the crowd is really not my vibe, lot's of young techie people. That alone makes me not feel it.  It looks like it would be a cool place to grab a drink on a summer afternoon because of the open air set up in front.  The major plus: The cleanest bar bathroom I've ever been in, in SF.

_q_MC7ebjDOCpX5Ec7TXEQ.review_text: I dug this place.  There was lots of seating, and outdoor seating for those nice breezy days. There were lots of house special shots, and the 'famous' bloody mary, though we didn't try it.  Place was pretty packed when we came here for a late lunch, we didn't have to wait too long for a small bar table to open up, and although small, it was still plenty space for the 4 of us.    Our waitress was busy running her ass around, but acknowledged us and came over as soon as she was able, we're friendly patient people. it's ok =) We each ordered our drinks and our food since we were starving and couldn't wait to eat!!  We waited, and waited...and about 20 minutes later, our food came out. Nice, hot, toasty, yum.  I had the tuna melt, it was open faced and came with french fries.  The tuna melt itself was delicious. Good portion of tuna, very savory and with melty yummy cheese on top and a slice of tomato.  The french fries were golden crisp and not soggy. Awesome.   My friends had the chicken sandwich and hamburger and each said that their meals were tasty as well.   The atmosphere was loud, rowdy, with a good mix of different sorts of people.  The place had plenty of tv's for game days/nights and there are game specials of $1 OFF Amstel Light and Heineken.    I already told my gf even before we were finished eating, we were coming back here without the boys next time =) there were some cuties!  Next game day =)

FnDttHrOrL-KADXxbeVeLQ.review_text: The Good: -awesome friendly staff -nice selection of beer  The Bad: -food is average for the price(guess cant complain since  this is Pac Heights  The ugly: -witnessing an episode of elimidate next to you.

qzDCMkf0vpk51UapdPoHPg.review_text: I've been here a few times and although I'm happy with the prices for a beer, the service usually pretty good and its in a convienant spot - I just don't dig it.  It usually feels dingy, the bathrooms dirty and the layout is akward and hard to get to the back.  It just doesn't have a great feel I guess.  But it does have a few big TVs and the olympics were so, so that's cool if you like watching sports while you drink.

DxQeJSiKJUmWIre2XGaKGg.review_text: I've been coming here for years and it hasn't changed much.  It would be great if they could refresh the place a bit.  We watched the Giants game, had a few beers and a salad and people watched.  Ran into a few buddies.  Our server was super nice.

pqX6xDHUOPS46A0J2RX1ig.review_text:
Drunk sorority girls standing on tables and singing songs from the Grease soundtrack. Drunk frat boys synchronously pumping their fists to Bon Jovi songs. 
  It's worth a look, but leave before you go insane.

AlWFJgPVptPynau60S9D2Q.review_text: Great burgers. Terrible music. Yes I love your Big Blue burger with tons of crumbled blue cheese and bacon. But honestly, Harry, I don't want to listen to the best of Sheryl Crow while eating it. Better music exists, it goes by the name of NOT Sheryl Crow...   It's seems like a lot of people dislike this place because of it's clientele. I understand that if you're going to it for the bar scene. But as far as great burgers go, it's worth the trip. When I'm eating dinner, I don't particularly give a damn whether the person sitting to right of me is an I-banker or not. I just want tasty food.  Also, the prices are really reasonable. A beer + burger = $13.00 with tip. Not bad. Not bad at all, Harry.

CSeWID1TbPxeFwaLRATjfA.review_text: Their burger is not that good....  its a normal burger but nothing i would ever crave.  They have tots... and who doesn't enjoy having some crispy tots once in a while instead of the boring fries!!! Also... they came with delicious dipping sauces.  This is a great place to watch a game... although im not that into the neighborhood in general.   They usually have some sort of drink special which is always appreciated.

swocJWD8R1iH20-lveXh0Q.review_text: I love this place!  My friend lives right around the corner and we come here for food ALL the time.  I always get their Meyer steak salad.  The steak is always sooo juicy and I know it wasn't previously sliced up and reheated.  The pieces are perfect with their grill marks and they go great with the little croutons and it comes with just enough slivers or parmesan.  My boyfriend got the seared ahi caprese salad and that was a little overcooked but still delicious.  The pieces were also huge and he got full eating only half the salad.  Come for the brunch menu too; it's also tasty!  Oh, and their sweet potato fries are delicious!

HqVl4rbdXxKLD4uHEqaTKA.review_text: Went to Harry's the other weekend for Brunch and Bottomless Bellinis with the girls. $10 gets you all the Bellini that you can handle at 11am.  Interestingly, Harry's Bar in *VENICE* was actually where the Bellini was *invented*. Neat-O!  Keep in mind they they serve traditional Bellinis... not the blended/slushy Americanize version. Expect something with more of a Mimosa consistency.... It's Prosecco and Peach puree.  Food was good. Portions aren't huge, but still very satisfying. I had the Waffle with a cinnamon whip-cream. YUM. The Brunch menu is fairly limited... I'll be honest, I like a lot of choice when it comes to Brunch. They could stand to have another few items to choose from. However, I will also say that everything they do have is made well and presented beautiful. Prices aren't bad either-- you're looking at $10-$15 plates. Not bad considering how 'nice' this place looks.  The place is pretty loud, which was a downside for me. Was actually hard to have a conversation with my friends across the table. But, aside from the noise, it's a really nice 'bar'. Well lit, busy, obviously a popular locale.  The waitress was attentive and kept our bellinis coming. I don't think we ever had to sit with an empty glass.. Which is a feat considering how busy the place was. Impressive.   I'm definitely going to go back!

ekYXsLHd4XNgW6YC9WiNYg.review_text: The bartenders Ashley and Maxine are the best. The waitresses are awesome. The rest of the staff are great to! Food is awesome for bar food! Not too pricey. People watching is good. Great sports on the tubes! Holler!

O7p4jXTjrY70e5CQbpoWsQ.review_text: Hey... it's a bar.  What else need there be?

_aSs5dSAabuwnXUGBPzASw.review_text: Date and Time:  May 3 Saturday @ 1pm, Various lunches Company:  Michael Crowd:  Friendly, hip 20-40 somethings Atmosphere:  Lively Decor:  Woodsy, old-charm bar with three outdoor tables Service:  Attractive with a slight attitude young female servers in low cut black tanks Imbibe:  beer and mojitos Devour:  Kobe sliders, Killer Kobe, Cajun fries and a MUST - Truffle parmesian fries Notes:  Quite the bar scene for young Pac Heights and the crowd is so cool and friendly and knows everyone!

uVzxkswQxGHrr7ZrX_ZMnA.review_text: On a happy hour date with my boyfriend, we had strolled into Harry's Bar to catch the first part of the game. May I please say that a restroom is such a major part of the ambiance of any location and Harry's Bar's women's restroom is one of the best restrooms in the city! Much because of the 1930-40's decor. I especially would like to point out that lovely Barbie Fashion poster in the women's restroom.  The bartender was so pleasant. The bar had a good arrangement of music playing as well. The TV's had a balanced selection of sports showing. We sat ourselves at the bar and ordered the Kobe Sliders with horseradish aioli, onions, and Bibb lettuce. A nice snack to share together with a glass of beer.  I wish I could give this place five stars, but the service wasn't how it was last time. Inconsistent? Maybe just an off day? One waitress and one bartender. They'd talk to my boyfriend and not me? How odd. It felt like a fake smile and nod. Then after a while, it just felt like service with no mean to it. I wasn't happy with that.

J7fmfD8q5v64eAmHE4dI6w.review_text: Consistently good place for drinks.  It gets pretty crowded, but I usually have a great time here.    I've never had any of the food, so I can't comment on it.

bd-kEeEMr5ADiVPj559vMg.review_text: This place sucks balls.  The bartenders who took pride in their craft are no longer there, and have been replaced by Hooters Rejects.  I just hope the staff will hold on the the last bit of dignity and self respect they have and refuse to wear those god-aweful shorts that say "Harry's Bar" on the ass.  While once a true "neighborhood" joint, the clientele has since been replaced with ex-frat boys who gawk at the cocktail waitress' titties and call each other "bro."  Yeah, the music is great-- if you're into Fergie and Nelly.   I hope Harry Denton (the bar's original owner), won't shit his pants when he sees what his bar has turned into. Oh, rumor has it that the owners also bought out Bruno's in the Mission. There goes the neighborhood.

uXSVu2ldBncOGMcvI9SW2Q.review_text: I'm a fan of this place in the afternoon- I can sit with my dog outside, have a decent sandwich or surprisingly good nachos and watch Fillmore Street go by. At night, though, its a completely different story. Weak drinks and a rude clientele. I'm sorry, but if someone bumps into you and spills his drink on you, "I'm sorry" is the appropriate response (especially at 7:00PM, when no one should be so drunk they don't notice). I've never been bumped into more in my life without the "hey, sorry" or the sideways squeeze as they walk by. Geez.

BTcZm-svYkYfiSafOx7Kpw.review_text: Harry's Bar is a great place to hang out with a group of friends or catch up one-on-one. I went here for brunch and I loved it!  From the outside, it looks like a small place with a few patio tables, but when you go in, you realize that the bar is much longer than it looks and the actually bar area stretches for 3/4 of the length.  The bar itself has a bit of an old rustic feel. The dark colors of the interior also makes it somewhat of a darker place.   The cuisine is American and the food is cheap and delicious, making it perfect for those "morning after a night out" brunch with your friends. Did I mention that they also have bottomless Bellinis served in carafes? Yes, those are dangerous.  Our waitress was very friendly and was good about refilling our carafe of bellini. She made us feel right at home.  Overall, this place had great service, yummy food, and bottomless alcoholic drinks. What more could you want?

2pb1RGYF72rhx4sHfLbPNQ.review_text: Came here with two good friends for Harry's Monday Night Special (Burger + Fries + Drink = $10)  Veggie burger available  = )     All was good, until this guy showed up and bought us a bottle of champagne and insisted that we include him in our little group.  That was socially awkward, esp. my friends and I just wanted to catch up over some greasy burgers and catch a Lakers playoff game... Luckily, two beautiful ladies showed up a few tables down so we suggested to our unexpected crasher to move along...  They seemed to appreciate the champagne a lot more than we did.    Now I can vouch that champagne and veggie burger don't mix well.

f2PvxaRfZ3c0vJm4Q0rJTA.review_text: Amazing place to go, except on a Friday or Saturday night.  It gets too crowded.

SIcz9tmyUGlZtiaa39fBsQ.review_text:
They're pretty loose with these categories.  "Night life?"  House of Prime Rib is in Night Life as well, perhaps Harry's leans more in that direction.   
 Great burgers, even better Chicken Club Sandwiches and an amazing "shower."

79pQB9ZzROBHxMM0qJaq3g.review_text: So so on the burgers...bit of a mainstream crowd for a sports bar. Great neighborhood. Consistent as far as expectations go.

of-Kuw-FAB59_b5YlUtGSQ.review_text: I have never been here before but they had me at Bottomless Bellinis.  My sister and our friends love a bottomless brunch drink but I am soo over Circa so when this Sunday Funday option came up, I was on it.  They took a reservation for our party of 8 - this is fancy to me.  The bellinis were delicious and rapidly came to our table.  We had calamari, spinach dip, and chips and guac - all were very good.  The one downside to the guac was it was too small - not worth it.  I don't remember what I had for lunch (damn bellinis) and we were all trying everyone's food.  I will be back!

nTAmX-Ab2BWMadULkrZ2Zw.review_text: I was recently in San Francisco visiting and had spent the day walking the city alone. I stopped in Harry's with my shopping bags and a book to relax a bit before finishing off the day. My server, Carly, was very helpful. Besides helping me decide between an Irish Coffee and Bailey's and coffee on that cold day, she made me feel so welcome to the city. She give me recommendations about what else I might see, directed me to the bus, and even asked about my book, all while unobtrusively allowing me solitude to read and think. On my next trip to SF, Harry's will definitely be my late afternoon stop after a long day of walking and shopping.

kIFja02Dxs7KdUHj_rY0nQ.review_text: Previous to yesterday, I've been here many times. Every single time it was so crowded & so hard to get a drink at the bar. Super hot & hard to walk around. But all of those times were later at night when the bar scene was pumping.  Yesterday I came for happy hour around 5pm. I easily got a table. Although it wasn't crowded, service was still slow. Well drinks are $4-$5 & there are various snacks to munch on. The calamari was good, nothing special & served with two different dipping sauces.   The blood orange margarita was good. I've tried the champagne cocktails before too & those were good as well. The drinks are kind of on the pricey side ~$10.  Sports bar vibe, but nice & clean inside.

kkAFJLviQ_dp1nChCvi3-Q.review_text: I think this bar is cute! Very cute! I was here saturday after the giants game with some friends and we had beer and burger which was quite good actually! I've been here during a game and it gets too packed but after a game and having some food is a winner at this place! cute neighborhoood, cute people, cute beer, cute cute cute!

-qDiotF8Qd0ThdLNEpg9Aw.review_text: The positives: Good beer; a young, good looking crowd; inviting; usually busy.  The negatives: Can get TOO busy at times, leaving little room to stand (let alone sit). Not as close to other attractive bars as the Mission, Lower Haight, North Beach or the Marina. Make this place your weeknight bar.

yfVbdcHTyb2N-2MI4Z9dGw.review_text: Still don't really like it here, but I'll give them some credit for excellent service the last time I was here.  However, I did meet the woman of my dreams here. Thanks Harry's.

NK5nADZUYGor1Bknp1CrLw.review_text: Being a UOP Student, I've been here more times than the waitresses themselves. I've had pretty much everything on the menu, and I have the say their turkey burgers with a side of sweet potato fries is something that i will never get sick of. Other than that I just come here for the beer and good company. I am definitely not here to be served by snooty waitresses that probably hate us UOP students...(we are loud and we are in debt :P)   Drinks are overpriced, but hey, it's pac heights, gotta pay the rent some how.

SIJ-y-bPouFmGj_HEZ-M9Q.review_text: I would never have gone into Harry's bar to eat had it not been for the fact that everyone else was closed on XMAS day. What a pleasant surprise: my fish and chips was delicious and my wife loved her Kobe beef burger. I'll definitely go back for the food.

fou9pya19z4NWWAGZslxXA.review_text: There simply is no better place to be at 1AM in Pac Heights than at Harry's. This Fillmore street staple serves decent burgers well past midnight. On the weekends the place gets packed with a slightly aggressive marinaish crowd. If you don't like drunk yuppies singing to living on a prayer, stay away. However, if you have had more than a few drinks at dinner and are willing to sing along to Michael Jackson and Usher this is a good place to end your night.

A8N64S6Oqgx63p45EiW5bQ.review_text: I think I may need to try this place during the day, because I could see that there MIGHT be potential. The only time I was there it was ridiculously crowded and I was standing at the top of a mini staircase so I was bumping into people all night. Not to sound like my pops or anything, but the music was annoyingly loud too. I nearly lost my voice saying excuse me eleventy billion times. I pretty much felt like I needed to leave the entire 30 minutes I spent there.

tXKTfiUh_3R1En0xYonXdw.review_text: Among the things life has taught me: when things go well, you better celebrate.  Because things won't always be great, even if they are mostly pretty damn good.  And since life will kick sand in your face many times, you need to make some time to enjoy the times things go really well.  For a friend of mine, things went really well last week.  And so, to celebrate, we went to a bar in his neck of the woods.  Harry's.  And had a great time.  Reviewing the bill at the end of the night (and I -DO- mean "end") was a bit like reviewing a lifetime of bad decisions ("3 rounds of Patron shots?  Yeah, I guess we did do that."  "Hey, who ordered the Jameson shots?"  "I did, because they were out of SoCo."), and the ultimate financial price was a little high (depending, I guess, on how you cut it: a hondo a head, or $80/hour for the time we spent there).  BUT: -the food was good; -the service was pretty darn good; -the drinks were strong; -we all had a great time; and -we helped a friend celebrate good times (c'mon!).  This place is way out of my ordinary travels around the City, so I'm not likely to be a frequent patron (did you catch the sounds of dozens of women all simultaneously taking notes?), but I would definitely go back.

rvxxmHFLzY911MMubS45jQ.review_text: I have to give this place 5 starts just because I've been here several times, and have never had a bad experience. It's a restaurant during the day and a bar at night. (they still serve food late, too) The bar gets pretty loud so if you're looking for a chill place to go and chit chat, this isn't the place for you.  It's a nice bar! I like it, and will defintiely be going back!!  OH..... and the guy that works at the door is actually REALLY nice!! Not one of those D - you know what's who think they're the shiz!  Check it out sometime!!

_UsEAddCzy4Auy-feBkpeA.review_text: Ah, a sidewalk lunch on a rare, balmy SF day...it may be global warming, but we can enjoy a bit of it, no?  But, alas, the food is just so-so.  I had a Turkey burger with bacon and avocado, and found myself wishing I'd made the trip to Burger Meister's instead.    That said, it's a nice place to people watch, read the newspaper, and wait for the polar caps to melt.

xfbSQGUaUAlkQ_v-ZCR09A.review_text: I came here yesterday with my b/f, his friend & g/f, after the Cherry Blossom Festival.  It was scorching hot outside, so the inside of this restaurant was hot and stuffy.  At least we were sitting near a fan.  Typical bar fare.  I ordered spicy chicken wings and truffle & romano fries.  Apparently the fries were good because everyone else ate my fries.  Haha.  The wings were tasty.  Nothing special.  The boys ordered the Filmore burger & the Kobe burger, and they both liked their respective burgers.  Drinks were abysmal.  Coronas were warm, and the mimosas did not taste like mimosas.  3 stars.  Just okay.  Next time, I'll try the place next door.

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: Sadly, it seems that a lot of the regulars or crowds here aren't orgiinally from the area - college-wise at least.  Once came here with a group of friends looking to catch the Cal game, but were told we would have to wait until the game showing on the TV closest to us was done, despite the fact that there were maybe two people watching it and it featured two teams in the Midwest.  Sadly, we had to "sit tight" and watch our game on a small TV all the way across on the far wall.    Service has been kind of hit and miss unfortunately - I've had a couple of good servers, but have also had a couple that seemed to only check on the same tables repeatedly (not mine).  Maybe these were regulars or friends, but it was kinda disappointing to have to interrupt our meal to keep looking for a waitress.  The food/appetizers are not bad - just about what you would expect from a bar menu.  One of the better menu items are the Grilled Kobe Sliders, which come with a great horseradish aioli sauce, and really could serve as a meal on its own.  The nachos are massive as well, but make sure you have several people to split it with cuz it's a beast to tackle.

tRyZ7RnmHi6rKFO0hRXZ6g.review_text: I seriously wanted to give this place more stars. It was crowded and noisy when I got there, which didn't bother me. What bothered me is that my friend and I were standing in front of an abandoned host area for about 20 minutes before we were so much as acknowledged by the staff.  Our server was fast and efficient -- she was a little brusque but considering the drunken frat/sorority table nearby that was also hers I thought she was handling herself pretty well.
