Tasty bellinis to be sure -- when you go for the all you can drink, you're subject to a time limit, however. Seems a little silly to me. My recommendation would be to swing by when it isn't packed with drunk college kids.

P1DWOzGi1e9rT1DvCmZdvA.review_text: Held a surprise birthday party with 25 people - what a GREAT experience. The waitress opened tabs for each and every combination of guests that we had. There was no splitting of the bill or confusion - AND she got every order right. We also brought in a cake (Harry's offered to give plates and forks at no added charge), we asked for a specific location in the bar  (they allotted more than enough space) and camped in our spots the entire night (the waitress never let us get hungry or thirsty for a minute). Every off the wall request and obnoxious drink order we made was met with a smile and swiftly executed. What a great experience. Plus their food was delicious and we ordered all the way until midnight.

bH5Su6kXayLmkG_fXKPaNQ.review_text: I think my friend put it best when describing this place..."It's a bit depressing."  And, yes, it is.  Last time I went it seemed as if the Marina crowd had spilled over the hill into this Upper Fillmore locale, residing in it to drown their woes; probably a result of the residual numbness created by a week working for corporate America.  But, less about the middle-aged bar flies and more about the place itself.   I walked into Harry's thinking I would find a tasty burger.  Granted, it was but nothing to terribly write home about.  Service was lacking and my waitress was a bit pushy on the drinks (even when I had told her that I had already had my fill of wine).  For all of this, the tab seemed rather high.   In all, the experience was rather odd.  The crowd, the space, the food, and the service.  In the Fillmore, with so many culinary options, Harry's ranks low on my list.

av2yABRzSHSAVbAmX8miWA.review_text: I really want to like Harry's more. Food and drinks are good for this type of bar (not a  dive, not super upscale, but just right). I've also found the wait staff to be attentive. However, the nights with a DJ are torture. The space is way too small for the ear-splitting volume of music pumped out of the speakers. It's as if the DJ doesn't realize he's not in a bumpin' club, or that he overcompensates for lack of experience. It would be great to park ourselves here for the night, but as soon as the music starts, my friends and I split. Hey Mr. DJ: louder does not equal better.

yXwWlO2CVElfEBYfSW5wKQ.review_text: I was shocked that they call themselves a "Sports Bar."  I guess they are just a 49'ers bar.  I just left there because they would not play the audio for the Sunday Night Football game.  It's the only football game on and they couldn't play the audio?!?!?!?!?  It is definitely a great place for 20 year olds to hang out.  If you are over 30, I agree with some of the other reviews, don't bother going Fri- Sun.    I did have the Ahi Tuna, it wasn't bad; but they had to ask how I would like it prepared.

9Bioyd5quWATuOq25WVbig.review_text: Been to Harry's twice. Once over summer for a quick drink, where the service was slow but nothing memorable either way.  Was in the neighborhood again last week and stopped in for dinner.  It wasn't especially busy or crowded, the two of us sat at one of 5 or 6 empty tables.  We waited about 10 minutes to order drinks, which might have been a sign of what to come.  We ordered calamari as an appetizer.  It came out 10-15 minutes later and was hot to the touch on the top, and cool on the bottom.  The first bite confirmed the squid's heat lamp death combined with being frozen.  I've chewed on rubber bands that would have gone down easier.  I rarely send back food, but it was inedible.  The response from our waitress was "want something else" rather than "do you want to have another made" which kinda makes me think she knows it sucks.  We went with a safe bet - tater tots - which were good. I ordered a chicken sandwich for dinner, she ordered a wedge salad and soup. The salad and soup came out a minute or so before the sandwich, and both were good.  The chicken sandwich came out and it looked a little, uh, dated. A finger to the chicken yielded not quite fridge-cold but not quite more than luke-warm.  It did seem cooked when I cut into it, so it might have been sitting around or precooked.. Not sure.. Sending that back doubled the amount of things I've sent back all year to 4. It was that cold.  The replacement sandwich came out shortly after, and was actually cooked property.  It was good - nothing to complain about other than we're now an hour and 15 minutes into sitting down for a quick dinner.  I think we sat down during halftime of a MNF game and it was over sooner than we were with dinner. Check time - dropped off without a "thanks" or "sorry for giving you two dishes you had to send back" or "come again".  I wasn't expecting a free dinner (maybe the tater tots? :-) ) but at least acknowledgement of the mess up would be appreciative.   If the waitress had been a little nicer, maybe just one apology for either mess-up, or even a smile during the 1:30 dinner I'd go back. But not now. Skip this place and goto SFAC or Wild Hare for American pub grub and sports.

XQMaAvF3YUslCD-0tZY1xg.review_text: I have been coming to Harry's on and off for the last few months - and have been thoroughly impressed with the staff. Ally (newest bartender), Kaitlyn, and Kelly are all amazing bartenders / servers who remember my drink and ensure it's never empty. I have found this to be very rare in San Francisco.  The food is on point for what you expect - burgers and fries are tasty; along with some of the other appetizers. Happy Hour is a great deal along with $10.95 burger and a draft beer on Mondays and 1/2 price wine Tuesdays.  As some of the other posters have stated - the place can get fratty and crowded especially on weekends with the DJ, however, I have never found it to be unbearable.  Well worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood.

oM7B-PDa7v-YVrk2bbi9dg.review_text: The best spot on Fillmore to grab a few drinks.  Great for Happy Hour. A classic joint with lots of seating - get there early to grab some seats in the front and you are in luck.  Sign of a good bar - hooks under the bar for your coat or purse! HUGE.

T6SuLkeGko0shJacHYWq6g.review_text: Been here a couple times...The drinks weren't very good, but the dj was alright.  I like the looks of the place and everything, but it's just missing something.... Plus there's always a couple of real duechebags running around.

N4_TkjvXk7N-XPdVqttCFw.review_text: It's not really my type of bar and the music is too loud. It's not that I'm old, but seriously, I'd like to talk to friends that I'm with when at a bar.   The burger special on Monday is great! The bar gets one star the burger special gets 5!

K3VdPu8XTf9YBETSpwRhng.review_text: This was one of the first places I visited after moving to SF.  I was, like, "Nice... beers on tap, good looking burgers, good looking patrons, no sawdust on the foor.  Yuppie heaven.  Pac Heights personified"  Second time at Harry's, I wanted something besides a burger and realized that the food sucked.  Third time, I stood in the awkward space in the narrow hallway in the seating area and protected by pint from lots of pushy people that I didn't like.  Fourth time, I insisted we go somewhere else.  It's not bad, it's just not good.  No soul.

H4-0VkwLSNzu7dXnI0NL5A.review_text: Only if every other place is too crowded on the Filmore and it is ten o'clock and you simply have to eat something before heading over the Bay Bridge to home. Decent enough burgers. Loud bar noise drowns out any actual conversation. You don't really have to drink, they don't care.

S7lxiY8zc5gBV7PwVzKThg.review_text: I imagine that this place stays in business because people move to SF and haven't gone anywhere yet and this place is decorated nicely?  Also, the girls getting trashed during happy hour make sex a total guarantee.  It's almost exactly like a Marina bar, except...well, there's no exception.    Had a burger which they put hard avocado on then proceeded to overcook it and it was on a dried out bun.  The nicoise salad looked like they got the Ahi from a discount food store and they overcooked it.    The Cucumber Gimlet is so sweet that it was like sucking down a 5 year old's birthday cake that Rainbow Bright crapped on.  Most of the cocktails are in horrible proportions.    They do have some nice TV's which make it fun for sports watching, hence the 2nd star.    There are so many great spots in this neighborhood that there's really no reason to even step foot in this place.

nkN_do3fJ9xekchVC-v68A.review_text: Granted I had 3 beers before I walked in the door, but I had a suprisingly good time here. I mostly hung out with my friends, but in general patrons' guards were down which made for a more fun and healthy social scene.

AWuTSbGKI2RKWa7oYdPIbA.review_text: The Monday Night bartender is amazing! And hot!!!!!

YYflpzatJGxRhyPijmHfTQ.review_text: Awesome spot for Sunday football.  Great prices. Bottomless Belini's are the way to go!  Great start to Sunday Funday.  Blackended chicken sandwich is fantastic.

KI7gPbRvdngGcgq3-RD7Gw.review_text: Not usually a fan hanging at Pac Heights/Marina bars...but I liked my food and drink order so will proceed to give Harry's 3*'s.  I ordered: --Their Mango Mojito ($8.5) is delicious.  Sweet and refreshing with big chunks of fresh mango. --Kobe Slides ($11.95 - 3 per order) was very juicy with yummy aioli sauce.  3 definitely fills you up.   --My boyfriend ordered some kind of chicken sandwich...I didn't taste it, but the chicken slices were pretty darn pathetic.  Dry and very thin looking...so steer clear of that.  Food aside, its not my kind of place as it tends to draw the a certain crowd.  During dinner, a group of drunk preppy idiots stumbled in as Harry's was part of their golf pub crawl...so i think you know the type.

Po9-MLc26OMIqybZbO37Gg.review_text: I like the warm atmosphere and great location but the cocktails aren't that great so stick with something SIMPLE.

YAzfheXd9Z9Y752kZna_3w.review_text: Awesome bar! Super delicious burgers and gourmet fries. I got the bbq bacon cheeseburger with truffle and romano fries. so delicious...Good drinks, kinda pricey for what I'm used to but I also don't live in San Fran. Very friendly staff. Good music. I really enjoyed there and I would definitely keep coming back.

odM7WqRsORcMsFymWEMiAw.review_text: Great fries. :-)  Harry's is actually a nice place to chill out on a leisurely Sunday afternoon, when there aren't so many people in there.  I probably wouldn't go on a Friday or Saturday night, though.  That'd just be too much: Too mainstream; too "Frat Boy/Frat Girl"-ish.  Not my scene at all.  Those fries sure are good, though...

m5B7oLeXWLJwTx16Re3h_Q.review_text: I've been going to Harry's for the past 7 years and it's always been great.  In time, the food has actually improved (try the steak salad!) and the drinks are always good and strong.  I love the ambience of this place.  Just a fun place to hang out with your friends and catch up!

dt_XnU3ZepAE5HIhMPFnfA.review_text: Meh.. Went here for a bite to eat before a show at the Fillmore.  I ordered, a margarita which was fine...I guess. For food, I ordered a Grilled cheese and a cup of tomato soup.   Pretty much the worst I've ever had.  That's pretty hard to mess those things up. I felt like it was food I'd get at the airport or something. Def. nothing special. Crowd was not my scene....kind of fratty. Music was ok...they were playing Mike Snow for a bit. Waitress....kind of scattered.  Looked like an ok place to get a quick beer and catch the game for a little bit, but not a place I'd hang out at.

088SkMN7Hjn2vK2MEUfc3Q.review_text: So-so.  Good cocktails, $4 beers during sports games, lots of TVs and lots of tools.  If I'm in Pac Heights and looking to watch a game I suppose I'll head here until I find someplace cheaper and/or more laid back.

zb9Hsey_L4VijrN1G2b7dw.review_text: I was a kobe beef virgin walking into this place, and I came out a kobe beef man whore. And it wasnt even a steak! It was a burger!  Wow  the best $12 burger ever.  I ordered med rare and they cooked it perfectly.  Mmmm this is gonna ruin me for burgermeister.  Yes it was that good. Comes with fries. The burger was well seasoned.I highly recomend the Heifer Weizen to wash it down. The amazingly beautiful waitress who told me to call her Nadi  (or was it Naughty?)  was extremely pleasant.  Cant wait to go back.

6EHbIv5w2I4XbXs3dG_D1Q.review_text: Solid, straightforward bar, with old-fashioned wood-and-mirror decor and new-fashioned flatscreen TVs for all your sports-watching pleasure.  Wasn't my first choice in the neighborhood, but we were thirsty and the place that we wanted to drink was closed (as in, now a different business).    Happy hour is half-price (i.e. $3) draft pints, currently including Widmer's, Sierra Nevada, and Stella Artois.  Pretty good deal, and that Widmer's is nice and refreshing on a warm day.  The crowd seemed fine to me, at least on a Friday late afternoon.  There was a good mix of types, and my friend and I chatted with a nice older couple who had just moved here from DC and had spent some time in Chicago, where we are both from.    As a bonus, the female bar and wait staff are across-the-board hot.

JRfrK4f3b5kCgO_t2mU0FA.review_text: Crowded but not over crowded.  Plus ample bar real estate if you don't get a table.  Huge HD TVs with mirrors to get an angle from any seat.  Relatively timely service given how many customers were in there.  Great chicken tenders.  Good drinks.

a3D4H3wlmecIGutD4njt8A.review_text: not a fan of hot sweaty crowded bars layout is cool prices were a little high but not overwhelming be a cool place when not so crowded total frat boy attitudes there

Omt3R9h3hj5JB9wt3_WXFg.review_text: Blog Post - dabblewith.com/2013/05/1… I've been to Harry's Bar on Fillmore a handful of times and each time there is a crowds but you can manage to grab a seat. Harry's Bar is a well-known watering hole to the Pacific Heights neighborhood for over 35 years. George Karas and Rick Howard purchased Harrys Bar from Harry Denton in 2001. Since then the two have a built a reputation for taking over existing bars in San Francisco. George Karas and Rick Howard also own: Brunos (since 2006), Owl Tree (since 2008), Pj's Oysterbed (since 2009) and Eddie Rickenbacker (2012). Harry's Bar delivers the expected with well to do pacific heights clientele matching the ambiance with its dark cherry wood bar. The bartenders are entertaining and the cocktail menu is definitely something worth trying out. I would recommend Harry's Bar for watching games, grabbing a quick bite, and  group gatherings. There always seems to be just the right amount of room. harrys-04Cocktails: New/ specialty cocktails are written on the mirror behind the bar. Lavender Lady #9 22 Fillmore 10 Fresh Mango Mojito Food: Veggie Quesadilla: Swiss, cheddar, grilled onions, mushrooms, peppers in flour tortilla w/salsa, sour cream, guacamole Kobe Hamburger:  Snake River Farms all natural Kobe

Dt4WS7GTtIR0kL7ENXnZDA.review_text: This bar is no good. The beer selection is bad. The DJ in the corner is a bit weird and doesn't seem to fit in with the overall environment. Too crowded (surprisingly). I wouldn't have came here but for a friend's birthday party, and now I'll be sure not to come back.

c-3RIdRwgECqjVHIUM_Y9g.review_text: Dive-bar ambiance (which, granted, can be a nice change from some of the other places on Fillmore St), but they still charge Pac. Heights prices. Food is mediocre, beer/wine selection is somewhat lacking. About all they have going for them is the full bar, which seems to be fairly unusual in the immediate area, so if you're in the neighborhood and desperately want a mixed drink, I guess you come here. Otherwise, there are plenty of better places within walking distance, and plenty of better bars elsewhere in the city.

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: I've had the French Fries - Good Bloody Mary's - Good (The celery was snappy fresh) Service - Good Nice outdoor seating but can be annoying when people smoke outside.

uiBh4IqocuHOzhM0XllqtQ.review_text: This is by fair my favorite bar to visit in the City. It's a convenient walk down the hill from my friends house so needless to say the nights here have been debaucherous. Good friends, great jukebox, friendly bartenders, and a laid back crowd that is just having fun.  New Year's here was glorious! Four of us went to the dinner to reserve table room and the people next to us at dinner were nice enough to let us take over their table.  A group of 20 total, we took over the front corner of this bar and danced on tables, broke sooo many glasses and brought in the New Year.  No one said a word (bar tabs were hefty).   Since the bar is so close to our friends house we have eaten lunch here on occasion as well.  The burgers are fantastic, salads were fresh, soup tasty, and the selection of beer is good.  Overall Harry's is a great place to go at all times of day and for any occasion! Five stars.

D6cTXACqfpjJlBrj-EN52w.review_text: I've been coming here to watch the Giants Games and its A-OK with me here.  happy hour beer special includes 3 dollars for a Fat Tire and that is one Fat-Tire that I can roll with.

khX_0HzTxqyv91TiXwK_6g.review_text: four stars for the type of place it is.  An unpretentious place to get a drink and some basic pub grub while watching a game.  But it doesn't feel like a sports bar so you can drop by for a cocktail as well.  Just enough class to appeal to male and female alike.

hkOiI-ctPYFuurzJZF6H9Q.review_text: I owe Harry's an apology.  I always overlook it, never really think of it when thinking about my neighborhood, yet I've ended up having great stories come out of my Harry's nights:  watched the Giant's lose to the A's there; spent my last day of l-school there; met my first real live little person there... It's plush couches and well placed tv's seem to attract good stories... if you can score the couches by the entrance you're in luck - great people watching both inside and out!

ADZ5c4IcZBEMVdT4EhXvyA.review_text: I love Harry's. I live in the neighboorhood and have been coming here for years. It's got everything you want out of a bar. Great drinks, great food and an awesome staff.  I've recently discovered Fish Taco Friday. Two fish tacos on corn tortillas with homemade mango salsa- pair it with a $3 draft beer during happy hour and I'm a happy camper. Their fries are also to die for. I'm not sure what they do to those black truffle fries but they are AMAZING! the bar and wait staff are also really friendly. I'm always greeted with a very friendly hello and receive stellar service. All in all a great neighborhood bar.

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: 3 - 3.5  Great layout, great bar, great bartenders, great tunes.  Around 10 it was packed, around 10:45 it wasn't, around 12 it was (on a Friday night).  Sweet tea vodka was delicious but I had too many of that plus beer plus whiskey shots and spent too much money :(

UzUnpnlH1n346MDgaFMOmw.review_text: First time (and probably last) at this little neighborhood bar.  Though this would generally be considered my after-work spot, I can't say that I will frequent the place (unless accompanied by large #'s of Yelp Elite of course).     I like the actual space (cool plasma's showing old-school movies, nice dark atmosphere), service was alright, music was rough (though they did play a decent round of Bon Jovi), but in general the crowd here is too much frat-boy for my tastes.

xyNdK7m0i1Y4pb4gJicA6g.review_text: A bar that is known for their burgers... unusual, no?  The interior is elegant, with deep polished wood, brass, and carpet. A refined place with a beautiful bar and booth seating. Would have been great for a romantic date. You wouldn't tell though, from the raucous preppy 30s white professionals that cram up the place. It gets very loud and very cramped. The music blares to compete, as does the overhead TVs glued to the sports channel.  Some people come here to have one of Harry's famous burgers or munchies (around $8-$13) with their drink (around the same price). Others come to oggle Harry's infamously hot waitresses and bartenders in their tight baby tees. It depends on your particular poison.  Be nice to the bouncer. He will be nice to you.

ZdmI7y9vMb2_8EIZk5i75w.review_text: Now, keep in mind that I came here for the first time when the Giants won the world series. The bar was absolutely packed, it was elbow to elbow and there was a line outside that was most likely not going to be let in. The servers were on top of refilling everyone's drinks and letting us know of any specials going on. When the Giants won, the place was crazy. They had a perfect ipod playlist of songs to celebrate the winning and even played songs inbetween commercials. I'd love to check this place out again. It seems to be in a great location, with lots of shops and boutiques nearby.

M5eUNWQMrpHu8Hne1HzeJA.review_text: Hey folks!  This is PAC HEIGHTS, not the Marina, BIG DIFFERENCE!  You may meet some snobby turds here, but do not confuse with the Marina snob.  (BTW, I know not everyone in the Marina is a snob, b/c many of my friends live there)  Harry is a great man.  Classy, decor is nice, his burgers are tasty, and he always sends me on my way spinning and staring at stars.  The crowd is pleasant, music is good, and I love the flat screens covering most of the place with different sports on each one.  They also turn lacrosse on for me - thank you!  Each day there is a special, and Mondays are the burger special! =)

A6jJ20wf9AauCAi_qVvuWw.review_text: I like the burgers, cheesy music, and the typical bar feel.  Crowd sucks though.  Walk 5 blocks to Divisadero for better bars.

TNo1aPj4p9mXkHBR0uHfEg.review_text: meh... I live in the neighborhood and avoid this place most of the time. The reason is that this place is usually overfilled with tools and just not very inviting. The service is pretty bad.   Drinks are ok...not much else to say. Great place for a douche bag gathering.

rE6ILt6TLU3pqlzrgB9Ntw.review_text: Prices on menu may not accurately reflect prices you pay.  Apparently they had been apprised of a situation where the menu price was $1 lower than the actual price of an item, yet failed to honor the advertised price.  While the mirror clearly showed a higher price for said item, it also had said item listed with a different name.  I recommend steering clear of this place.  I will not be returning.

UXCbdc_Tksomv3bORw38sw.review_text: I was a bit skeptical to try this place - I always got the "Marina-Frat-Fake-Blonde" vibes while walking by..   However, I was pleasantly surprised after meeting a friend for brunch - $10 bottomless Bellini's, delicious waffles & spicy baked chilaquiles...couldn't have been better! The service was also good and decor was comfortable & classy. I will definitely return!

yB_XGeC5v74Y7x507ep8xw.review_text: I still haven't found a better burger in the bay area that's comparable to Harry's. It's oh-so-good with grilled onions and mushrooms. The drinks sure can get pricey! I ordered a vodka cran (KetelOne) which wasn't strong and it was $11! I like coming here on Mondays when you can get a drink, burger and fries for $11. Yes, one of the best tasting fries, too! Usually pretty crowded and servers are nice; hostess okay. MONDAY BURGER SPECIAL - Monday 4PM - 11PM; $10.95 Burger special. Harry's classic burger and a drink. Choose a draft beer, house wine or well cocktail. harrysbarsf.com/promotio…

mZokz37TaR5jFgMrx4WyFw.review_text: Just came for the beers at their nice long bar.  Crowded (it was a Thursday night) but I felt like the staff was attentive and cordial.  A little chaotic, especially when you contrast it to the peaceful Grove next door.

vn8nPLA7J_GkHEiW5vEmbA.review_text: We stopped in here on a really exhausting saturday night after attempting to shop and study at the same time.    I ordered the chicken tacos, Tori got a Turkey Panini, Elizabeth got the calamari, and Chris got the Kobe Beef sliders.  Everyone seemed to really hungry when we first got there.  But everyone could only eat 1/2 of their food.  Except me.  I had to eat it all and really fast.  And now, this morning, as I lie in bed in my fluffy purple fuzzy robe trying not to be sick, I wish i'd ordered a salad.    In defense of this place, it seemed like a really happening spot.  There were a bunch of Asian Gangsta-wanna be, J-pop dress a-likes, and they played musical chairs.  Pretty asian girls drinking fruity sweet syrups, blond stylish girls dressed like asian girls drinking beer.  A happening spot.  But a sinking place for food.  So, see, Chris, this is not a negative review.  I was truthful about the food (Meh, I've experienced better), but I gave a shout out to all the trendy Asian ta-ta crowds that like to squeeze in here between the velvet chaise and that spiky haired Sonic the Hedgehog look-a-like.  Does he really think that will help him get laid?  Maybe a paper bag.

9yuOMbrURP4we2CIZVuGdA.review_text: This is a fun place, the crowd is definitely preppie but hello?!  You're in Pac Heights!  The burgers are decent, the service is good, and I highly recommend the mozzarella sticks!  Not a place I would plant all night but perfect for a quick bite to start the night!

7e4CioqxGMByqh0lJP5FZg.review_text: I tried their coveted burger and was pleasantly surprised, four stars. While the space is humorously cozy, the crowd is bizarre. My girlfriends asked repeatedly to move on to another joint, which we did. Apparently, the mixture of "never been with a woman", hopeless young men and regulars that circle the door like sharks in search for new prey was more evident to the ladies than what I observed. Women in general, are much smarter than men and are far more perceptive, so I give this place one star for the crowd. Hence, three stars. I suppose if you live near by, one might find this place convenient for a quick beer. The problem with Harry's is that there is nothing special about this place.

jGwctRACex2yuxbVgRzD1w.review_text: Harry's has a really busy, young crowd that makes it appealing. I tend to come here to mingle and meet up with friends. My partner and I got the french fries and a couple beers, and they serve some good sauces with the fries.If you're more hungry, their burger is very tasty.  The service was fast, but almost a little too fast. I like to linger and spend some quality time with my significant other, and finish with a nice cup of coffee or tea. But sometimes I feel like the plates were coming out too fast and not allowing for people-watching and conversation. But, maybe, for the after-work crowd, fast service is more desirable.  I'd recommend this place if you want a busy, fun atmosphere with a large group of friends.

NwdJgZaorL2r9X6NhaVMBA.review_text: Truffle fries are delicious. The fish tacos and BBQ steak sandwich were also very good. The place was pretty packed when we got there. Overall good environment and would go back again.

VxLYSHb1Vggp1tBHYtR4-w.review_text: What's not love? The food is good, the drinks are stiff and the scenery! Get in good with one of the barmaids or server's and you can be treated like Norm on Cheers every time you roll in! As a card-carrying member of the Swedish Triumvirate (Sven to be exact) with a 24/7 reservation for the back booth I have no complaints save one. They used to have an Atomic Chicken Sandwich which has since been axed from the menu. Bring it back for a fifth star, and I'll reconsider spending my Saturday Night's screaming out Livin' on Prayer with 60 or so of my closest friends and pouring some out for Henrik and Bjorn! And to my fellow men . . . don't break the seal and go before you leave the house, it's just that easy. PS: Depending on the time of night, the planters at the grove work too.

5wH18UFgZ3yLXLFFmUMZIg.review_text: No clue why I gave this place 4 stars. I watched most of the World Cup games over the summer and the 2007 NFC/AFC Championship games here with one of my buddies and I don't think we snagged a seat but for a couple hours. At the same time, the crowd is decent, the food is better-than-average and they make a mean Bloody Mary. If you don't like the people in the Marina, don't come here - it is a little 35 yr old frat-boy/ sorority queen heavy.

GXn4ZsasLKh0qZ5g3nIqcQ.review_text: Harry's has disarmed the rowdy pub feel of their establishment by giving you posh seating and really nice TV's on the wall. But you can still come in looking like a scrub, order a beer and one of the best bar burgers the city has to offer. Perfect for a casual late night drink or a leisurely date on a sunny Saturday afternoon with their large, open windows and outside seating.

XvKdp9PB4rKJKwI798mJgg.review_text: I really enjoyed my French toast, but the service could have been better. They took forever to take our orders, and many of us got bottomless mimosas (which you can only order for an hour and a half), but they never came back to refill us so some felt they did not get what they paid for. Would come back to watch sports.

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: My expectations were too high. Not quite a chi-chi as I imagined it would be looking from the exterior. The drinks were kind of on the expensive side. Nothing I hated about it, but a little boisterous and not relaxing. I went to a bar with the same name in Amsterdam. Not sure if it was the same owner, but I liked that incarnation way better.

fHb-RTrsg7kKfIe2XxiEbg.review_text: Great Place to sip cocktails before or after shopping , Check. Great place to catch a quick drink with co-worker/friend after work, check. Great Place to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon, Check. Great Place to meet new friends...NOT SO MUCH. I love the speakeasy and rich decor, and their mixed drinks but the crowd isn't always so cool. My recomendation is to come nosh on some snacks and sip some of their (pricey, but good) mixed drinks and then move on to your next destination for the night. My faves Raspberry mojitos and Peach martinis. I'm told if you come on a Monday you'll get some great happy hr deals!

rKkpHJkJ27xOwnhy_bMkvA.review_text: This place is OK. It's a dimly light sports bar with limited seating.  I ordered a burger and fries, and both were good. Nothing spectacular. Our server was prompt and friendly and took good care of us.  Overall, it's a chill place to watch games, but there is nothing worth writing home about.

m-2lsMLw6H140wVhGCa-Tw.review_text: Went there last night. Pretty decent crowd early on. Beer selection is okay , and beer prices are okay. I'd go again but it would have to be one of the stops for a night and not THE stop. Decent number of big screens but not all are high def. Good location on Fillmore though.

WFu7vUIuQ3qcHHGZhsZrGg.review_text: Leaving soon gonna miss all the good times had here!  Good drinks...food menu might need to be retooled.

PABIXXEx_6ykhF7I6_Fu-A.review_text: The only reason to frequent this bar is on Monday's for its 8 buck burger and beer night. Great turkey and Kobe beef burgers....crisp fries, and cold beers. They have a decent cadillac margarita, but for all intents and purposes this is the kind of place frequented by the after work professional crowd and the Marina folks that want to stake their territory lines well beyond Van Ness...not that there is anything wrong with that.

84_dntKzc1B3E_TfBeakpg.review_text: This place is overcrowded with the kind of boys who push girls to get them out of their way, it's called excuse me. Unfortunately the waitresses also leave a lot to be desired in terms of service. On the other hand they do serve a solid grilled cheese with tomato and avocado and the mango mojitos are almost too good to be true.  I do like you Harry's Bar just before 10pm.

RZJd7l-GyqHT24F7dQFT2w.review_text: Great nachos and good burgers (the burgers aren't as good as Sliders.) But I loved the ambiance with the leather couches and  tables near the window for people-watching.  It's not the laid back hangout I was expecting.  Maybe during the day it is, but not at night.  Girls wore their weekend-best tops and heels.  OH, and there were a lot of good looking guys :)

kLh6DJKLi9c46NqIokmPaA.review_text: Harry's combines everything I could want in a bar: it combines a sports bar with multiple TVs with a classy spot for a cocktail. I can sit at a cozy table, watch baseball, sip a pomegranate martini on the rocks, and talk the night away. Sure, the drinks aren't exactly at rock-bottom prices and the staff gets busy and a little cold on occasion, but take it with a grain of salt. I just enjoy that I feel equally comfortable here for an after-work beer or a Saturday night birthday gathering.   The dining options are pretty good for a sports bar: my favorites are the Mushroom Burger and the Grilled Cheese (I'm a classy girl!). French fries are deliciously greasy and great for when you realize you might be drinking more than you should.   Speaking of drinking too much....   A word of caution: Beware the votive candles on the bar, they have a habit of attacking errant strands of hair and igniting said hair. Not that I would know that from first-hand experience. I'm definitely smoother than that. I swear. If it might have been me, I might have been very lucky that the cute boy I was trying to talk to somehow thought the fiery hair was more endearing than anything else.

0L1-6hDowdoVzV3DpPcdKg.review_text: This place seemed pretty large, but it was probably all the mirrors they had around the walls.  This place was packed when we got there, but we were able to squeeze into a corner table.  The drinks were about normally priced but the atmosphere was what made the place.  The bar was full but there were still only 2 bartenders working which made drinking difficult.

0qaI3F0KpKt-r5YZQyI8MQ.review_text: perfect local hangout.. the atmosphere ranges from casual sports fans, to drunken men in suits, to old couples, to girls out on the town... always a good time, either a place to hide out at your own table with your friends or mingle at the bar, however the bar area is pretty slim so maneuvering your way around is hard-- hope that you'll find one or two people you wouldn't mind talking to for a long time...  my housemate is obsessed with the truffle fries...   i love the burgers, but the tacos are too messy...

xtZMctl7AQNspIL_SF3guA.review_text: Two years ago I would have given this place a 5-star for the mere fact that they had great burgers and are located five blocks from my apartment. Since then, the service has gone downhill and the burgers are just average. Still a great place to grab a few drinks with friends before heading out on the town for the evening, especially if you live in the neighborhood.

ZrW5ejGgZwfj-yVnlOXVqg.review_text: Had my last meal at Harry's before leaving back to LA.  Good place to watch Sunday football and have bottomless belinis.  We had brunch and I ordered the Egg sandwich.  It was good but i would have rather had the sweet potato fries with it than the regular potatoes.  The organic mac and cheese was excellent with Tabasco.  The waffles were fluffy and the mixed fruit was refreshing.  My bf had the Kobe burger but he said it was whatever.  Pros: Sweet potato fries Mac and cheese Bottomless belinis Atmosphere  Cons: Could be a long wait for a table Rest of the food was nothing really special You only have 1.5hrs for bottomless belinis

g1o6jFWuKfyXowASCxrp2g.review_text: My friends and I came to Harrys for New Years 2011. We had a table and an amazing waitress, Carley. The food was only average, but the menu was fixed for the night so I didn't have a chance to order my usual favorites. When I have come before and ordered off the regular menu, I have never been disappointed. On New Years, Carley made sure I was never without a drink in my hand she was so, so sweet. Some people can be bitter about working on New Years, but Carley didn't seem to be at all. In retrospect, I should have tipped her way, way more. Next time you see her, be sure to tip her well- she deserves it!

34bU3gnSHUFHNPLNvwl8fA.review_text: It's basically the marina crowd that got tired of the marina. The bar is doesn't offer anything particularly special, although the first time i went there, i saw peter gallagher's ass... that was rather... uh... disgusting.

KM7B9GLQVFnk9BCYyKF0-w.review_text: horrible customer service by the servers on Sunday evenings. they were more concerned about talking to the friends when working.

KY5-kJziOKeqSH-GI4l6vA.review_text: I've been a huge fan of Harry's and spend a lot of time here, especially during football season.  I like the neighborhood environment where you can go for a burger, night out or just a casual drink.  However, the last few months I've been a bit disappointed in a few things here--the food and music.  The menu changed a bit and the burgers AND fries are nothing like they used to be.  And the music-- Harry's would be the place you would go, feel 'at home' and have the great rock, oldies and 80's music blaring.  Now, there's a DJ on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights which I think really takes away from the great atmosphere Harry's once had.  A bunch of us girls ended our night at Harry's last night and let's just say we were ALL disappointed in not only the music but also the 'club' feel it's transforming into.  I want the old Harry's back--where you know the words to all the songs playing, don't need to worry about 'the scene' and can go and feel at home.

IDVX4Is4CanREchBmpFXoA.review_text: I've changed my mind. This place isn't awesome. In fact, the crowd really sucks and the drinks are presumptuously overpriced. However, I will stick to my original assertion that they offer up one of the best burgers in San Francisco, and its reasonably priced at $6.95. Of course, the rub is that's for the plain burger with fries, and where they end up making most of their money I suspect is the dollar you pay for each additional item you want thrown on your burger such as grilled onions, cheese, sauteed mushrooms etc. (not to mention the pricey drink specials). Other bar foods are tasty here as well, but the real draw for me is the quality burger.

c0ILFQ6Oyccsc8UoyoMPSw.review_text: I used to like Harry's.  But now, whenever I step in the door I'm already planning my escape route.  Lucky for them, it seems as though it's consistently packed Wed thru Sat nights.  But it's not a fun packed.  It's a "I'm gonna need to hire a 350 lbs pulling guard to get to the bar or bathroom" kind of packed a lot of nights... And if you do get a table, don't get your hopes up about the service - the girls may be hot, but the attentiveness is lacking.   I'm sure that it still does the trick for some - good place to trap a coug, no doubt.

vQ4IV9xP_t-lfj0eGE46hA.review_text: I really try to avoid Harrys at almost all costs. I spend a lot of time on Fillmore but almost none at Harrys. Their servers are usually unfriendly and seem annoyed that I'm only ordering a beer. When I did try and order a mojito on a sunny day while I was sitting outside, the mint was not muddled at all and the lack of simple syrup made it taste horrible. On top of it, the times I have been in there its as though been invaded by a bunch of rude, drunk, pretentious jerks. If you'd rather go for a more chill scene with nice people, go across to the Elite, grab a beer at Thai Stick or the Grove, or head down to California and Divisadero to Solstice.

YlJNqoHqIssCHP25h2sUFA.review_text: Can you rate a bar after only spending 90 minutes here, one time?  Well, I am.  Within walking distance of Neha S's pad - check Within walking distance of Vivande - check They have TUACA - check, check  So I really wasn't here long enough to give you good idea of the vibe.  It was quite loud (Tuesday night) and it was almost Sports Bar-ish with it's flat screens showing the Giant's game.  Crowd seemed a bit Marina-ish - they waitress could've sworn my sunglasses were Dior.  Had to break it to her that they were $15 at Aldo Accessories.     Regardless, we had a good time drinking our Tuaca, and I'd more than likely come back here again if I were in the 'hood.

4MzTss4Hn2sVvwb317xxpw.review_text: Lychee pineapple martini--delicious.  Worth 8 dollars?  Unsure.  Pretty crowded at 9pm on a Friday night, but lots of tables.  I'd like to come back and get a burger.  Also--why doesn't anywhere in SF have cider?  I know POPS does!

EV-3Nwxuy3IOsCn6nQUoXw.review_text: I live three blocks from this place. I have only eaten here once but will be returning. I thought the food was good and the service was very nice. Our server was very attentive and polite. It gets pretty crowded so get here early for a good seat.  The menu is pretty limited (mainly burgers) but it is a great place to go if you are craving a burger on a sunny day. Also great for stopping and getting a few drinks with friends (and to watch sporting events).

X9NXcUK6nkcUPJs3qNT6qA.review_text: Unfortunately, my older brother is a fan of marina bars. Bad taste must be a recessive gene or something (he also owns the Steven Seagal dvd anthology). Even he couldn't stand this place.  Not too long ago, we decided to give it a try since it is the only marina bar I haven't been to and don't already loathe. We parked nearby, which was pretty easy, and walked in. That's as far as we got. You know those videos you see sometimes of a crowded New York sidewalk? Imagine that...in a bar...nothing but guys wearing striped shirts and Marina "women" with spray on tans who look like the type that carry dogs around in handbags (the kind that make my penis recoil in horror).  We walk up, show our IDs to the bouncer, walk through the door, observe the crowd, turn around and immediately walk out. It is the closest this clumsy Irish doofus has ever come to doing a pirhouette. For that, Harry's, I thank you.

F4li3HnfS4gY5IeMSPkGcg.review_text: If you're looking to catch a game or hang out with friends after work, Harry's might be a good spot to consider.  It's not a place to sit and talk, but if you don't mind standing and you like an upbeat crowd, go to Harry's.    The last time I was there I also liked the drink special.  It was a cherry vodka and some crushed mint leaves, bitters and a dash of sweet & sour...kinda like a cherry margarita.  Be sure you check the board to the left of the main bar for their special if you're looking for a change of pace from the typical beer / whiskey options that usually go with the game.  Food was just bar food.  Burgers, fried stuff, etc so hearty, but not healthy.

O968pIXwwj4YIQWjudEAkg.review_text: A sunny afternoon my friends and I nabbed a patio spot and grabbed a few bellini's and some chips/salsa/quacamole.    Nothing above average about this place but it made for an enjoyable experience.  The drinks were delicious and the appetizer was standard.  The servers were friendly and attentive.  Inside was a bit dark and stuffy feeling which made sitting on the patio a plus.  However, those who like college football would be able to view the popular games on the tv's.

KPe1lPzx5viLrOgre5k_3A.review_text: Not my kind of crowd.  A noticeable lack of funky eclectic faces.  Stiff atmosphere.  Overpriced drinks.    I thought the bartenders were friendly.  Maybe it was just the shift.  And yes, I'm enough of a caveman to dig their outfits.  But I would never go here on purpose.

a-CtXGkmHkaaXSvnOLFxOg.review_text: I really like this place!  Their burgers are delicious, and it's especially good to go Mondays at Happy Hour.  Don't order any soda though - it tastes gross and watery.  This place would be a lot cooler if they repainted the walls - the clown face surrealist mural they have going on is really ugly.  The atmosphere is kind of frat-boy-ish, which is why the poor waitresses are forced to wear skin tight black pants that say "Harry's" across the butt.  The more I write about this place, the more I wonder why I like it.... I guess I just really, really like the burgers.

-l0VLqH6lvXEdFDbGTclSA.review_text: Meet a group of 7 friends here for some drinks and a light dinner this weekend. Overall it was an average experience. Drinks were OK, food was typical bar food. Crowd was between 30 and 40 with a wide range of styles.  Not bad but wouldn't go out of my way to go here.  I did find that it worked wekk for groups as long as you get a table.

VG-toQE2YcjDlmgvLni2ew.review_text: Party of 3 of us were wandering around the 'More looking for a place to nibble after visiting a family member who was hospitalized over at Cal-Pacific Med Center.  We were lucky to be there at Happy Hour (3-6pm) when pints of Stella & Fat Tire are $3!  We also had the Calamari, Mozarella & Wings appetizers.  I had the roasted turkey sandwich, which was excellent.  Very nice, clean upscale bar with HD big screen tv's that were turned into sports stations.  All of us loved the place and the ambiance.  Looked like a cross-section of all types of people from tourists to the after-work crowd.  Solid service.  Good luck with parking in this bustling district however.

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: Came here to meet up with friends that were watching the final four game to grab a drink (raspberry stoli lemon drop - yum!).  This place was crowded with so many people, it was hard to talk in there b/c it was so loud.  Seating is limited and most people are standing and blocking the walkway so there is none behind the bar stools.  I would avoid this place when it's busy.

NCm2jj55oF9tr7r8zv3GIA.review_text: This is my kind of sport's bar!!!  You got the crowd(pack), drinks (hawaiian martini  is great), pretty faces, hip area, shopping locations n' closer walks to cars or nice area to walk around for when bf or husband are big fans superbowl, nba finals, world cups..........  update: kobe burger is good

YSDhmkxZ84eIzaG-5Z6jBg.review_text: Run-of-the-mill bar filled with Marina-types. Walking in on a Saturday night, we had to push through a crowd of gawking dudes. I don't get it--why do people have to stand and stare about 3 feet from the bar, blocking both the path and the bar?  The bartenders were really nice, as were the servers, and the drinks were relatively cheap. And while the crowd seemed a bit yuppie, the overall vibe  was pretty relaxed.   I'm not sure if Saturday night is the best time to go here, but I'd probably come back for happy hour if I were in the neighborhood.

c8qFkI_VusWo0xZvkjfBWQ.review_text: I used to go every Monday for the $6.99 burger, fries, and a beer special for almost 3 months.   Any other day it's still the best burger and fries for only $5.99.  Way better than Johnny Rockets down the street, and cheaper too.  I do NOT like the crowd in the evenings, it's full of the yuppie alpha male fratboy types then.

hFvLaKDNHMxHze13Hd-FZQ.review_text: I liked Harry's before I moved to the neighborhood, and now I like it even more, since it's less than 2 blocks from my apartment.   Harry's is like The Matrix or Balboa Cafe, but on the other side of Fillmore, landing it in lower Pac Heights.   There is always a "scene" at Harry's, and the drinks, burgers, etc, speak for themselves. Last night, I was super digging the $5 Skyy Vodka specials, especially the pineapple daiquiri, and the parmesean-truffle oil fries were so tasty, and so salty.   The major downsides to Harry's is the narrow-bar/difficulty getting seating, and also only ONE toilet in the women's room.

clsUcSMUxmlpdcvnVPLeoQ.review_text: Yes I've definitely experienced better! Late review but much deserved!  Ok let's start this story like all yelp reviews with a little background on why I rate it 2 stars.  Harry's is definitely one of the places where you've been there and dont that!   Me and my party of 10, came for brunch, the bottomless bellini's has been drawing us to Harry's for the past year and we were the FREQUENT Saturday brunch crew.  So mind you, we've been a loyal friggin customer to this place.  Me friends and friends of their friends were all in town for the UNR game at AT&T and everyone was hyped up for the pep rally at union square. We came  around "10:50" and waited for the doors to open since for everyone wanted to make it in time to the peprally. The hostess or manager came out side to say, "I'm sorry but we're not open yet." #Ho I think we know that, that's why we're waiting for the doors to open and it's 10:50!  Finally they opened the doors and we sat and waited for the server. A group of 10 showing up that early to this brunch place should've made the bartender(bitch with the tattoo's on) happy. Little did we know, she had the nerve to say we were making too much noise. Bitch isn't this a bar and you do realize people have to talk to communicate right? Ok, one of our friends was on the loud side but still, the bartender of a C U Next Tuesday shouldn't have scolded at us like that. Plus the place was friggin empty!!!  We get our drinks and eventually ordered. More people came in and most of them were out of towners or locals who were also going to the UNR pep rally. So the boys being boys, started a chant for their school team. The bartender with the tattooes chimed in and started screaming at us to shut up and that if we can put it out then we can take it.  Bitch, I'm not even drunk yet. I had like two bellini's down and this hoochie had the nerve to talk back to patrons and my friends. Your job is to serve so how about you pour us more drinks because we're paying for your rent/cocaine habit. I had to hold back my "keeping it real" moment until we paid.   The bill came out to 500 dollars btw. Which we all tipped too. I normally would be like, NO TIP for the TATTOOED BARTENDER C U NEXT TUESDAY but my friends, friends were out of town guests who felt bad that after all, she's just a bartender.  OK LET'S KEEP IT REAL. THE FOOD ISN'T ALL THAT GREAT. I'VE HAD BETTER BAR FOOD. BRUNCH - BOTTOMLESS BELLINI'S SOUND LIKE A GREAT IDEA BUT THERE IS A TIME LIMIT. CHECK OUT OTHER GREAT PLACES WHERE THEY DON'T RESTRICT YOU AND THE FOOD IS ACTUALLY REALLY GOOD!  THE DRINKS ARE OK, AVOID THE TATTOOED BARTENDER!  Overall, Harry's Brunch they like to herd people in and rush them out! Would I go back? HELL NO!   There's so many other great places in the city!

VfZ62dxri2CxsSBXgrzqsg.review_text: Started around 5:00 on a Saturday and it seemed like an okay place, but it got weird and crowded fast. Freaky bartenders and pushy patrons. I wouldn't have noticed if I'd been as intoxicated as the other clowns, but 3 beers in was not nearly enough.  I did have a decent burger here, though.

iK5oMORPCmoWUmannptD-Q.review_text: Great bar to watch football. They have all the games on various screens around the bar. The service has always been great. The food about average and the price was reasonable. Get there early if you want to catch a game.

eHy6p5DOZjEbvm7GFvJKuw.review_text: Worst experience today, our waitress Michelle was rude and blamed us for bringing the wrong food. My husband ordered a turkey sandwich, but she wrote turkey burger. When we mentioned that he didn't order a burger her answer was "well, when people say 'turkey' I assume it's a burger, you should have stressed sandwich!" He told her that he did say sandwich and she insisted that he didn't repeat it so it was his mistake. I then asked her for morel water, but never got a refill. When we got out bill I noticed we got charged for the burger not the sandwich. The waitress says "oh wow, it's only a $1 difference, I'll give you the $1" which she then threw on the table!!! I used to love this place but after tonite I'm not sure we will be back. Michelle is by far why some waitresses get a bad rep!

C6qExAutKzFRAQJSmGY_Jg.review_text: i like the atmosphere of harry's... and appetizers were pretty tasty... but we had really bad service, and the so-called famous bloody mary's were not very good.

TcegfUu6Txv7QfaytanaRg.review_text: The food here is ok, it doesn't suck, but it's not anything that special. I had the Kobe burger and it was your normal burger. Not too juicy, not too dry, but not too flavorful either.    Come here for the hot chicks, but I say take a few shots at home before coming here because the price of the drinks and food are going F your wallet like a prison rape!!

omA8E9OVn4w3lBBmnYmMJQ.review_text: Relatively generic bar, probably not a destination spot.   You'll certainly never catch me in there on a Friday or Saturday night or any other time it's packed for that matter because you'll never be able to get your drink refilled.  Oh yeah, you'd be standing too because there will be no place left to sit.  If you're like me and you go out alone a lot that's pretty uncomfortable to just be standing there with a drink in your hand and no place to sit.  On a slower night though with a couple of friends and you've got an attentive bartender or waitress it's decent enough.  If I remember right I think I had a pretty tasty mac and cheese here too...

iEglBT7v2Z0NaoQio6VbAQ.review_text: Tried out Harry's finally and left with a smile. I had the Kobe Burger and my wife had the Mac and Cheese. One of my wife's life-long disappoints has been not finding great Mac and Cheese. Harry's Bar turned the trend around. The Mac and Cheese was a pasta in an alfredo sauce topped with cheddar cheese. The Mac and Cheese gets a well deserved "B."

xqg8EihBjem6EFYtdKoBjQ.review_text: They have the best fries.  Yum. The server was super friendly and efficient, even though the place was totally packed.  I can't wait to go back to try it when I don't have to share my eating space with obnoxious Hillary '08 supporters, who rudely hovered over us while eating, then decide that it is totally okay for them to put their dirty hors d'oeuvres plate down right in my face so that they can squeal over the election returns.

1xvmDofA0MvWDSD2hJAvyw.review_text: Oh how I love Harry's.  It's mostly only cool when it's not too crowded.  I can't really handle it on the weekends when you literally can't move through the place.  But during the week its a great place to hang.  It has an old SF vibe to it.  It's a long narrow bar lined with mirrors.  There's a raised area for small tables and seating.  And then a few more casual seating spots up in the front.  They have a great Monday special.  It's something along the lines of a burger and a pint for $7!  And I honestly think they have one of the best burgers in the city!  They make some fancy cocktails which you'll see etched into the mirror above the bar and they have big TV screens for games or movies.  Sometimes the music is a little too loud, but what are you gonna do.  I still love you Harry.

sgTNHoh04BaPE3xMVpFCDQ.review_text: On a Friday night, I have pretty high expectations for a bar.  Had this been a weeknight, it may have faired better.  Harry's is nothing special, but not bad either. Its a pretty run of the mill upscale cocktail bar.  There was a pretty decent crowd, but talent level was spotty besides the imports. I did a little scouting in this hood while waiting for some talent. I believe the big reason it suffers is because there is little else in this hood, and thus very little bar hop traffic.  On the plus, they had a fantastic pomegranate margarita and made a mean dirty gin martini.   Haiku !  Warm oak, dim lighting Can't these people dress better ? Pom tequila Nom.  Talent ? Great for a weeknight, weak for a Friday.

X7NruZXmLRCXnYpa6ylwRg.review_text: Somebody rip that "Best Burger" plaque off of Harry's wall right now!  How dare you claim this dry piece of low grade chuck kobe beef? Have you even had wagyu beef before? My order of medium rare came out a medium/medium well. The extra roasted pepper mayonnaise only added an overwhelming pepper flavor that masked all flavors of the beef. The truffle fries redeemed nothing.   The bottomless peach bellini made with Wycliff brut and peach puree is the way to go during brunch. Apparently, Harry's Bar in Venice invented the bellini as claimed. Hard to believe there is a bar called "Harry's Bar" in Venice long ago, isn't it?

343SitEpnQj0HQDg41RIYQ.review_text: Solid bar.  Decent food. Nice regular folks. Friendly staff.

J4Jw6zrmkyaRw8PFyw8YYQ.review_text: Great people, great location and great service.  Lots of seating, fun and friendly atmosphere.  A very comfortable place to sit back and enjoy some drinks and hang out with friends.

PmrFSehNLWAn8pMWtB53Lg.review_text:
I don't love Harry's - we have a truce.
  Harry's doesn't mention that I go there way too often since I have a couple of friends who adore it and that I can devour a greek salad in about three seconds flat.  I don't mention that the ratio of annoying to sincere people is really unbalanced (I guess they could be sincerely annoying and really throw me off) and that the wine list is a complete and utter joke. 
  More stars because I have always had great service here, and because it's close.

zDWhnidBcEok7Vqnu-AnMg.review_text: i used to live literally down the block and my roommate and i would always make plans to come here but for us, plans made are meant to be broken. so we never came. but we really wanted to! it was always hoppin when we walked by  so we came back to the old hood the other day and walked in for lunch. it smelled...like a dive bar. we were uneasy for a couple minutes, but after our food came, we were delighted. then again, i have never met a kobe burger i have not liked. food and prices are your quite standard for a pub and ill came back one night for drinks

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: Crowded, yes!  Obnoxious people, yes!  But I have to say that I really do enjoy the Cobb salad.  The only reason I go.  12/04/2007  Another reason to go, the bellinis are off the hook!

hDdPhupEislu6QYMb4bCxw.review_text: I've been here a couple times in the past week and have enjoyed myself each time. The first time was on a sunday for brunch. It was packed, but the $10 bottemless peach bellinis made the wait fly by! The food was good and there was a great vibe. This sunday my friend and I returned for a relaxing glass of Malbec in the evening. It was perfect, the weather was so nice it was tropical.  the windows were open in the front seating which were all occupied and the rest of us perched along the bar. I hope to be here cocktailing/brunching very soon!!!

duymKKwUruH8GwbvcaFd0w.review_text:
I'm basing my review here on what I like and don't like about a bar.  I was here since it seems to be one of the few bars in this neighborhood and I was meeting my friend Jules here.  
  I can compliment the place on their ratio - definitely a lot of women compared to guys.  Of course the crowd wasn't quite my style for chilling and having a few drinks although the drinks were not as pricey as I would have expected.  I didn't eat anything here so I can't say anything about the food, but if you are in the hood and need a drink, this is one of the few actual bars.  I also went in just to use the bathroom earlier that evening and the bathroom works very well!

1S00XbNTwa_b0MIi_lVgoA.review_text: Negative star. I'm curious why you call yourself a sports bar when on Game 1 of the Stanley Cup Finals you 3x refuse to turn the sound on for the game as opposed to bullshit 90s rock. Only local sports? Only championship games? Get some smarter employees. Understand where your name came from (Paris/New York). I'm sitting around 30 people who just want a little sound. And to give your bar more money. Figure it out.

HUH-ajdSI28p547Kwoqhcw.review_text: Great for a neighborhood joint. The Harry's Lemonades are yummy. Gets really crowded and a little too loud for comfortable conversation.  But if you are wanting to get picked up instead of actually talking to your friends - this is a good spot.

a0DwyYWrg4LbrSinWd1Beg.review_text: Had a lovely lunch on the sidewalk: salad w/chicken and a Mimosa. Sampled their fries too. Will be back!

vxR_YV0atFxIxfOnF9uHjQ.review_text: Came here with a friend to have some drinks. It was early on a Friday night but the place was kind of busy already. We grabbed a table near the door. The servers were nice and got our drinks fast.   The funny thing we saw was a group brought in their own liquor and shot cups in a brown bag. They drank it so fast I don't think the server caught it. It's a nice bar but this group definitely ghetto-fied the place.

nSLWZEjpko87WWMv2KIq7w.review_text: Dude - such a fun Saturday night.  The Saturday night DJ Pablo is ridiculously good.  Every song he played was awesome - everything from 90's hip hop to current besties (QTip, JT, Michael Jackson, Big Pun, Craig Mack, Madonna...)  He had the whole bar on their feet dancing by the end of the night.  We even got his card hoping to pass him along to the next friend getting married.    Drinks were just fine (I had a pomegranate martini, my husband had a manhattan) and our cocktail waitress was super cute and nice.    I've definitely been there when it's been terribly crowded, hot and a lame crowd.  But I'm going back next Saturday if Pablo's there - he's that good.

yUEST-mxyXkK_3f-qwTtgg.review_text: Had the monday special: Harry's Burger + Free beer/wine/cocktail. I upgraded and added the truffle fries based on the server's recommendation. I'm glad I did, the fries are amazing. I started rolling my burger around the fries to get the flavor. I even took some of my gf's spicy buffalo wings and rolled them around my fries too. Then washed it down with the free beer. It was a good monday special.

cAAyMv71MuQ7mXT5LZ7zXA.review_text: I agree with other reviewers that it's really loud and unpleasant when it's wall-to-wall people.  Go on a weeknight for dinner.  No crowds (well, not usually) and great burgers.

MfhI88812oE4SQiW3APfsQ.review_text: Desperate women, preppy guys. Young, loud crowd. Great drinks..... a great time. (at night on Thursday-Saturday)

JMKuduMr2luu4dcWHmTM-Q.review_text: Great spot for happy hour. $3 Blue Moons (Warrior games). People here seem more interested in spending a few hours chatting rather than watching sports but still very cozy and welcoming. They have about 7 flat screen TVs. I had the chicken wings (hot), the waitress was polite. No complaints so I will be back my next time in the neighborhood.

lClAon6sKRp1HcLhq1EFzA.review_text: Shiot Harry, I think the saying is something like... Don't try to be something that you aren't.  Which is exactly what they're trying to do.  Harry's BAR not Harry's Bistro or Cafe.  I ordered a classic burger and am not sure what was classic about it.  Arrugula and pickled onions on a wheat bun???  How is that classic.  A classic burger should have two white buns, a piece of beef, LETTUCE, TOMATO, ONION and PICKLE.    Who are you Harry and why are you doing the Houdini on my Burger?  Not Impressed brotha, all I wanted was a juicy cheeseburger and a cold beer, tears...  On the upside, the beer was decently priced for an anchorsteam or IPA (forget the brand) at $4, so a good price, not great.  And my Girlfriend enjoyed her chicken sandwich on the torpedo roll, which is a glorrified name for a hoagie roll with sharp not rounded ends.   End Note, only reason we ended up going here was due to the hour wait at Dosa.

7TlOc3udM8Fp8H9UBimznA.review_text: A bit noisy and almost always crowded with the 20 - 30 year old yuppies, but the Kobe burgers are the best on the planet!!! Service was decent, an I would eat here again!'

IH1iOatR3UkGxuiZVD4Xqg.review_text: Open super late - major points here.  Good drinks.  Good snacks.  I had a great ime and I'll be back.

YVNhgD9dtNbr9Ww-yxABdg.review_text: I've only been here during the day a few times for one of the best happy hours in town.  The appetizers are good portioned and at half the price during happy hour can't be beat.  I like sitting outside on a nice day but they only have a few tables out front to do so.  My husband brings his laptop since they have free wi-fi so he can work from "home."  There's lots of comfortable seating and every spot is only a few feet away from the bar!!!!!

vSaPxmnyq8X5Ai5e0n4kew.review_text: Fun spot, great place to enjoy a leisurely afternoon day drinking or a bite. Indoor & outdoor seating, bottomless mimosas on the weekend, TV's allowing for sports to be watched. Great people watching as well!

X88abNC-oOZgcRvudRW_Cg.review_text: Stopped in during the jazz festival and found a great world cup crowd with an attentive bar staff.  Standing room only but worth it.

n_jxdgZ-7jfqWSM43L3sgQ.review_text: I went back to Harry's and realized I had been away for too long.  It's funny what a difference living 12 blocks up and over the hill makes.  The half price bottles of wine on Tuesdays is such a great deal!  We enjoyed a delicious bottle of Prosecco and shared calamari.  Of course, the company always adds to the experience, and Harry's is a great place to go with friends or a date.

XmsH14_06Ap8NGzQZY5ZOg.review_text: Me:  We did not beat the Marina crowd. Pal #1: Whatever, the girls are hot Pal #2:  And so are the guys!  Luckily, we took the barstools of a few girlswho were leaving so we got seats immediately.  I have to say, my experience would have been much less Yelpable if I had to stand .  Bartender was nice, made good drinks, and as mentioned above, plenty of stupid eye candy around.    Surprisingly fun.  Thank you hot girl in the headband standing next to me all night.  You smelt good.

YxPczw0Ge_-t2LBqzqNr2A.review_text: The first time I went here, I was like hey, this seems like a cool bar.  Lots of white yuppies which was weirdly refreshing, although probably half of them were in a frat or sorority. But crowded.   The second time I went to get dinner, it was packed as I expected but the volume in the place had to be twice as loud.  I had to scream across the table to hold a conversation with my friend, the waitress couldn't even take our orders it was so damn loud.  The music selsction was great, the only problem was they were blowing out their speakers.  They need to bring the volume down a notch.  My honest opinion is it is overrated and that is what has ruined the place.

6JeTaXe3rtyvoPQP71IbKg.review_text: I love this bar because it's a mix of of everything.   Filmore regulars, marina bros, etc.  It's very cozy and relaxing once you get a spot at the bar or the side tables.   Drinks are well made and they roll out a DJ once in a while.   Tips:  -Wonderful to just drink here at 5pm or 6 on a Saturday.    -Crowds don't usually show up until 8ish.  But if you do decide to go during peak hours, tables are usually easy to find and claim. - Bartenders are very nice and make refreshing drinks.

Q6mLCOo2ZC9Ivj6RQj9ZBw.review_text: Harry's is a great place if you're with a great group of people.  The staff is horrible, so as long as you have enough entertainment to keep your mind off of the 20 minutes you've been waiting for that mojito - then you're golden.  Last time I went, Grease was playing on the screen and the music was frat party soundtrack.   The burgers are phenomenal and the drinks are pretty damn good.  Slightly pricey, but not horrible for Pacific Heights.  All in all, not a bad place (but I live approx. 2 blocks away so I do really WANT to like this place).

WF1o6AyXm6-NovD5dFnMOg.review_text: To be honest, I'm really disappointed.  I always enjoyed coming here to grab a beer and a good ol' Route 66 burger with the fellas, but I went last night and realized they overhauled their menu and got rid of most of their burger selection.  I ended up having the Harry's Classic burger and it was smaller than a Big Mac! C'mon!  Harry's has always been a great place to grab a mid week burger and brew (never a good weekend spot) but now I might have to find another mid week oasis...

JsVB8eE-FOhJjf5hL0nNwQ.review_text: I totally agree with the 'A-Ok' average rating of this place. There's nothing extraordinary, yet nothing that was disappointing about the experience. What's cool is they accommodated our group of 9, which is generally tough on a Sunday at noon. The menu was pretty limited, more catered to lunch than incorporating typical brunch dishes. I ate the grilled cheese and tomato soup, which was yummy.

_q_z9bIwYg2q0mSNbwxmGA.review_text: I'm not often in Pac Heights, but I've been here a couple of times to meet up with friends. Last night, I watched the UCLA - Florida game here. For a bar with a Hemingway reference, it seemed post-literary. As a sports bar, it was OK. There were several big screens, and you can reserve a table in advance.  The food was good. The fries were crisp and tasty until they cooled. Same goes for the fried calamari. My friends split a burger and said it was good. They have Stella on tap, which is nice.   But in the end, a bar is about the crowd and the vibe, and it's not my scene. Far be it from me to distinguish between the crowd in a Marina bar versus those in a Pac Heights bar. To the untrained eye, both appear to be filled with well-scrubbed young white people who look back fondly on their time in the Greek system of their local university. Maybe the Kappas prefer the Marina, and the Betas chose Pac Heights, I dunno. It's just odd to be in San Francisco and see hardly anyone of color.  Oh, and the waitstaff. They seemed generally cute and friendly, both the women and the men clad in standard service industry black.  In short, this is the kind of bar in Pacific Heights you should go to if you like going to bars in Pacific Heights.  n.b. Ordering PBR in yuppie bars is a provocative act, and while I support the concept in theory, those who don't think they're going to be hassled about it should put down the bong and come back to reality.

R_0FzpImqrhCbYkDydtfXw.review_text: I've been here quite a few times, both for drinks, dinner, and brunch. this place is so overrated! The burgers are overrated, even on discount monday night. they lack anything good for food around brunch time, the bloody marys were lacking, and its always crowded. the redeeming quality being usually the crowd is full of attractive women.

9AkVFSJm_lWZ7OUXwEHjXw.review_text: I liked this place! We came here to watch the Sharks playoff game, which was admittedly second fiddle to the Warriors playoff game, but whatever. San Franciscans just don't have a good grasp on proper sports prioritization.  The food was good (more options than just "bar food", including a solid salad selection), the service was attentive, and the atmosphere was warm and lively.   We'll definitely be back.

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: There is potential for this place but I haven't ever seen anyone but Marina/Frat types hanging around.  Good for them.  Just not my scene.

U-blmCm_qUbibUUgqDSB_g.review_text: Been here several times for happy hour. The prices are good and their appetizers are good as well. I've tried their buffalo wings and their truffle fries. I recommend the fries cause they serve you a ton and they are really tasty!! One time I came this older lady was probably drunk (I hope) and was grinding on this dude on the chair... Not a pretty scene when the sun is still out. Aside from that I've liked it here.  Overall, good place to grab a bite and/or a drink.

IKTyFlE_VsoFyapciSP2Rg.review_text: Met up here with some friends for a friend's birthday. It was pretty crowded on a Friday night. The raspberry mojito I got was delicious. It has fresh raspberries muddled in. I should have stuck with that because the next drink I tried was a grey hound, but it tasted a bit funny, like they added a splash of cayenne or something.  Overall, I would go back for the raspberry mojitos, but the bar itself isn't particularly fun or inspiring.

5RqIQRaRKLPVr2TtUBkCpw.review_text: Great local spot on Fillmore. Sunday brunches are awesome (bomb chilaquiles) and great spot for a casual weekday drink as well. I'm definitely a regular here.

s1hZZMkaWCql09X-cGUQEQ.review_text: Been here twice for the bottomless bellini brunch and its delicious! Their bellinis are made with peach nectar and they are very refreshing! I have gotten the Harry's breakfast here both times and its the perfect size! Really lively atmosphere, not too loud, and great service!

OqlcSakW1xxCBONdE9Mwlg.review_text: Worst Bloody Mary ever. Horrible service!

gTBXZLSlx9xvfbV5h-uNuw.review_text: Went into this place on last 7/19 Friday looking for a happy hour. Got the Blackened Chicken Sandwich with Avocado on a french roll and sweet potato fries. It was delicious nice vibe in this place we had a window seat.  Service was cool and had recommendations readily available when asked. Drinks were exotic (which is the norm in most places these days) My spiced Pear Martini  taste like cough syrup :(  Thomas Jefferson had the Raspberry  Lemon Drop which was pretty tasty!  Respectfully Reviewed

YDDzBj6-tRclC4ogbOGFIw.review_text: Love this place.  It is great for drinks after work or late night eats.  Generally it gets crowded pretty early, so if you want a table, you have to get there early or wait it out until after the dinner/drinks crowd leaves around 10.  Service is great, food is tasty, and the mohijtos are AMAZING!  They used to let you order take-out, but I think they want the girls to get tips, so that is no longer an option.  Regardless, its still a chill spot...   The only reason I give it a 4 is that the drinks are kind of pricey.  You have a few of them and your bill sky-rockets.  But they are so tasty!

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: Everyone- "What are you doing tonight?" Me- "Going out with my friend Joey" Everyone- "Like on a date?" Me- "It's not a date" Everyone- "Where are you going?" Me-"Meeting him at Harry's" Everyone- "Sounds like a date" Me- "It's not a date" Everyone- "Are you guys getting dinner?  And wait, didn't you used to date?" Me- "Yes and yes, but this ISN'T A DATE" Everyone- "Whatever"  Of course, I had to wait for my non-date because he was at the mercy of a cab, and while I was standing in the doorway boring holes in my phone with my eyes so I could avoid the sea of popped collars in front of me, nary a person greeted me, despite many of the cute young things in black fluttering around.  It was busy, but not THAT busy.  So I snag a seat at the quasi-bar...and wait.  Thankfully my non-date is a man of action, as we were not getting any action sitting at this poor excuse for a place to sit, he went to the bar and ordered us drinkies and food.  The burgers were very tasty (again, I love my meat).  3 stars because the blood orange margarita was insanely overpriced for the size and the quality, and the lack of service at that little quasi-bar.  Also, just because I'm a chick doesn't mean I can't tip.  I had to flag down a blondie just to get some water, although right after I did the non-blond bartender noticed me.  If I didn't like Pac Heights so much it's highly unlikely that I would come back.  But I do, and I will.    For more non-dates.

dIQnYbjf-rTxn5dQoRr0bg.review_text: Beer, burgers, and a ball game.  Yeah, that sums it up.

_31KXT4K2Mmh10DnIBMPcg.review_text: My first experience at Harrys bar was a good one.  The food was good, at a fair price and the service was friendly.  I made a reservation for my family to have dinner there on Friday night and even from the start the service was terrible.  The woman on the phone was not very friendly and they required a credit card to hold the reservation which was fine but a bit annoying.  I called at 8 to push the reservation back to 9 and the woman seemed fine with it.  Then I get a message on my phone at 8:45 saying that she wanted to know if we were coming because it was busy and she would charge us if we didnt show up.  I thought this was rude and completely unnecessary 15 minutes before our reservation time!  Also threatening to charge us because of a long waiting list really doesnt make much sense...just seat someone else and seat us when we arrive.  Seeing as 99% of restaurants function this way, I dont know why they couldnt as well.   We were on time and seated at 9 (despite them first seeming to have lost our reservation).  Then we all order and my sister who was driving and not drinking that night got a water.  None of us were ID'd when we ordered.  The waitress came back to our table when we were ready to order our food and asked for my sisters ID.  She said she wasnt drinking and didnt have her purse because my Dad was paying.  He vouched that she was over 21 (which seemed unnecessary because she hadnt ordered anything).  Then to my complete astonishment we were told we had to leave the restaurant because it was only 21+ after 9:00.  The website doesnt say anything about this and we were not told on the phone OR when seated.  Completely ridiculous to be seated and order drinks (WITHOUT being carded) and then be asked to leave. Especially because I had made a reservation and we then had to find somewhere else to eat at 9:30 on Friday night.  The waitress was apologetic but the manager had terrible customer service. I hope after reading this, they will reconsider their policies and try to communicate better with their customers in the future.

CDZWiihsmtiP-cgBRSSljA.review_text: I remember very little about my visit to Harry's this week, which is a sure sign that it did its job well.  I do remember that we ordered Fernet shots after I had cut myself off after a boot of beer at Suppenküche earlier in the evening.  That was a bad choice.

YzwiErmRMLpolqUhFg9gyg.review_text: One of the few bars on lower pac heights that stays open past 11pm. This place doesn't get crazy busy on Friday and Saturday nights, but gets a good crowd. Harry's has a good, laid back atmosphere. Great for a casual night out if you want to stay out a little later but don't want to be in a packed bar in other areas of the city that stay open late. Even though they aren't packed, the bartenders are pretty attentive, so its typically not hard to get a drink.

YoSlY-Bq9ojCjM9C58GBfw.review_text: What can I say the cocktails are lousy here. The management has no idea what they are doing, and plastic plates and ugly glassware are not inspiring. This space could be cool, but the owner has no idea what that would be.  This is a place where you can get a burger and a warm beer on tap and watch sports. For that it is OK, for anything else not so much.   Missed opportunity due to lack of foresight and understanding of what's really going on.

bkT1wsuQkOyOVk0eOFM_8Q.review_text: You know...even though you can be stuck in a sea of yuppies, this place for the most part is fun.  Good place to hang while you are waiting for a table at Fresca or Chez Nous

qRSlyWSh5NjI2VqOgrFX5Q.review_text: The couple and the party behind us to walk out. So we walked out.   After waiting at least 10 min we went to the bar to order and the bartender sends us away to order with a server.... Who does that? Take my order if you want my business. 10 minutes still no drinks. We left. This place was not that busy. I truly hate the service at this bar. It needs a serious change. I don't enjoy coming anymore.   The Thai place across the street has the strongest vodka soda, no wait, and nice service. Go there :)

d4jbh5BcXlOsEJif_qqNMA.review_text: 5 stars for the burger and fries.  Decent enough for a quick drink at night, but definitely not a destination bar.   Still, the burger is good enough for me to forgive just about anything.

6aJNIB8yGHDiwrzyxlExRw.review_text: Great neighborhood bar.  Has that "Cheers" look, but new younger urban professionals hanging here.
