Drinks are fair, lots of fancy choices, and they do have food; which I'm told is pretty good, definitely a plus if you need something in your belly to soak up the booze ;)  They have a DJ spinning at times, not much of a dance floor to speak of!

pbWdN5VuadxyDzrIKN8YTA.review_text: It's a decent bar. It's not trying to be a fancy restaurant or bar. It does the job in a neighborhood that is short on regular bars. Also nice staff, and well priced for the area. 4 stars.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Bartenders here lack logic. Never going back.  I came here with a group of friends, some more drunk than others. One bartender decides to cut off serving one because he looked drunk, judging purely by the look of his eyes which are a little smaller than others because he's Asian. The man was the most sober out of all of us. Same bartender then proceeds to serve shots to another friend was trashed and blacked out. Then, the same bartender decides to kick all of s out because she didn't want to WORRY about the sober kid sneaking in a drink, who was already having a shitty time because he got cut off for having small eyes.  Managers and bouncer did not help at all either. Amazing how badly oblivious employees can ruin a night.

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: Alright, I've gotten my drank on at Harry's with Yelpers two times this week! What can I say? It's a bar and it's near my house, so that pretty much guarantees I'll be spending a lot of time here. In all honesty, it's a pretty average bar. With an excellent burger and a decent menu. And a table section, where you can sit and drink/eat civilly on those days when you don't feel like bellying up to the bar. I myself am a bar-bellier. So that's where you'll find me. If you'd like to send me a drink, please make it a Ruby Red Greyhound.  Phil and I hadn't exhausted our collection of 6th grade jokes by the time we finished brunch and we certainly hadn't reached our full buzz potential, so we went back to my hood to drink some more and hit on members of the opposite sex at Harry's. Harry's is an excellent place to pick people up. If you like cougars and fat men. Or both (hay-ay).  Phil and I like both. So we were in heaven. Or maybe that was just the mimosas getting to us. The bartenders are ok- not rude, not super friendly and the drinks are fine. A little on the pricy side but whatever. Harry's is HUGE (yes, HUGE like Willie) so that means there's always plenty of room for everybody. I like not having to try to stand and drink at the same time :) Bathrooms are clean but there's only one per sex, so that means a line.  I stay away on weekend nights, when the overgrown frat boys and the tanorexic cougars who love them take up every square inch of real estate.

e4Sek5hTjpe_eBeM9jXd6g.review_text: Loud.  Solid Nachos.  Good drinks.  A fun night out when you're with Het friends.  Although they will serve you drinks right up until close, and then bring up the lights & try to toss you out.  Laura & I were not having this sort of treatment & took our drinks to go.  Ooops.  But, again - fun time otherwise.  And make sure to bring an umbrella if its raining, otherwise you'll be stuck under an awning like Laura & I were at closing time.  Sipping our to-go's.  Mwahaha.

TGk1kxejVyQ7_S-XCMtBiw.review_text: Stopped in for lunch on a Sunday afternoon, on a recommendation that this place had the best burger in town. Had the Kobe Sliders and a bloody mary. Both were fantastic. Given my SF burger foray is still in its infancy, I can't claim it's the best burger joint in the city yet, but you will not be disappointed.

IYSLj4WfKxpILvBz1io9_A.review_text: Aside from the fact that it took 15 minutes to get a bellini and an amstel light, it's a good spot to watch a game.

WZ4nY12jwmnvbACinQdMVA.review_text: Our neighborhood staple. Great burgers, not so great service, can get super crowded, and at night turns into a weird meat market-type place. Still, a favorite for a burger and beer.

Ybr4mtjJyjAFt9wbAHwEVw.review_text: This is a good place to watch a game, but it's not so good a place to order a turkey burger, (dry patty, bread buns tasted like flood damaged carpet)... you feel me?

-JQWn7dNVHLwrbrk8f-mzA.review_text: Quesadilla was horrible... Tortilla wasn't toasted well.  The calamari was rubbery and very salty.  Drinks were over-priced.  Surprisingly had a decent crowd though.   PS French fries were good (so are McDonald's...)

3xf0f3XlvbeD0DNooDH2MA.review_text: You won't see me here Thursday-Saturday . . .  however if I'm looking for a nice place to grab dinner or a cocktail after work or a meeting nearby, I know Harry's is a staple that I can count on.  The bar feels old & distinguished.  The crowd is typical Pacific Heights professionals:  polite men & well dressed women.  This is SoBro (South of Broadway) so on a typical school night the Marina crowd won't venture up the hill.  I do have to agree with many of the other yelpers - unless you order a martini, expect a weak pour.  Even if you order it "on the rocks."  Stick with one of the signature martinis and you can't go wrong.               They used to have this great Monday night burger special, but decided it get rid of it - why?!  The food is comfortable & dependable bar food.

KJ_0tYPk3VeoNun0s4RkBA.review_text: It's a decent bar with decent food. I have enjoyed the bar scene the times I have been there.....good looking young men yes please. They have some decent wines, but pretty overpriced. I had their turkey burger with avocado and jack cheese- it was pretty legitimate. Their fries are nothing special- but their calamari definitley will satisfy anyone's munchies. But seriously, when does fried calamari not satisfy such munchies? I like to go easy on service because I've worked in restaurants for years but here's the thing- although the waitresses have always been nice and friendly, they do have some timing issues, mainly with greeting tables, taking your order, etc...The food comes out quickly....but getting to that point can be difficult sometimes. Overall, the food is decently priced, but you aren't going to get anything amazing. Pretty standard bar cuisine.

yq_qqNHc3zR1Zi1Qj0sB3A.review_text: If you're looking for pub fare and reasonably priced drinks along with a good crowd, this place is probably for you! I'm not sure it's a place you'd want to travel to but if you live nearby or happen to be in the 'hood, definitely consider it as a reasonable choice!

DQj7DnJiDV9TAxS0ott-3g.review_text: Service is utterly ridiculous. Went there for Sunday brunch and even after being seated outside it took about 30 minutes for a server to attend to us. Give me a break. Look outside. Giving the 2nd star for pretty good food, but unfortunately I won't let myself go back there due to the immense time waster it was.

6Chth4-xjMGgTtaAZkrYxQ.review_text: Great ambiance, so effectively marred by indifferent and cold service. It functions adequately as a waiting room for SPQR down the street, but your dollars are better spent anywhere but here.

FjK2oAPVPcPiB9WzBhIc-Q.review_text: I love that Harry's has plenty of seating.  Great drinks and friendly staff.

XO-YWxq9Y8fY5u7OYXERdw.review_text: Great Kobe burgers, but you get to be surrounded by ex frat boys now desperate men. So sad. Don't stay longer then you have too.

JY_pDWL__5oRQKms4j11Zg.review_text: The only reason I've ever gone to Harry's Bar is because of its convenient location.  Usually the servers/bartenders are nice and efficient and the crowd is meh, but whatever.  However, I refuse to ever return to this place again due to the PISS POOR attitude of one of the bartenders.  I'm sorry honey, but if dealing with people drinking pisses you off, then maybe you need to chose another profession. From looking at the other reviews, I have a feeling she does this alot,. Cutting people off when they're barely drunk--that's just shit service.  This is not some frat party, I'm actually paying for these drinks.  It seems that this particular bartender is on a power trip and is seriously bad for business.  I am never stingy, but I was LIVID and honestly I felt like $0.95 tip was $0.95 too much.

8Y6h0FDZUBDk_5k4WT1_kg.review_text: I love the staff here.  The cheeseburger is awesome.  The place is clean and comfortable.  The prices are fair.  Every bartender is different and cool in their own way, as are the servers.  I cant really complain about anything.  I love Harry's

yPmlM7fxm6H4u3kFdvdHbw.review_text: Who woulda thought - mango + mojito = yum.  Try one, I dare ya.

cUlbdfTXsPt9owLcDNx3lQ.review_text: This place is great on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon for lunch.  They have good food and obviously an array of drinks.  However, I find going any other time a bit frustrating.  When it gets busy the wait staff seems to get flustered and they forget about tables.  On game days, it can be fun, but it's total chaos and expect to wait for everything.  If you happen to wander in on a Thur- Sat. night, it's a cheesy pick-up bar.

maEDOyw7sL9vaCGeKW_iog.review_text: Lame.  It's loud, the music sucks, the service sucks, the prices suck, the crowd sucks.  Besides that, it's awesome - go knock yourself out.    What's the problem? My theory is that the feng shui at Harry's is off - the layout is AWFUL: it's dissected into 2 parts, with people squished together at the bar and others trapped in booths with too-big tables and not enough leg room.  I've given this place a number of chances because its in a convenient mid-Fillmore location, making it a good jumping-off point for a lot of other things, but I'm officially over it.  There's a lot of attitude in this joint, and I'm not exactly sure why - place isn't really all that hip.  A see that a lot of Yelpers dig this place, but frankly, I don't get it.

ksonr4xKjpmznXtf_rB2jg.review_text: After dinner on Saturday at Ten-ichi, the roomies and I went to Harry's to wind down after a long month.   1 - They brought us someone else's order. (Thanks anonymous dude! Your fries were tasty and your buffalo wing-sauced burger smelled delish)  2 - Sausage-fest  3 - The music was good.

7tVzJLsxKdzQfwKocbnf3w.review_text: BRUTAL - poor lay out, forces people to be slammed into each other if you are not lucky enough to get a table.  Staff are slow, drinks were wrong, customer was not right.   I have a very high tolerance for crowded bars but only lasted one drink here.

5IX9FOesKrLRyz618xc6tw.review_text:
I came over here last nite to kill some time before the Yelp Elite event started at International Orange. My friend Connie C. got the Mango Mojito and it was really tasty so I thought I'd order one too. Well the drink didn't disappoint but some stiff prices for a small glass of cocktail. Plus the glass was mostly filled with ice and 3 big chunks of mango. 
  I felt much better though once I got to the Yelp event where they were serving FREE wine -- the muscat was so good!

pU4vClwD9sHe5Dq0zUpFew.review_text: Great bartenders (especially Rashelle, she's a stud), great drinks at reasonable prices, great neighborhood, tons of fun. A staple of SF nightlife and always a solid go-to.

EUDuSd11Fhxm6ioLgvxFEQ.review_text: Drinks are a little on the pricey side (although given the neighborhood, i suppose they are about what you would expect).  The bartenders are efficient and friendly, and the atmosphere is very upbeat.  If you are in Pac Heights and looking for a swanky spot to mingle, check it out.

OKrtyH725FAIsxVhPyayNQ.review_text: I lived across the street from Harry's for 2 years.  When we first moved in, we occasionally stopped by for a cocktail at times when they weren't too busy. The bartender (snake as we called him) never remembered who we were even though he was introduced to us plenty of times when we first moved into our apt.   The running joke with my roommate(s) became; "Let's go to Harry's," then laughter; as if we were ever serious about going there.  It's too crowded, meat market, they play the music SO LOUD that you cannot bother to have a conversation, and the drinks are expensive (especially when you live across the street). It's not relaxing that's for sure.   I will give it two stars because it's "okay" for lunch, as long as there isn't a game on TV.   Perhaps if I was 22-26ish I miiight be into this type of scene, but nowadays I would much rather be able to talk to and hear my company/friends.    Although I enjoyed crazy, loud bars in college, today I am not so much into get wasted finding myself  singing (aka yelling/singing)  "Hands, touchin' hands Reachin' out Touchin' me Touchin' you  Sweeeet Caaarooline Good times never seemed so good,  Chorus so good so good so good "  If you're into that, you might enjoy the place. Cheers!

IQymtwcSb7elorFDr_6YUQ.review_text: F this place. They sent my burger to the wrong table then realized thier mistake, took the burger away to the kitchen and brought it back out to me saying that they'd cooked a new one when the fries were half eaten and there was nacho residue (the original table's other dish) on the food. They hadn't done a thing, I'm not picky but my food had been half eaten and manhandled by a stranger. I aint down with it. F this place.

Z2AuC5sWT4mjPgt2ga7S0Q.review_text: I swear Harry's has the best Kobe beef sliders in San Francisco.  I stopped by Harry's last night for an official meet and greet that was very successful. And two orders of sliders later and Rasberry Mojito we are the best of friends with a great connection.  Not like last time when I think last time and the connection became animalistic and the hostage asked us to stop or leave. Too many martini's equal the mating dance sometimes   But enough about me because the service is always great. The fries and calamari are good and the cute girl behind the bar make great drinks.

N25XbMni2oNugGBkO85Baw.review_text: I really like all the leather seating, the mirrors, the lighting, the bar section, the TVs. But I could really care less for this crowd. No offense, it's just not my scene.

nqb5kKa4nHQtVq6zQZtnxg.review_text: I love the layout and the look of the bar and it's great to know that they serve food until 1:30 a.m. But the crowd is not very diverse and the music was straight out of CMT.

zfuOb38lqzL1GpP9EfowxQ.review_text: Strolled over to Harry's Sunday night to catch the World Series.  The large screen TV's were visible throughout the space.  This cheered up my friend, a Phillies fan from Philadelphia.  Our sight-line was unimpeded.  We ordered calamari and spinach dip to munch.  Both were big disappointments.  The calamari had a cardboard tasting batter, were overcooked, the aoli dipping sauce was bland, maybe came straight from a mayo jar.  The spinach dip. well, tasteless is the nicest thing I can say.  But, the burgers!  The burgers were great.  Flavorful meat with just the right texture and dripping juice.  I ordered mine a bit rarer than medium rare.  The kitchen made it just right, a rarity in SF where I've had my request refused or ignored and ended up with medium.  The buttermilk bleu cheese had a good kick and loved those pickled onions.  Skinny, crisp fries were good and would have been great if not lukewarm.  A couple of people at the next tabled order salads, Cobb and steak.  They looked soooo good.  I may have try one next time.  When I get a burger carving, I head to Harry's.  The Flat Tire beer on tap lures me back, too.

rPmaTwqb7nE414ypb1fILA.review_text: This is a great spot to grab a beer and and watch the game. The wait for Sunday Brunch is always crazy so either get there early or go after 3PM.

H4mtLg7PyTRzYHS9cYzeEQ.review_text: ok so im here with good company when i come so i cant totally complain but dude service is slow, drinks are ok, and when its packed you just wanna run the other way. The crowd is a so so group of people some are cool and some not so much.

JNyLyXn-unUhJmiGJnI6tQ.review_text: I just dropped off my roommate at Harry's.  I don't know why I agreed to do that.  I like my roommate; I don't like Harry's.  It's stiflingly hot (this from the girl who is always cold), and as dull as its name.    To be fair, the bar does seem to draw a crowd for the food (probably bland), and the big screen TVs (yawn).

s1DSkbdFEuO3ODbMWQqSvw.review_text: Four stars because I've only been on weekend afternoons. Good burgers, good drinks, and good community. I avoid it at all costs on packed nights, though. Too loud and meaty for me.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Someone replaced the house veggie burger with a Gardenburger. Not sure what happened since my first visit to Harry's. My tolerance for drunk people has probably gone down. As has my tolerance for abrasively loud music. What has gone up is my expectations for house veggie burgers. Maybe the Plant Cafe ruined me (yelp.com/biz/the-plant-c…). Either way, Harry's was no better than Gardenburgers out of the freezer. Yet is costs a lot more. Greens on the side is still an option. Just seemed smaller. Water sat empty for a long time. Left with an empty (and slightly hungry) feeling.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: Looking for a good place to watch the big game? Harry's is definitely your spot! My friends and I went for the Final Four and while UCLA didn't win, enticing lots of curses and head shaking from our table, the service, drinks and food more than made up for our somber mood. It was the bright spot in our dark hour.  I had a blood orange, champagne cocktail that barely touched the table before I gulped it down in a flurry of glass to lip action - so unique and tasty.  While I didn't eat any food this time around I have in the past and can attest that the burgers are fabulous. This is not the time to think about your diet, go for the real deal and indulge while you make fists at the TV.  The service was surprisingly attentive considering the huge crowd that had come for the game. Our server was helpful and quick which I really appreciated.  If you happen to make it on a Friday or Saturday night you'll be impressed with the bustling and diverse crowd. The music is really fun and was reminiscent of my favorite college bar - a great spot to start out your evening and get you going.

jxDkshPcSQnSFB1qxDcNpA.review_text: After being kicked out of the wild hare we ended up at Harry's bar. Best decision we made that entire day. They have their own Tater Tot Nachos that are delicious and the endless Bellinis were truly never ending and yummy. Our waitress was super attentive and always made sure we had carafes of bellinis on the table.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: I never bothered to write a review for Harry's...because pretty much everything has been said.. Last night..after the yelp event, my GF didn't quite want to go home yet..so we asked mom and dad (Tanya Z. and BF) to drop us off at Harry's on their way home. WHY? WHY? WHY????  Why did I have another martini when I was already had more than enough at Mighty? And when the young, under aged looking boy offered me a shot of Jager, why did I asked for a McCallan instead? Did I really think that Scotch would sit well with my dirty martini accompanied by the biggest plate of chicken nachos????? I think I was dangerously close to becoming a cougar last night...Thank God what was left of that little voice inside me told me to hail a cab before things could go from bad to *&^*#&@!(*&@!!  NOTE TO SELF: This review serves as a reminder to never return to Harry's...

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: This place was jumpin.  There were no tables or bar space when we arrived on Saturday afternoon but the wait was only going to be 20 minutes and we got a bar seat before ordering our first drink.  We started off with a drink and then hot wings.  The blue cheese dip was excellent, don't know if it was made in house but tasty none the less.  It might have been a bit garlicky but not sure.  What I do know it there seemed to be something different about it.  The wings although not as spicy as I like were good.  I don't like a thick crispy skin but these were fall off the bone soft.  Next we ordered the mushroom Swiss burger with truffle oil Romano fries and the Mahi Mahi tacos.  The burger didn't look too impressive at first and the grilled half inch thick onion was a bit daunting but I pressed on.  Our medium burger was on the rare side which is OK with me but beware if you don't like a red burger.  The onion turned out to be fine, sweet, grilled and slightly crunchy but not too raw, perfect.  It really gave that burger the extra bump.  With no condiments the burger was still juicy which is a sign of a good burger to me, when I don't have to slather it with mayo, mustard or ketchup.  Although not my top 5 it was good.  The French fries were to die for with a whisper of truffle oil (my newest obsession), Romano cheese and what tasted like slightly fried herbs of rosemary and maybe thyme.  YUM!  I also enjoyed the tacos but hubby not so much.  Drinks were pricier than I like at $8 for a vodka and soda but I was in the city and to their credit my tall was served in the preferred pint glass.  The main drink attraction and definitely the best deal was their $10 all you can drink in 1.5 hour Bellini.  After 2:30 one Bellini will cost you $8.50 so drink up early.  This was definitely the popular drink with the majority of patrons being a maximum age of 25.  If in the area I would stop by again and although I like a busy place unless I was going for a Mimosa high I would shoot for later in the day to avoid the craziness and get more attention.  The servers were friendly but swamped.  We parked against the park which was free parking all day so although we had to circle the park 8 times we found a spot for the day.

cx6CMeztrzFYAY0gpaC3Mg.review_text: Hung over? I was.   My gf and lil sis have been raving about the turkey burger and wanted to come here for a greasy breakfast.  Knowing me, of course I had to try the bacon bbq cheese burger. All big and bad I thought I would man up and have beef.  Big mistake. Try the turkey burger with grilled onions, mushrooms and guyere. It's my new hang over cure.  Lesson learned.   Minus two stars for other little things like a slow waitress, not so great beef burger and a flat diet coke.

S34qI4Jvdn-Nn5rfuKzgYw.review_text: A fight broke out amid a first date...  Is that a good or bad sign?    For years we loved this place, the beer and burger combo is unbeatable.  But last night I realized how weak the cocktails were, or have been.  In the past when I felt the love of intoxication it was really  due to whatever I drank at dinner prior to coming to Harry's.  The crowd has gone downhill as well.  Last night's fight exemplified such.  The bar needs to be staffed with bouncers at all time!  Protect your preciously blond and standoffish cocktail waitresses!  Krudos to the brave bartender who screamed "Get out of our bar!!"  It was all on balance, somewhat entertaining, I must admit

dCEeajtb0eFgrIHLvwWtNQ.review_text: There's a special every day of the week!  But aside from that, my turkey burger was oh so good! The best since I can remember. Yummy!

F99jyRHGoUbRLRIdyAPDFA.review_text: Great, relaxing atmosphere! Delicious Food! Usually there is a game on the TV and service is always good even them they are filled up.  I will be back!

Ql1iPdQWROSYb_DM1J371Q.review_text: I've been frequenting Harry's Bar for years and I keep coming back for more...  I recently had the roasted chicken which is a Thursday food special.  It was served with arugula salad and yummy french fries.  The chicken was juicy and tender!    Harry's Bar has different specials every day of the week.  Last night...half off bottles of wine while watching the NBA finals...fun!  On the weekends you can get a bottomless bellini with brunch.  There are specials like this every day of the week!  I also love the staff here.  They are fun and friendly ladies who get the job done.  Enough said...

E6-j37wHgQwg0cpNLMkQGA.review_text: Beautiful, classic bar with THE WORST MUSIC ON REPLAY in the world. Not just annoying. Not just an afterthought. THE WORST MUSIC IN THE WORLD.    I have a theory as to why it is so unhip as to be studied unhip.  Every tune is so loud, and so vanilla, that it's comical. People really don't like the Gin Blossoms, Madonna, and Sheryl Crow or Michael Jackson on full blast. Seriously. Not your mom, dad, unhip banker friend, nobody. NOBODY.  I was in there the other day and this annoying late era Michael Jackson ballad was droning on and on and on. "Feed the world/make it a better place/ for you and for me/ and the entire human race" -- that one. The bartender asked, "Wow. This is annoying. Do you mind if I skip it?" The guy next to me and I were like, "No. Please do." So she puts another song on. It's upbeat, but it's friggin Madonna. The next track comes on. Michael Jackson again! The dude next to me, total stranger, just starts laughing.  That's how it is in there. It's weird. You know, they have services, Muzak is one, that will provide music mixes for restaurants. These guys bought one. But they bought it back in 1995  and they never spent another dime on it. I'm convinced they did it on purpose, as some sort of bet among rest-o people that music is not important. George bet Jay Foster down at Farmer Brown -- a guy who takes the complete opposite approach -- a dinner at Gary Danko's, or something.   It went like, "Watch, man. I will play the worst music ever and I'll still get tons of customers. People just don't give a shit. " -- Well, he's right. People don't care. So that's my theory. They have to be doing it on purpose, not just letting it ride.   Because if you think about ti, similar approaches from chain restaurants in shopping malls at least use Muzak that is contemporary. Kanye West and Lily Allen minus the bad words and shit. No, these guys are up to something.  So a big time "Ouch" on that front. Othewise,  great burgers and fries. Great bar. Great location. Kind of a friendly vibe. Nice owners. Nice management. Nice bartenders.  BUT THE WORST MUSIC ON THE FACE OF THE FRIGGIN PLANET.

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Love the mimosa's here.  They even have a blood orange mimosa.  Excellent vegetarian nachos.  Nice servers.  Next time I want to try the infused vodka martinis!

fHnAHkd0rNscAXlWpy7M9Q.review_text: This place has ambiance going for it 1000%. The food and service are a bit pricey and tasted like whatever, but who can argue with street view seating on the good part of Fillmore?  I only wish they had WiFi, so people could sit and work here on sunny days. I'll have to visit again during the night to check out the night scene.

bdmtgNrUXAOT0gRXqQ5tuA.review_text: I may just be old, but this is my least favorite place in the neighborhood.  Every time I go there at night it's jam packed with rude wasted people, and last night it smelled like a locker room.  We spent 30 seconds there.  If young rich (by way of their parents) "adults" talking smack is not your scene, go there in the afternoon as long as a big game isn't on, and try the tasty flavored mojitos.  Good fresh fruit mixes.  I have to give them that.

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: Working in this area for 12 years I have only been in here a total of three times.  Twice for lunch and once for drinks...definitely nothing to write home about.  On my last occasion the service was quite lacking....

7_sdsi8LPCWhvtpVPjR9nQ.review_text: I'll start by saying I really want to love this place. It has a classy, saloon feel and is a good place to order a cocktail, yet Harry's has it's pros and cons. In addition to the above, they have above-average "bar" food, TVs for sports, and a convenient, central location. However, the prices are a bit steep, and it can be over-crowded with douches.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I came to Harry's for happy hour. I ordered a seabreeze and ended up with a vodka pineapple, grapefruit drink which was fine it was tasty, the waitress ended up giving me the correct drink free. My friend ordered red wine and she ended up with white wine, hmm...so far all wrong. Well then we ordered buffalo chicken tenders and they were not big chunks of chicken tenders like you would imagine. Tenders were skinny long pieces of kinda soggy chicken, also dry in the middle. The tator tots were PERFECTION! I could of eaten 2 orders on my own, crispy on the outside soft in the middle, wow!! Truffle fries were good too, nice thin crispy good. I thought the mac and cheese was good but my friends thought it was bland. I say go there get a few drinks and order the tots and burger.

_4EPDYdg8sFzdnW2ZMYixQ.review_text: great place to chill & grab a drink.  good food.  OK service.  this was a nice place to unwind after my flight from Austin & catch the last innings of a quite exciting Giants game.  we were lucky to snag a table for 2 in this packed establishment.    Orange Blood Agave Margarita was quite yummy.  I'm a sucker for agave drinks. :)    Spinach Dip: I would have to say this was surprisingly REALLY good!  served with pita bread slices, which beats chips  service started off great, but slowly dwindled by the time we closed out.  we waited about 10 minutes for the waitress to pick up our check & was forced to walk it over to her so we could go home.

GrVIegI1gjVevOMgXyoxiw.review_text: -minus one star for our waitress being kind of a beez after we asked her to split checks 3 ways -minus 2 stars for the kobe beef burger that was cooked to the correct color but tasted dry and bland. also the burger did not have enough cheese on it and overall it was just flavorless and bland -minus 2 stars for the burger costing $17 when I could have gotten a much better tasting one for $1.50 at in n out -plus 2 star for AMAZING fries.  overall i would not come here again. who the heck pays $17 bucks for a dry, bland burger when I could just go to in n out. or cook one at home. the fries r DELICIOUS. the original ones are salted and crisped just right and OMG the truffle fries are HEAVEN ON earth. but I still don't want to pay $17 bucks for a crappy burger. not only that our waitress gave us a little bit of attitude. if we are paying this much for cheap food ie bun patty potatoes then be a little nicer geez.  oh and my friend who also got the kobe beef burger told me that the normal harrys burger tastes a lot better. so if u MUSt get a burger get the cheaper one!  i am very disappointed. i KNEW i should have forced everyone to go to fresca down the street. i know its a  bit more expensive but the food there is AMAZING and I feel justified paying for the prices there. but definitely i don't get the same feeling at Harrys.  also when we first walked in the bar was hot and humid as heck. and sometimes they blast loud music.  oh and I also got the lychee martini. theres barely any lychee flavor but it taste very strongly of vodka and not in a good way. ick

xt8tqNaVPzgBhhftXBr-5A.review_text: Just wanted to add my two cents since there are quite a few mixed reviews in here.  Harry's has changed over the last few years and now resembles a Marina Bar on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights.  During the week (and weekend mornings) you can always find a seat, have some pretty good bar food, and casually watch a game on one of the many plasma tvs.  It's also a great spot for after work and won't get crowded until at least 8 p.m.  They have a great cheeseburger special on Monday night ($5.95 for a cheeseburger, fries, and a pint).  Because of the layout, it's a bad spot to go if you're going to stand around.  The bar area is separated from the tables by a small wall in the middle of the place so there is no room at all.  Overall, a good spot to hang out.

Cph7U9lIT23uCV85K-nyZA.review_text: Eh. I don't think I'd make a trip just to eat at Harry's, but it's a good spot for a quick, cheap bite if you're in the area.

JbV35FSTr4p1UG_9vnrUYw.review_text: I am trying to diversify the quality of places I review (ie review more 1-2 star establishments), but it sort of pisses me off that Harry's averages only 3 stars, so I feel it my duty to raise that up a bit!    This is a quality Pacific Heights neighborhood establishment good for a meal or happy hour.  They have great American fare and cocktails.  In particular I love the grilled cheese / tomato soup, sweet potato fries, and bourbon drinks.  The specialty libations aren't cheap ($10/cocktail), but aside from that they perhaps put a little too much ice, they are good drinks.    It's always hopping but for whatever reason I've never had to wait for a table really.  They have bar seating, meal seating, and this area at the front that is sort of mixed / could be used for both.  The food is pretty reasonably priced (you could get out for under $15 all-inclusive if you're not drinking).  I am a carnivore myself but people have had good things to say about the salads as well.  It is a short walk from the famed Fillmore theater so I recommend it as a place to get a bite before a concert.  You'd think it's pretty casual based on the prices but people always seem to be dressed decently nice; I think it is a common place to drop in after work or for a casual date.  Pretty good/underrated place also to watch sports, although I wouldn't say it is known for that.    Lots of yuppies & can slightly err on the bro / douche side at times, but it's not nearly as bad with that as you might find further north on Fillmore like at Greenwich or Union.  Occasionally can get quite loud.

0I99ibr1vy7yiHIUdo3Zyw.review_text: Harry, it's not you, it's ME.  I've been to Harry's twice now (both times were on a weekend night) and, well, I think it's just alright, nothing that warrants more than 3 stars.  The music is incredibly loud, the bar is always packed to the gills, and the general scene here is kindof reminiscent of an 80s movie where all the dudes scope out the chicks from a distance with shifty eyes and their shirt sleeves rolled up half way.... Only fast forward to the present and the chicks are wearing clothes they can't really afford (but pretend to) and the dudes are sporting designer jeans and polished black pointy shoes, but still have shifty eyes and cocky grins on their faces.  Harry, is it really your fault?  Maybe I haven't given you a fighting chance?  I should come back on a school night and do HH here sometime, but... well, there are just too many other places in SF I'd rather frequent.

l1JMdRB9LnxQ4JWpbYlQSA.review_text: Ate here tonight...It was packed.  The burger was solid, the bun was great!  Pretty good place for sure...definitely above average (3 stars).

Iu3VnoZBqCF92bew7IIOjQ.review_text: Bottomless Bellini's, hottest waitresses I've ever seen, everyday they're truffle frying, I think this should be renamed Heaven.  I can only aspire to marry one of the waitresses.

nu4NZLFnJ57TIIwSsXd33w.review_text: brunch review:  server was slow but pretty. food took 45 minutes and was portioned for toddlers. tvs were tuned to nascar instead of college football.    harry's breakfast may look good on paper, 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes and toast for 8 bucks, but as i said, the provided amount could satisfy an 6 pound child.   go to crepevine up the street.

vqNtKMeDbIJ07RUdexsAvQ.review_text: It's true, I used to love the occasional Saturday night stop at Harry's, mainly because it was pleasantly lame. Like the same way you love freezer pizza. Sturdy, but not titillating. Just dependable.  However, a quick fly-by on Saturday night proved things have changed. It's just. Too. Much.  Bumping club music, dark lighting, extremely packed crowd = huh? What happened to the trusty neighborhood bar?  You'd do well to stick to early weeknights.

pPDnLdtSbD-qdplEh7Y4uw.review_text: I've come here for both lunch and their bottomless bellinis brunch. Bottomless bellinis= great deal and delish. Food = meh. Harry's Bar is what it claims to be- a bar. Great drinks, mediocre food. Service is also sub-par.

iCsA9Ak88i6GHHdJ6zJxHg.review_text: Harry's delightfully suprised me when they provided me with an excellent sunday lunch. Within my party our top favorites were:  Mac n Cheese! - heaping cheesy goodness Sweet Potato fries! - crispy and addicting Cobb salad! - super fresh ingredients and lots of variety  Had some great Rum cocktails with ginger beer in it and called it a day.  Thanks Harry's!   Yum fun and good all around :)

3aur17CDgFoedYmmAl-3lQ.review_text: Harry's bar is so much fun! You can feel the social vibe in the air, and everyone who comes seems down to earth and sincerely just looking for a good time. We came here with about 6 people and got seated in the corner, ordered nachos (so good, the chips were airy and crunchy!), and I got a Blood Orange Margarita (which apparently, as Nick and Kristy said, was their favorite, but shh, don't tell anyone because Nick still has balls haha). It was tangy and sweet, but I could still taste the alcohol a little, which is just what I like! The menu also offered an assortment of gin, tequila, mojito cocktails, all with dashes of fruit-- which I give a stamp of approval to!  I'm definitely going back for the Bottomless Bellini brunches and fruity cocktails! :)

68C8pn05FypeGHQdBB8bHQ.review_text: Okay, okay . . . first off I will admit that one of the reasons I like to come here is to check out dudes.   For some reason hot guys and their friends seem to gravitate to this Pac Heights spot in throngs.    It is a comfortable place to meet a date, but if you bring your girls you can ogle all you want.  The Hendricks Cucumber Gimlet was damn good.   This is coming from a girl who doesn't drink gin, but what can I say?   I guess I felt like getting a little crazy.  The pheromones in the room must have been getting to me.  If you are hungry, or even if you aren't, try the Kobe Beef Sliders!   So good.

-PoCbyNa4xc4yvReuj5pqw.review_text: It's funny to be a semi regular at a bar that is nowhere near my home and not particularly close to any of my favorite restaurants.  I meet my girlfriends here before we go out to dinner, several live in the neighborhood and it's usually not too crowded early in the night, we can grab a drink and hang out a bit before heading out.    I also seem to be taken here for a post dinner drink on every other date I go on.  Perhaps it's because Harry's has a nice cozy vibe, it's not too chic and it's certainly not too hipsterish.  Late at night it's easy to get a fairly comfy seat and service is always attentive but not obstrusive.  The one drink I can't stand is this berry lemonade thing.  Full of lemon and raspberry seeds, it tastes beautiful but is a mess and just not worth the trouble.

LkyT0hPUs_47mCtS4MQs3Q.review_text: Harry's is a good place, and I make it there probably about once a month for some reason or another. In fact, I was just there this evening to watch the Lakers destroy the Jazz by 29 points. It's a good place to watch a game and have a couple cocktails.  They have changed their food menu a bit over the past couple years, and still think the only thing good on there is the Kobe sliders, which are amazing. They really need to improve their food menu in order to make it a more well rounded place.  All in all, good bar for watching games / early evenings. Would be even better if they had delicious food, but this is still a decent neighborhood spot.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: Hot Food, Delicious Men and a heap of Flavor in Ambiance.   I've enjoyed many entree items as well as appetizers. Hey and who'd complain about the bar? They serve anything your little heart desires.   At first sniff, I was a little taken back. There is a strong wet bar odor to get used to. I know it sounds gross, but after 1 minute you'll adjust. (the only downside to a great place)   Cheers!

rBRuie_HNzxCkMDF-ooRog.review_text: Prior to this past Sunday, it's been quite awhile since I've been back at Harry's.  They had much smaller TVs back then.  We came here to watch the AFC & NFC playoffs and I was pleasantly surprised with all the big flat screen TVs surrounding the bar... definitely a nice upgrade.  What was even more impressive was that despite the "standing room only" for the 49ers-SeaChicken game, the sound system surpassed the bar scene noise.  We just had drinks so I can't comment on whether or not the food got any better, but will definitely be back for sporting events.  Sad that we didn't make it to the Super Bowl this year, but it still was a great year.   Now we can focus on watching the Warriors:)

vV-T6Va8RllvC00VHkYtXQ.review_text: Not a good place to watch sports, but seems like a decent enough place to hangout....that is IF you are FAT have reservations.    A few buddies and I decided to watch a game at Harry's since it's the most convenient for all of us. We got there around 5 for a 5:30 game.  We even told the waitress we're going to stick around and watch the game.  Her response was "no problem."  So we ordered a few rounds of drinks and food then around 6, the waitress came by and told us that she is reserving our table for a 7 o'clock party. What the heck! There are 10 other tables in the entire bar yet they pick our table?!?!Luckily for us, we were able to squeeze in and found another open table next to our table.  To me that's a slap in the face! We spent nearly 200 dollars that night, we weren't belligerent we were just minding our own business watching the game, yet the waitress had the cojones to come and kick us out of our seats even though we were in the mist of dropping $200 on food and drinks.     When the party that had the reservation finally showed up,  they were a group of fat girls on a night out.  They had waters all around and a drink here and there.  Nothing close to what we spent. Great business plan; force customers who are spending money out and replace them with cheap fat girls.

TzSFCbZoi3Ohs9hqDmoQDQ.review_text: It was okay. It's usually crowded and the food is really greasy.

A6V3MgvjZKu2ZAnOAat86w.review_text: I've been to Harry's a handful of times and every time I get in there and take in the crowd, I always think the same thing.....this bar needs a name change. Harry: Good name. Simple but not overly common like john or jim, and definitely a kind of name that would be attached to a no-frills, no fuss dude. He likes to drink a pint or two, enjoys to watch the occasional game and has no idea what Seven jeans are. Thats the type of man I would expect to encounter at Harry's bar. However, if we're judging Harry's based on the crowd and the drinks, it would be more fitting to call it Chauncy's Bar or perhaps Wellington's joint. In other words, Harry's is a watering hole for metro men in pink button downs, popped collars and designer underwear. If you're into that, then this is a great place to meet some gents. They're good looking, no denying that, but they're also most likely drinking a fruit infused cocktail and tucking into their hamburger with a knife and fork, Main topics of conversation will include yachting, their ivy league and dogs. I love going there for a chuckle and a tasty bite to eat, but at the end of the night, I will always leave alone.

UYoJ8XeHEdf-TD_cSFXCQg.review_text: I don't write reviews until they are actually necessary. I've been here quite a few times & the service is splendid every time. No bitchy attitude from the bartenders which what I like & the bartender is was actually engaging in conversation with me & my friend.  Good night here at this bar!

vSTi9G85c5c8RNPFIEMETQ.review_text: Not really my scene, which is too bad since I live so close by. I ate here once and was pretty unimpressed. I think I'm the only one who had a mediocre food experience here, judging from others' reviews. Apparently I should have ordered something other than a sandwich and green salad. I would only come here if I was with a few friends and able to get a seat. Otherwise it's not worth the noise, cramped quarters, and cheesy crowd it seems to attract.

UWN-IXDJNqE3Ldl2lJY76w.review_text: Oh my. How many times had I been to Harry's, swearing up and down that I would NEVER, ever go back? And why did I? I seriously don't know. I guess it was because the drinks aren't that expensive, for one. It was a pretty ok place to get a pre dinner drink or late drink after dinner. During those hours, the music wasn't bad, and you could hear your friend sitting next to you. The girls behind the bar were friendly and quick with a drink.  Oh. I remember..... Maybe it was because during peak times (i.e. 6pm-11pm) the single, 45+ Bridge and Tunnel guys would emerge, and gross you out with their special brand of stink. That was it!  Ok, Beware. Other than that, decent.

Ldy03uMFaEEEnh3KIsPP_w.review_text: I kind of love Harry's even though I don't love everything about it.  It's in my neighborhood, so it's convenient, it has great burgers and pretty great food for being bar-food.  Sometimes it's a bit douchey-marina-y, sometimes it's not.  I avoid it when there are sports games because at times customers have been ultra rude.  Some woman actually told my friend and I to move out of their view of the tv, while they were sitting down on their fat asses and watching a screen clear across the room.   There was literally no where to stand.  We said "fuck this place" and left.  Normally, I like going there to meet my girlfriends on a weekend night, it gets busy around 11pm. It's usually our meet-up place, then we go somewhere else, but sometimes we end up having so much fun that we stay the whole night.  There was a period of time that every time I went to Harry's something funny would happen to me or my friends . . shenanigans are always to be had.  They play fun music at night, I usually get wine so I can't comment too much on the drinks, except the last time I got a girly martini there I saw the bartender basically pour all red juice and a tiny splash of Cointreau.  I was pissed, thanks for the $8 juice.  Reminded me why I get wine instead.  I have had the same drinks at their sister bar, The Owl Tree, and they've been decent and strong.  It's always a crap shoot with bartenders though.  Which brings me to my favorite bartender, I believe her name is Marie?  Long brown hair, pretty girl with none of that shitty attitude so many bartenders can have, she is fast and efficient and sweet and pays attention.  When I was a bartender I was trained to always be looking, scanning the crowd for who needs something next.  She always does that, I've seen her multi-task making drinks for different groups of people, handle the cash/cards and be able to serve several people very quickly and without attitude.  (That may sound like what bartenders are SUPPOSED to do. . trust me so many seem like they're stoned, don't see you, don't care. .)  Anyway Marie is my favorite!  I think she may be somewhat new, but she's a very good bartender.  She doesn't act like she thinks she's all that, unlike many I see!    Anyway, that's my pet peev, shitty bartenders, so I love it when I find a great one.  Most of the bartenders at Harry's are at least pretty fast.  And they have to deal with drunk idiots like me, so . . Oh yeah and the poor doorman .. he is always sweet even when he has to tell my friend and I to get out of the street when someone dares us to dance with their friend to OPP on Filmore street.

B35Nwmd15-0WNdI-8jISOA.review_text: Very disappointed with my latest visit to Harry's.  The place has a lot of potential; good layout with a mixture of booths, tables, bar area and small patio seating.  I like the multiple games on, along with the DJ there Friday/Saturday night.  In addition, I' m glad that they resurrected the blackened chicken sandwich, along with new additions such as the sweet potato fries.  UNFORTUNATELY, I don't think I'll be heading back until they change their bar policy.  It was my friend's 30th birthday on 5/5, and when we went to the bar on 5/8 for her bday festivities, and birthday girl couldn't get in because her ID expired three days ago!  Absolutely ridiculous.  I understand the importance of an expired ID, but it expired three days ago!  And she's 30; it's not that she's 22 or 23 where you are unsure of her age.    It was horrible, we were a big group (8-10) so half of us went early to get a spot, ordered drinks and basically had to split the party until we finished our first round.  My ID expired last year on my birthday, and multiple bars allowed me to come in; where I had multiple bouncers tell me I had a one month grace period.  Come on Harrys, get your act together.

fcLg6igOVfs3ZTvBADNtNQ.review_text: Why on earth would you ever pay for a $10 drink at Harry's Bar?   Just stick with the beer.  The best part of the meal/drinks was the tasty and gooey mozzarella sticks (very yummy).   The inside scene is very Marina - however sitting outside is good people watching.

ZrXUauJw1f4QYpklfCLZPw.review_text: "If one more guy at  this place pops their collar, im gonna punch them"...that is what i though to myself the last time i was there. A woman asked if i was a professional belly dancer because of my 'costume'? I wasnt wearing a costume...but i guess to this crowd anything that was not bought at J Crew or Ralph Lauren looks like a clown suit. Most people wear things the same color as the DMV...beige. I will admit that the art deco decor is really beautifully crafted and they have a good dj on the weekends. Also they have some interesting drinks.

tqx3IU-8w1R84p1zxtsJhA.review_text: So first off Harry's isn't typically my type of bar, but i go there at least once every time i visit San Francisco. Why you may ask? because the bartender with all the tattoo makes amazing drinks, they play sweet movies on the t.v. like the labyrinth, and their fries are good :-) I'm a simple guy.

94b0y-FFFIF8hy3SJgXd-g.review_text: Let me start by saying, I have never wanted to go into Harry's.  It's always a friend's decision...probably due to my lack of enthusiasm for drinking domestic beer, watching sports, and eating red meat. Because of that, maybe I shouldnt be writing this review. Though, I'd like to add that the staff is really great at ignoring customers until you violently wave hands to alert them of your presence. Other things I dont like about Harry's ....(1) it often smells like pee. (2) very frat/sorrority-ish on fri/sat nights (3) comfy sofa chairs are never available (4) lighting is depressing  *On a positive note, they are quite accepting of me doing illustrations on their tables.... he he he  :)

aSB77ckbtSVb43As_H8MjQ.review_text: Went her for some drinks on a thur night. The place was busy but not packed so you could still find a place to sit. The music was really good and the vibe is good as well. I would go back but think that the drinks are over priced.

UZjHLY0ABrFuCfxJrNhf3Q.review_text: Drinks are great, food is good, service is good. Why I come back? The bloody marys (with all the fixins: bacon, shrimp, olives, celery, pickle) and the Irish Coffees. Two things not to be taken lightly. The burgers are good as well. Wings need more spice for sure. Harry ~ This town needs great buffalo wings. Make amazing buffalo wings and you'll have a customer for life in me.

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: We came here when warriors & patriot/jets game was on so it was pretty packed and loud. You could see how the people were divided by the teams. Anyways, their drinks are decent with all the regular cocktails. People are mixed and it's packed on weekends. I like the wooden tables and all which gives a pub feel to it. There's plenty of tables around and the service is usually good. I've only tried their fries but I hear their food is good.   Great fun place to hang out and grab some drinks!

m9vkagc4KEn5X47J9WGOBw.review_text:
'Member "Three's Company"?  This is the "Regal Beagle" of TC fame.  Really, think about it.  Any time I've been there, I've just wanted to order a chardonnay and wished I was wearing roller-derby shorts.  
  Cuter staff, tho.  I 'specially like the boy with the bangs.

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: Harry's bar is legit. It has good cocktails and it's one of the only bar bars in Lower Pac Heights. Good to go if your watching sports and nice spot for drinks with friends.

ty9DYtFFQiVCCCq24yjKlA.review_text: Burgers were delish. Definitely would go back.

DWbcEKJDBR6vPaNxb00sgw.review_text: I went here last nite to meet a friend, and do the pac Heights bar crawl. And now I know why I've never partied much in this neighborhood on a Friday nite. Very cliquish marina types who seem pretty boring.  As for the drinks, I got served fast, but the drinks are definitely weak.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: Does Harry Denton still own this bar?  I thought he sold it.   Anyway...this place is kinda sucky.  Overpriced cocktails and if you dare come here at night when it's crowded, it's like the who's who of the Biggest Tools in San Francisco.  Most of the time, I've ended up at Harry's because there aren't any other true BARS right there on Fillmore.

cVErDLDF4I0N3pikaQzWwA.review_text: Normally I avoid places like this like the plague but I was in the neighborhood with a friend and we heard they had killer bloody mary's.  Three stars for the nice and spicy bloody mary and cajun fries (I think I had an ulcer death wish that morning).

8ilYdOcteBu4Hoa0veVNpA.review_text: Came here to grab some drinks before dinner at woodhouse.   I got a mango mojito, loved it. they put a lot of mint and it wasnt overly sweet.  Their food looks good too so I cant wait to come back and try.   Ambiance is pretty laid back.

VwtdVLXenWgk9JMYUwZQOw.review_text: girlfriend of mine had her birthday party here and i stopped by.  it was very packed and seemed like a great place to go to watch a game like the laker's kicking spurs ass!!!!!!!!!

zycslf7iIxKNq0-sLK1UoQ.review_text: This review is not only for the glorious establishment Harry's, but more importantly Maxine Winn.  Maxine carry's a purely artist style, vocally, and physically.  She has made my day as well as friend Corey's on more than 5 occasions.  Also, Marcileno, you're tight.  We enjoy your company too.

I3aNBlJFWq8uvTqqjWyozQ.review_text: Harry's is great for a drink after work, however, I do not recommend ordering a cocktail here. They have a "one shot per drink" policy, resulting in a very weak drink. I learned this by politely asking the bartender if he could possibly put a little more vodka in my vodka cranberry. He took my drink, poured it out, put new ice in it, filled a shot glass with vodka, poured that shot into my glass and then filled the rest with cranberry juice. My drink turned out just as weak as the first one. So now I only order beer at Harry's. Besides that, the atmosphere is lively and the waitresses are friendly but the bartenders... not so much.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text:
RECENT UPDATE: so perhaps harrys is a better sports bar? a big group of us went last sunday to watch the AFC/NFC football championship games and it turned out to be a really great day. they reserved a table for us and drinks consistently flowed all day. fun place for football.
  ORIGINAL REVIEW: its funny, i've been here 3 or 4 times with friends... i love the location, the bar has a nice set-up but for some reason i've never had an amazing "lets go back again soon" time here. i think it might be the crowd. one time i got there early and was waiting for a friend to show up... within a minute i had 2 older gentlemen on both sides of me trying to sidle-up to me. i felt trapped. the moment my friend arrived we bolted. i just don't like this bar although it has great potential to turn itself around. like i said, great location on fillmore.

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: If you're a CPMC slave up the hill, this is THE place for pharmaceutical industry "lectures" ie, insane happy hours where the reps will plow you with alcohol if you are even remotely connected to the doctor they want to talk to. I drank here for free courtesy of some big drug company many times and I don't regret one drink or tasty bar snack.  This was also a pretty decent lunch spot if you can't do the Grove/Mollie Stone's/La Salsa, but I don't think I need to tell you how much the crowd fucking sucks at night. Not my scene, dude. Not at all.

QofHOTxS9QwXoTGbz0l0Iw.review_text: Good burgers and regular pub type food.  The drinks can be kinda pricey, but it's a fun bar to kick it.  Points off for a frat party vibe sometimes.  Points added for the wonderful waitresses.

KivTl6k7urUMhPqPj-MDaQ.review_text: Dear Harry's Bar: Just because you paint the names of your cliche "specialty" drinks on a large mirror behind the bar doesn't mean you can charge more than $10 for them.  The dichotomy if the classiness of the facility and the lack thereof of the clientele is amusing.  It's like you were uprooted from another, more annoying part of town and dropped onto Fillmore.  And your staff is mean.  I was astounded to see that the chain of lame buttrock songs was emanating from a live DJ, not a mix CD.  Goodbye, and see you NEVER. Eric S.

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: Pricey drinks, check.  Attractive Bartenders, check.  Good Kobe Sliders, check.  Usual upper Fillmore/Pac Heights crowd, check.  The place has a lot to love and a lot to hate.  The deal breaker for this place is when you go.  Thursday through Saturday nights are crowded.  Most other times are enjoyable.  Get some bar food and couple of drinks then move on.

OEDNHIPFL9rFSw4Nq-WjJQ.review_text: I met up with some friends here for a late happy hour on a Friday night. The place was packed with the typical crowd for the area... I didn't expect anything too interesting, so that wasn't too distressing - you gotta know what you're getting yourself into. That being said, I was the first in my group to arrive, and I sat at the bar with cash in hand for more than 10 minutes while the female bartenders served the people on either side of me, that already had drinks, more than once! One of them actually stood directly in front of me mixing a drink and avoided all eye contact. No acknowledgment whatsoever!  My take, female bartenders and a beyond tipsy line of 30-something men at the bar, they are looking for their tips, while the guys are looking at their... well, you get the point. I will not go to this bar again because the service disgusted me. I wouldn't recommend it to women who just want to grab a quick drink on a busy night - you are not an important customer, and they let you know it.

oA4ompknoW6XrONKYXQ_jQ.review_text: I have an alcoholic friend.  She has been sober for a year.  We rarely drink around her.  Instead we opt for secret drinks.  I have a lot more non-alcoholic friends.    Well, Harry's is where one of my one non-alcoholic friends and I always meet to have a drink prior to meeting up with my alcoholic friend for dinner at Fresca.    What?  Don't look at me like that!    Fine!  Fine.  I'm going to hell.

0niNpv8X_2I7wIWVWl3ZyA.review_text: Since I have been unemployed and in school (again), I find that the best use of my left over student loan money every month is to dine out, buy booze, or buy shoes. Don't tell the Feds. Since I put said money toward said expenses in that order, from most to least frequent, I have now been eating things with truffles in them at every chance possible, within reason. Reason, as it turns out, would exclude Hubert Keller's $5,000 truffle burger (salivate in disgust over that here: lasvegassun.com/news/201…), which I'd be happy to sample, should any of you fine people need a date to Fleur de Lys.   At Harry's, truffle oil has found its way on to the fries.  I've had truffle oil fries before, and they were very tasty.  Harry's, with what seemed to be sage and parmesan, seemed to fall flat for me. It was like... not the party I had expected it to be. That said, I think Harry's pours a great drink and serves with a smile.  The bartenders and staff are nice, and the prices are... well, not Reno drink prices, but pretty typical SF prices. I think it's between $7 &  $10 for a specialty cocktail.   Ah, those student loan dollars at work!  In other news, if you are an attorney and you'd like to hire me, tell me where to send my resume. I'll need approx. 150K to pay back these bloody food loans.

QjNubQpE1lO2Hod_Nxr-sg.review_text: For what it was...it was ok.  Good bar food, but I have to say the fries and burgers are pretty damn good.

sr5ThmDuk8daEADGWSzLyg.review_text: Okay a few points:  ONE:  waitress was a bitch. thanks for being so nice, oh and enjoy your tip. oh wait, what tip? thats right, i'd rather give my spare $$ to the crackhead down on sutter street.  TWO: umm.. douchebag and cougar central. I'm sorry.. flip flops to the bar? WHY??  And ma'am.. could you NOT hit on my friends little brother? thanks..    THREE: every experience I've had here has not been good. The bartenders were fine, food fine too. the girls who got the drinks.. not so much. The guys hanging around trying to think they're cool with their teva's and william rast jeans.. no.

8gs_YDAT8vVIKVR33imu1A.review_text: this place is great if you're looking for a dark bar with a marina 27-45 crowd.  It's a singles place, but the atmosphere doesn't really allot for much mingling with the crowded two top seats and mediocre drinks.  If you're looking for a place that's got the bare bone basics - come here - if you're looking for a great atmosphere to actually hear another person talk - or a good beer selection - try somewhere else (maybe even Monk's Kettle).

swqPgaC_wLtmVbCYxIpOqw.review_text: Harry's is a solid go to for a simple weekday drink. I live in the area so it's close, convenient, and always has some people there. Prices are reasonable, and they have some good beers. I love the special large mouth jars the Lagunitas IPA come in. Their happy hour looks good but i never make it early enough to try it out. It's in a lively, cute neighborhood - Fillmore - so there is plenty to do around there. I'll have to try it on a weekend sometime.

g4qdXv9tO5f-XxD2KVlKpA.review_text: i guess i'm in agreement with the other yelpers on this one - for a change. solid 3 stars.  but not anything more than that.  i've been here maybe a dozen times.  it seems to be a place that you go with 6 or 7 of your friends that all live in the area (walking distance probably) and you all want to go somewhere for a drink - maybe after dinner in the area, but you don't really want to get all that dressed up.  so you can go here.  it's got people in it!  that's for sure. we weren't alone.  it wasn't shoulder to shoulder pushy and shovey.  there were people, fairly dressed down.  i suppose it's also a place to bring your date after you eat dinner right around the corner and you don't want to get back in the car before calling it a night.   but i felt a little out-of-place.  there seemed to be a lot of guys wearing jeans and a dress shirt.  which was puzzling.  how do you do that?  do you come from work?  i wear a dress shirt while at work but i don't wear jeans with it.  i have a dressy type of job where you have to kind of wear nice pants so what jobs do you wear a dress shirt and jeans?  or do they change INTO the dress shirt and jeans AFTER work?  i don't get that either.  because why would you change your pants but not change your shirt?  let me see: "yes, it's after work ... i'll change out of these dorky pants but keep this stylin' sexy shirt i have on, but untuck it.  or maybe tuck it in! yeah."  and some of the guys not only had jeans and dress shirts but sweaters on top of that.  i'm not a hater so i think it's all good.  do whatever makes you feel good.  i'm just noting.    this is a place to go if you want to dress in jeans and dress shirts or maybe if you like people that do.  suffice to say that it appears to be a crowd from the neighborhood that didn't want to bother going anywhere too far away. enough said.  been a while but the food, as i recall, is also 3 stars.  there was a DJ the night i went and the music was probably a notch above the crowd which means that he probably won't be DJ'ing there much longer.

aXjSSohHC9yGlrXYbDLe2g.review_text: Was just visiting last night for New Year's Eve and was not impressed.. Paid $80 dollars at the door ($10 each) & about $200 in drinks and the wait staff proceeded to shove not just me, but 2 other members of my party to clear the path for her to deliver drinks.   I get it - you need some room to operate. Thanks to the guys at the door letting everyone in, that wasn't a possibility. After working in restaurants/hospitality for 11 years, I can rightfully say I am very disappointed and will not return.   There are plenty of other fine establishments in the city who deserve my business.   Cheers

BCTHdSoeI-IQyaeixjSNdg.review_text: Since it's the ONLY bar in my neighborhood, I have no choice but to stroll down that way for a drink. Oh and pay 8+ for a mixed drink. I am sending out a SOS. If anyone is looking to open a bar this would be a great place to put up a nice neighborhood bar. Do it and do it fast!!

gnImz6ZvVwirX4oH6cB-mA.review_text: First the positives. Nice setting, good location, decent food and great bus/support staff. BUT the attitude from the wait staff is so thick you could cut it with a knife.  Arrogant, pushy and full of themselves. It might actually be charming if they were half as attractive as they seem to think they are.  I'll continue to patronize due to location and happy hour deals, but don't expect competent or even cordial service.  With better service I would rate 3 stars in case you don't care about service.

YZxZopC-X-fSONb3Dq2DUA.review_text: This place is always packed on a weekend evening...And during a Saturday/ Sunday afternoon, it's packed as well...It doesn't stop.  So it's a good place to catch a game or a neighborhood drink.

ZnBTVsQMCuHdp4qmwrZNeQ.review_text: I like their Mac and Cheese. I was so super hungry. It's 11pm-nothing else is open nearby.  Long Day at work and a hellish commute so I hadn't eaten anything for like, what 10 hours??? Elite had shut, so what to do? brave Harry's.   Friday. Super crowded. Walk in, Justin Timberlake's annoying song is on, and two drunk girls are smacking each other in the ass as all the ex-jocks ogle. gag.  go to the waitress, says she can't help me. i'm still hungry....not happy happy Joy Joy. More like hungry hungry Joy Joy. I think this review is skewed by the growls of my stomach.....

lXtS5MsO2xPcChp6dZPm8A.review_text: I live a couple blocks away from here and I go here all the time. Never been disappointed. Food is awesome, and they have great drink specials during happy hours.  Last time there were even "Absolut" girls that gave us all drinks for 2 bucks! Not a bad deal...It gets very loud and crowded later in the night but a fun atmosphere for sure.

WS3HDCo9CRQMnd37OXXuKA.review_text: It's been awhile since I've been here.....now I remember why.  How do you mess up bar food??  By the way, the waitresses here have limited personality.  Try smiling every once in awhile.

r2-fuL5SE-BzJv-7lni80g.review_text: Bad crowd, bad food, bad vibe.

1JUuxkZxEN6L7JW1SvbjmQ.review_text: Now that I've recovered from the food poisoning, I'd like to temper my review a little.  I'm not absolutely positive that Harry's was the cause of my pain.  The 2 other people I ate with did not get sick--although neither ate the tomato.  Food poisoning or not, the burger was dry, overcooked, and worse than what you would get at McDonald's or any burger chain.  .

W9BWCeuTjQH0TbFeuPB7Ww.review_text: I really wanted to like this place.  The atmosphere is cool and its so close to my apartment that I even gave it a second try .  The food is decent at best and the service, well, quite frankly it blows.  The waitstaff was more interested in chatting at the bar in a cluster than serving the patrons.  (This was the case both times.)  She seriously didnt crack one smile or say one word during or after serving.  The first time I got the Kobe burger which was good, but two dollars extra for "cajun" fries that ended up being splashed with chili powder didnt exactly score points in my book. The second time I ordered a BLT & A and the avocado was literally black.  My girlfriend ordered a veggie burger both times and was pleased, but then again she still thinks lousy servers should get 20%.......  Not the worst place, but if you appreciate good food coupled with good service, go somewhere else.

PZvyqN7sgHI-o4f8z7O-ZQ.review_text: OK yeah I've read fellow Yelpers' reviews of Harry's and see their 3 star-related points, but you know what? I'm the kind of dude who doesn't make bars and restaurants earn every single star I give. Your place starts with 5, then I adjust accordingly. Nice, huh?  So after drinking here a couple of times, I can understand the gripes that the clientele isn't always the coolest group of people you'll meet, and that the food isn't that great, and there's nothing truly outstanding about the place. But so what? I like their drinks (and the mojito on the hot Sunday afternoon after the Cherry Blossom festival hit the spot), it's spacious, is located in a nice part of town, and I always feel kinda at home here. Which probably says more about me than Harry's...

x3cLQwSLV4ow8eEmHRNecQ.review_text: The Good:  I wasn't really in to the San Fran club culture until I meet Harry's Bar. I went with some friends from the area and this place is like cheers for drunk sexy people. The place was crowded but in a good way bunch women keep bumping into us. Just grab a spot next to the bar and have a great time!   The Bad:  Parking but isn't that just how it is in San Francisco. There was not enough taxis around.

e_Nl3VfvnZhewUpHgAF6mQ.review_text: Slow service, but the atmosphere is cool. The mango mojitos are quite good (not as good as Le Colonial!) and a little expensive. Overall, it's a nice place to grab a quick bite to eat or a drink with a friend.

O96xqRJ8NghRgWOjDoPNXw.review_text: So, I had been hoping for a nice little breakfast joint in which to partake in a good ol eggs benedict, a view of the water, sun on my face - the start to Sunday Funday - that did not happen.   Boys made a date to meet here to watch the games....okay no worries, Im down....cause Im easy like Sunday morning, right?  To begin with I like the hood and today was an unusually warm day in the city so there was a lot of people watching to do.....and damn if I didn't keep eyeing that dress at Betsey Johnson across the street - focus Kitty focus.....  FIrst virgin bloody mary was pretty much tomato juice with a giant celery stick......um ok. After a debacle with whose name the reservation was under and blah blah blah we sat down. I was starving and ordered a bacon cheeseburger.....yes yelpers Im pregnant - a girl needs virgin drinks and red meat on a daily basis as of this week.   Burger came out a prefect medium rare but the bacon was rubber crispy - an odd combination but I could have cared less at that point. Fries were tasty as I am sure they were fried in some sort of evil oil.   Second bloody mary came out spicy as I requested but at that point my taste buds had left the building and all I wanted was a 7-up.   Ok, so the low down - nice servers, nice bartenders, okay menu, only three choices for breakfast, nothing that I am going to beg my husband to bring me back for but it is a nice little place to have a drink and watch the game...........3.5 stars

HkKQnZd8jT8WtlJKH0X77w.review_text: Oh, Harry's.  Let me count the ways...  Harry's is the bar closest to my house.  That's why i moved here.  Ok, not really, but it is definitely a plus.    Harry's is always busy.  Someone is always drinking in there, so I never feel like i'm doing something wrong, even if it's 12:30.  In the afternoon.    Harry's has outside table for awesome afternoon sunny drinking.  And huge windows that open up to let in the light, too.  They have food, too.  Their burgers are quite good.  In fact that is the only thing i would recommend on the menu.  But hey, who goes there to eat, anyway?

6j-83dSs723UFBBgmx3_xw.review_text: This restaurant has a nice sport bar/gentlemans club ambiance, ( late fifties gentlemans club in the woodwork and decor).  I have only eaten here for lunch, I can imagine this place being a packed meat market after dark, thus the only eat here for lunch caveat.  I had a good hamburger - it was overcooked and served slightly less than warm, the fries were cold.  Had the food been hot I would have given 4 stars.  Our waitress was very nice and accomodating.  The bar has an impressive list of drinks i.e. blood orange margarita, I'll be back for a late afternoon drink - but only if it isn't crowded.

M19NwFwAXKRZzt8koF11hQ.review_text: (See pics)  Generally not a fan of this street's bars as there always seem to be too crowded leaving out the chillax factor. This evening a group of us came after a Yelp event and decided to grab a bite and a drink.  Harry's Bar, one of those that looks busy during the day time, was quite chill on this Sunday evening.  It was spacious with a solid bar menu such as salsa with chips, calamari, potato fries, spicy chicken wings and mozzarella sticks and all were delicious. I had an Irish coffee and it was also fairly good.  Service was good and friendly.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: I was willing to give this place 3 stars despite my having to watch a full game of football, not a single pt scored in the 3rd qtr, EXCITING.   What got me wasn't the somewhat stale pita nor the stingy portion of artichoke dip, for bar food the burger was pretty good and who can argue with chocolate lava cake? It was the fact that I was craning my neck to see around a hanging light positioned directly in front of the TV screen (why would you do that?), and sweating profusely while doing so (this is SF, why am I sweating?). Alright, so their "fan" broke, but I could've generated more wind with a leaf even if it wasn't broken.  For a sports bar, if you're coming to Harry's pick a spot near a TV and by the door, otherwise there are plenty of other sports bars that are better.

y3HFVx8nbNmomSc-PWOy-g.review_text: Popped in here the other night.  Nice to see the place is still jumping after all these years.  Walked in and couldn't even get a spot at the bar so I popped across the street and had a drink at the Elite Cafe before bouncing back just in time to find a prime spot at the bar.  Had a couple drinks and also ordered an appetizer of nachos ($8.95 plus $1.95 to add grilled chicken).  Nachos were just okay.  The portion was certainly plentiful and I paid extra to have it with grilled chicken, but the temperature was lukewarm at best and the cheese wasn't what I am used to seeing on nachos.  it was a really watery, strange light-colored cheese sauce that kinda grossed me out.  Sad, because over the years, I have always loved coming in here for appetizers and to dine at the bar.  I had ordered it before too, but had forgotten how bad it was.  I won't be ordering that again.  As always, the cocktails were good...the bartender that had been helping me completely disappeared though and then reappeared like an hour or so later.  She came up, did something with her register and left.  I told the other girl working there that she had totally forgotten about me and was told that she hadn't.  Yes, I guess I really enjoyed sitting there all that time, forgotten and waiting for my next drink and my bill.  I used to really love this place and I still like it, but this visit was far from magical.  In this competitive market, Harry's had better step up their game or be left in the dust.  Then again, judging by the full bar, I guess people just don't care.  As always, a great place to meet and sometimes eat.

zW9Z278npO2i_phglHX18g.review_text: happening to be walking down Fillmore Yelping for the next bar to check out.  Harry's was the closest one so we decided to check it out.  Was about 9ish on a Saturday night.  The place was wasn't packed yet so we were luckily enough to get a seat at the bar.  The crowds looks like normal (lol my variation of normal) and the place had a good easy going vibe to it.  The bartenders weren't so busy at to be ignoring us so we got drinks right away and not stupid expensive either.  A couple of big screen TVs with the A's & Giants games on.  We didn't try the food so I can't comment on the menu.  My only knock on the place if I had to give one would be they don't had a whole lot of beers on tap - maybe 5 if memory serves, not a big deal, just putting it out there.   All and all a good relaxed time.  If I'm on Filmore again, I'll make sure to swing by.

39xpC_ncPbmz-2PeB9V22Q.review_text: The male bartender working with a gote was extremely rude to me and my friends. When I tried to get his attention to order a drink at the bar he raised his hand up at me and told me "don't do that" and walked away. He made a similar comment when I tried to order a second drink. Great bar but very unimpressed by our bartender.

ZcDVqrn6mk6AkhAp2aOEmA.review_text: I am surprised to see so many negative reviews for thsi place. I love this place. I go here regularly over the weekends and find the music and the atmosphere to be pretty cool. It is a little crowded though, but its a bar and its good, so its got to be crowded. this gets 5 stars from me any day!

JjtQ1txoSd69pSwUPsWxcA.review_text: Mango mojito was killer. Burger was killer. Got a table despite the world cup final. It was tasty and a fun place to have a beer and burger. I'll definitely come back to chill.

IT8Wi1ALLF325LfUIHU0vA.review_text: I walked in here for a beer and to check out the scene. The place was packed on a Sunday afternoon. The food menu did not look that interesting but if you are looking for something "off the menu" I think it is a pretty good place. Tally ho gentleman!

oOLMN5z8xSoSRHwAV_yd0g.review_text: Harry's Bar has a great old school atmosphere, good selection of drinks and delicious food! I love their veggie burgers-the best I've ever had at a restuarant-and sweet potato fries!! Mondays they have a burger and beer special :)   This is an awesome place to come chill with a small group of friends. The place is relatively small so if you have a large group it might take a long time to get a table large enough for everyone.

TMr5z8JDuGPc0I-5WfpBMQ.review_text: Came here yesterday during happy hour, but their only happy hour was1/2 off their wines...which was not really what I was looking for.  They have a pretty good selection of beer and for a good price to (~$5), and their cocktails are decent.  The 5 of us shared some appetizers, and those were really good.  The chicken nachos were my favorite by far, and the cheese they use on it is this white creamy cheese that was soooo good.  Plus the jalapenos, chicken, and guac on it topped it off.  The calamari and spicy chicken wings were both good, but I'm not sure if the food is worthy of the price.

WO4ojAvstSzj7cQ42nV-Yg.review_text: So being in back in grad school is interesting because it brings back all  the same habits and trends of being a freshman in college. Unlike the much older and wiser 3rd years, the 1st years still travel in packs. Its not enough that we spend every second of every day in class together, in lab together, in the library studying together, but we need to go out together as well.   I guess its tradition, but Harry's is the watering hole for all UoP dental students. This means that any day there is a huge test, we inevitably will end up at Harry's afterwards. If it is someone's birthday, which is also a common occurrence considering there are 145 people in my class, we go to Harry's. If it is Friday, we go to Harry's.
