I am beginning to think that we give this place so much business that there should be some sort of a discount for UoP students. So ladies and gents, if you want to meet a guy or girl with high PEP (potential earning power) I guess this the place to start looking.

M0mONsg1ZJIKA30ad1qE1w.review_text: AWESOME HAPPY HOUR!  Garlic Fries: - crispy, fresh, buttery, and only slightly garlic-y, enough so that your breath doesn't reek of garlic after dinner  Truffle Fries: - crispy, fresh, and meaty tasting - worth trying over the garlic fries * would definitely recommend  Kobe Sliders: - juicy, tender - bland patty - grilled onions gave the burger some flavor and sweetness  Calamari: - crispy, crunchy, and buttery!!  probably one of the best fried calamari dishes i have had.    - calamari meat was good chewy texture, not too hard and dried out like other places * would definitely recommend  Mozzerella Sticks: - nothing too special, very bland, inside and out  Cheap cocktails!!   - i asked the waitress to surprise me, so i got a tequila-pineapple juice that turned out tastier and stronger than the gin and rum mixes that my friends got  Service:  - we had this sweet blonde girl, she was very nice in making accomodations to our party, and making sure she entered in our orders before happy hour ended - even though we were late comers - accidentally left my phone there, but she kindly locked it in the safe for me and returned it to me when i came back for it!  so awesome  Overall, awesome food (especially the truffle fries and calamari), kind service, and friendly atmosphere!  i would definetely come again perhaps for happy hour again or to try their meals!

GVXDcOOsexTAUJJdP14U4g.review_text: Came here for weekend brunch (probably). Had a blast hanging out with my friends (probably), eating a nice breakfast dish of some sort (probably), and enjoying the bottomless bellinis (definitely).

LrvKFG_j93umkuctQwvLEA.review_text: the blackened chicken sandwich is back...

GgW4jEXFcD4_7NBQZXFuag.review_text: Bar on Fillmore.  Serves bar food and has a large menu of cocktails and drinks.  Wine list is ok.  Has large TV's playing sports or movies.  Sometimes a DJ on the weekends.  Can get busy at night and hard to get service depending on the staff.   Brunch has Bottomless for $10.  Was looking forward to trying their brunch food, but after waiting 30 minutes without receiving our drinks we left.  Horrible service that morning.  There was one bartender and one server and almost all table were taken.   We left to go somewhere else.

LUm7l2cPDM_whNbyMp4lYQ.review_text: What the hell happened to Harry's? I used to swing by here often just for the great Kobe beef burgers. Tonight, it tasted like I was eating frozen patties dipped in cold sweat. The beef tasted bland, the "fries" were blah, and the only reason I finished was because I was paying for the darn thing. My friend, who I was also paying for, had the luxury of sending his away after two bites.   I used to put up with Harry's douchey cougar-bait fratters and SoCo lime chicks for their solid burgers and onion rings (which they don't have any more). Back to overpriced after-work shots instead.

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: Football and Brunch!  Surprisingly good fritatta served with mixed greens.  Perfect hangover food!  Sloooooooooooooooow service.  Go Niners!

qjoZFgL9j4jdGgQXkEQW3g.review_text: DRINKS ONLY!  We came here after dinner at Pizzeria Delfina. The place wasn't too packed yet, but by the time we left around midnight it was pretty hoppin'.   They crowd is probably closer to late 20's-mid 30's and not as hipsterish as what you get at a lot of nearby places. One local said this was the "most New York" bar in the area. Whatever that means.  They have  a deal for a whiskey shot and a draft beer for $10. Awesome deal when you know a shot is $7. I lived on those.  I also had their greyhound, and they use fresh-squeezed grapefruit so it was delicious.   The pricing is a little higher (not ridiculously so, but definitely assume near $10/drink) but I was happy with the atmosphere, the music, and the general vibe of the place.

gnor7oSGErXJyVSDDO4azg.review_text: Great place to come and chill and have a drink, great laid back atmosphere! They play great music on the weekends.

dC5kYsLGGoLLVlMjeMqfLw.review_text: The bf and I were walking down Fillmore and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. That's how we found ourselves at Harry's Bar. The first thing we loved was the "please seat yourself" sign...so we did. The only downside was that it took some time (about 15 minutes or so) to order, but they were pretty full. After we did order...food came out very quickly.   What we ordered... *Breakfast burrito (flour tortilla filled with eggs, cheese, bacon and salsa) - simple, but very tasty.  *Turkey sandwich (sounds just blah, huh?)...but this tasty sandwich comes with bacon, avocado and chipotle aioli on sourdough.  *Do yourself a favor and order the garlic fries. DO IT!  *BF ordered one of their many bloody mary's and loved it. Blue cheese filled olives...yes, please!  Next time...I'm getting either their raspberry mojito or one of their champagne cocktails. Or maybe all of them. So much goodness!   Bonus - several TVs throughout the restaurant and awesome daily drink specials. PERFECT place to watch a game or to just have drinks with friends.   Overall...on a street full of delicious restaurants...Harry's Bar holds their own. I highly suggest you give them a try.

Fg1ZhF_2pHcRwgyq_6yUiQ.review_text: it's a transcendent bar experience, even with the yuppies.  a great place to watch the game or just to hang out, it gets crowded sometimes for good reason. they make a good manhattan and the staff is extra-friendly, especially if you knew any of them in high school. drinks are well-priced, even for the area.  you'd think of a place this clean and classy as belonging in the marina, but the fillmore has one of its own.

RCmFusO1_e8LzjkbNPyJDg.review_text: whiny asses crying about discimination....  bitter man hating lesbians getting agro....  what a bunch of pussies.  I GOTTA start comign to this place!

Bp-TQEtc6Vs6ldnLgjqglg.review_text: i would come here more often for a pint and burger while reading the sunday times if it weren't for the millions of loud, sweaty, abercrombie and fitch wearing, frayed baseball cap toting, fraternity sharing, unibrow plucking TOOLS and their wank groupies that look like they just graduated from tanning school and sporting nice little muffin tops.....  one star for the food (which, is a-ight for the price).  if the boom boom room served food, i'd be all up in that joint.

etubXPmhZmNX9xNnp-mwLQ.review_text: I go harry's all the time not only because I live in the neighborhood, but because there are good bar foods and drinks.  It can be soooo crowded on weekend though.  Personally, I like sunday though thursday since it's less crowded.   It's comfortable and easy.  If you like beers and cocktails, this place is the way to go. Plus it's open late.  What I like the most is the sliders!!!!!!!!!!!  Their sliders and fries are the best.  It's like a neighborhood hangout place.  You may like it, may not.  Depends what kind of vibes you like.  So, come check it out!!

ql-JNHMqpseFUbB6p-b-sg.review_text: Cold beer, and $6 Burger & Fries special........ How could you go wrong!!???

4DeQyBgWx-NBIYHCKq2Chw.review_text: OK, Lara, the manager with brown hair is horrible!  She should not be in a customer service industry. I have frequent Harry's on and off for the last 9 years that I lived in the neighborhood.  But not anymore.  It was a good place to get some cocktails, watch a game and bring my clients.  But with managers like that you are NOT getting my business, $$ or recommendations anymore. LARA needs to get some manners, Intelligence or fired!  I will not bring my clients there anymore

gVPjZNCn68ZXmDmk4XhR2A.review_text: Great place to come and watch the big matches. However, they are often stingy with their bottomless mimosa specials. When it is crowded, it is not very diverse, which is something I look for in an SF bar.   Came here for the UEFA Champions League Final, great atmosphere. Came here after the Fillmore Jazz Festival, not fun.   Find the day that works best...

cT-qW9c0E_1UV46KSQCAuQ.review_text: If I never go back here - I will be ok.

VexWkVF1SOf6xpw8jUNjzQ.review_text: I can imagine i wouldnt like it here if it was crowded during one of the bigger games but on this one Saturday i went, it was perfect. Only a couple of empty tables but enough for our group of 7 to get down on some dranks n eats. Nothing that really blew my chucks off my feet but i did like their mojitos cuz it was in the high 80's that day. Ordered their truffle/romano fries on top of an order of the veggie focaccia. pretty good sandwich...damn, my mouth just watered thinking about this

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: A little old school but good food and drinks for the Fillmore area.  The truffle fries were my fave; the mac and cheese was good but not particularly memorable. The tacos were good, and so was the seared ahi salad. Good for the neighborhood

UzG5IHFUu6H1UyCRbqHHZw.review_text: ok ok, harry.  i've had a bit of a change of heart.  the spinach dip is delicious, but it doesn't come w/enough pieces of pita bread.  the burgers are pretty good.  fresh mixed greens, a good portion of fries...  although, my fillmore burger w/swiss cheese, roasted onions, trumpet mushrooms was cooked rarer than expected.  ...but...  not worth $22 + tax + tip.  and...  i still won't touch you w/a 10 foot pole during evening hours.

dcPQNbeNAeqvGggDXNKudg.review_text: I've been to Harry's a couple of times since its right down the street from my apartment and my boyfriend is a fan of their hamburgers.  Usually the food is pretty decently good, it's pretty hard to mess up a burger.   But I think the service can be hit or miss with this place.  I ordered the grilled cheese and the tomato soup under the sandwich category.  And in parenthesis uder the sandwich category it states, (all sandwiches are served with fries).  Unfortunately when I received my sandwich it didn't have any, so I asked the waitress.  And at first she said it didn't come with fries, but after showing her what the menu said, she apologized and said she would come get my fries right away.    She comes out a minute later from the kitchen stating that the sandwich doesn't come with fries.  Even if the sandwich doesn't come with fries, it shouldnt be under the category that says it is served with fries.  And I'm sure not too many customers ask for the fries when ordering, so why not make the customers that do, and serve them fries (which costs the business maybe 50 cents).    If we do go again, I guess next time I will have to clearly ask what comes with what meal, because the menu could be wrong.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: Not sure how many times I've been here, but we had some time to kill before a movie at Kabuki and rather than wait to get trashed at the bar inside the theater (god BLESS you Sundance (Kid) for putting a 3D cartoon movie in the 21-and-over section of the theater) we stopped at Harry's*.   Best Hendricks cucumber gimlet (or any gimlet) I have had in a long LONG time.   Service was great. Although the place really started to pick up around 8 (Saturday) with what was clearly singles.   So I guess if you are looking for a place with amazing drinks which will swiftly and deliciously dispense with your inhibitions....duck into Harry's for 20 minutes.   I'll definitely check out the monday night burger thing.  thanks yelpers.  PS: Dear Harry's management/staff: I know you guys aren't a sports bar per-se, but you've GOTTA do something about the angles of the flat screens! the center of the bar is like a dead-zone.  *okay, we still got trashed in the theater. But seriously, HOW can you pass up actual-glass champagne flutes, a full bottle, and dorky 3D glasses?!?!?!?

jwW2bxNbCpZIcHuYL5JjYA.review_text: Pro's: * Open late * Lively atmosphere * Truffle fries  Con's: * Almost always too crowded * Expensive * No happy hour specials  I would go to Harry's bar on two occasions:  1. If I am craving their amazing truffle oil french fries  2. If I want to get a drink late on a weeknight. Most places on that part of Fillmore close early. So it's nice to have a place to go after 10 pm on a weeknight.

kJ1DWC8d6YdpRhdLwctjLg.review_text: Good food, especially the Kobe burgers, and their regular sized burgers.  Drinks are a little on the watered down side, but I remedy that situation by having a shot of Irish Whisky and a beer.  Get there early on and then go somewhere else once the yunguns start piling in.

VKZLyatJIBluTouWvZghAw.review_text:
Harry's is a weird place, but on fillmore st., it's one of the better places to eat if you're not some rich yuppie. The burgers are fairly big and quite tasty. Chips and salsa are a good appetizer too. 
  The one complaint is during the lunch hours it gets kinda busy and there's only one waitress doing most things (the bartender runs food). And sometimes, the waitress tends to ignore certain tables. 
  Last time I went there the service was a little better so I gave it four stars.

F7SgSRGCnNDiPz9EBaicgw.review_text: Boyfriend and I came in on a Thursday night for dinner and drinks. Food was great and reasonably priced for San Francisco. Drinks were decent and the service was good. Liked the ambiance but I was told it was "dead" that night. To me it seemed pretty packed so I'm probably not venturing in here when there's more people, not really in to feeling like a packed sardine in a can. Oh, met the owner and he was very pleasant. Really says something about a place when the owner doesn't mind introducing himself and asking how everything is going for you. Will probably come back next time I want a lil' snack in the Marina.

mgof5X-rGvqsOMKSmsCU_A.review_text: Great customer service, quality food and fast cold drinks. Warm atmosphere, clean and comfortable. A great place for happy hour or anytime.

TeWVfmqxTFoK_ZX2MDvGQg.review_text: I have a love, hate relationship with this bar.  The space is a bit narrow and long to feel comfortable mingling if you haven't landed a good spot early one.  I'm not a violent man or a belligerent drunk (usually) and yet drinking with these patrons seems to consistently threaten violence.  The ladies are suitably aggressive as they take their young cougars in training practical exams.  At the same time, the drinks are tasty, the people watching is fun and the ladies are suitably aggressive.

R7atWnGlDkXTzS78iwH7Xg.review_text: Oh Harry's....how I love you so.... let me count the ways...  1. Bottomless Bellinis?  Yes...absolutely...   2.  Majorly fun place to watch the Giants in Orange October w/friends...the crowd, servers and bartenders were all super enthusiastic  3.  The food actually isn't bad for a bar....my burger was better than I expected and our server was nice and pretty quick on her toes...  I heart you Harry's...

77orrALxKhy6zamnstuMVQ.review_text: Kobe beef sliders.  That is the only reason to go in here.  But it is a good enough reason, that despite the fact that it is OBNOXIOUSLY LOUD, and smells like a bar, I will still give it four stars.  But only just barely.    At all costs, avoid popping in on a weekend, unless you are a drunk football fan!

94Vdm34IzLwC-FK3p6bGsw.review_text: This is somewhat of a skewed rating, because I'm judging it as a brunch/early afternoon place as opposed to a nightlife spot. I probably would not come here if I was looking to party on a weekend night, but for the morning after, it's absolutely on point.  First off -- bottomless bellini brunch. Can we talk about how many times I've finished off about two carafes on my own with my other alcoholic degenerate friends? It's you're typical cheap Prosecco mixed with peach puree, but guess what? It's actually pretty good and certainly does the trick.  Good selection of breakfast plates (eggs, bacon, potatoes; chilaquiles; frittatas, etc.) that will satisfy your hangover, plus other snacks like french fries are equally tasty.   Service can be a little slow because this place does get busy for brunch and there are usually only like two waitresses working, but they are very friendly. I seem to remember (it's hazy, though) that one of them even allowed the aforementioned degenerates to stay beyond the 2 hour time limit on bottomless belllinis. I'm so full of shame.

qD5HLqYssT0tFG6FBTTslg.review_text: Don't come here expecting an incredible restaurant or bar, but Harry's is a good neighborhood staple. Bottomless bellinis and brunch is a regular thing for us, and popping in for a beer and every now again works just fine. It's big enough to get a group in, and there lots of TVs for games.   I hate the white tile they recently put in, and if it wasn't across the street from my apt, I wouldn't venture across town to get here.  The servers are nice, and the tater tots are bomb.

ElqZrC18jqOCVCJjZgM6xA.review_text: We couldn't get into The Grove, so we joined the crowd gathering outside Harry's Bar for brunch at 11am.  The poor waitress was alone but somehow serving all these tables by herself.  The bottomless bellinis ($10 within 1.5 hours) were great and packed a bigger punch than we expected.  My breakfast burrito was incredible and surprising coming from a bar.  The other menu items got so-so reviews.

leKtNh_i4YES5fIvOhtHoA.review_text: Harry's deserves to be commended for the quality - and strength - of their mango mojitos.  And now that I've partaken of them on three occasions in the last month or so, I figure it's time to share the love with the world.  In the interest of full disclosure:  they pack a powerful punch.  Watch how many you dare to consume if you're planning to head over to a show at the Fillmore down the street...you may feel entitled to jump on the stage.    And don't bother drinking  on an empty stomach, the food is really good here.  We split the Route 66 burger (bacon, bbq sauce, cheese)and the Killer Kobe (which is served with an awesome chipotle aioli).  The burgers were juicy and cooked perfectly.  Great fries, too!

a5bVNQAqI_oYrHq0oLMGkQ.review_text: Loved the inside n outside seating- did not like the hot wings , overfried, dry n not enough sauce, so I wouldnot get them again. But still 4 stars due to very tasty sliders, garlic fries n blue moon! I'd go back there again for the atmosphere (cute, bar-ish, nice crowd) n sliders;)! Yum!!

drYNmDsQdJi-YpxsoIBvAg.review_text: This place is THE lamest bar in all of San Francisco.  Besides the "scene" (read: frat boys, old men dressed like frat boys and emotionally stifled white girls with too much makeup on), the service is slow, at best.  The waitresses all walk around like they're trying to figure out some difficult mathematical proof in their head, when they're really just setting a drink on the table, trying not to spill it.  The "cuisine" is pallid and way overpriced.  Just go to Japantown...the shrimp are bigger and the Sake is stronger than anything those yahoo bartenders can make at Harry's (and thick Japanese accents are easier to decipher than bimbo blank stares).  Ugh...I so hated this place.

ADIMCaJqpUy97l8LMOtHYA.review_text: Great service (even on a busy Friday night)! Mixed drinks are reasonably priced and STRONG. The only food I ordered was the f'ing fantastic mozzarella sticks. Just great, not greasy at all, perfectly crisp breadcrumbs...but the spicy marinara sauce really made it. Plenty of TVs to watch your game of choice. Definitely a place I'll come back to.

v6YD66ixMQ5vW9afzxxMpA.review_text:
The category:
 Bars
  The seven-word skinny:
 Just a good time all the time
  The review:
 I've lived in many different cities since I turned 21 and Harry's is one of the best "local watering holes" that I've come across in that time.  First and foremost, its location satisfies my "within stumbling distance of home" requirement.  I believe this is the most important requirement of any neighborhood drinking establishment and admittedly, it biases my already favorable review.  Secondly, it's as versatile a joint as they come.  Have birthday coming up and need a place to celebrate?  There'll be a lively and attractive crowd at Harry's with good music to boot.  Just want to chill out and maybe grab a bite?  Head in during the day or at night early in the week and order up one of their specialty mojitos and something off their menu.  No matter when you drop in, there are always people there and for good reason.
  The bar itself is very clean and comfortable.  There are many two and four-person diner-style tables (which can be combined for larger parties) that lend themselves perfectly to the SF's "group outing" approach to nightlife, as well as some lounge-style benches and tables in the front of the bar.
  The waitstaff and bartenders don't actually turn over as much here as I've seen in other places, and I think it's a testament to the fact that Harry's is a fun place to work and has plenty of business.  Plus you can't go wrong with Xavier making sure the Thursday through Saturday crowd doesn't get out of control on weekends.
  All in all, I'm a happier SF resident for having Harry's in my life and even if you don't live 'round these parts, it's worth checking out!
  The good:
 Lively and attractive crowd, good music
  The bad:
 Quite loud if you're trying to enjoy a late dinner (but then again, it's a bar), very group-oriented (but that's SF for ya')
  The notable:
 Burger specials on Monday (burger w/ fries and a beer for under $10), food served 'til 1:30am EVERY NIGHT!
  The Junius pick:
 The Kobe Burger!
  The person you're dating:
 Should be brought here after dinner (ESPECIALLY if you're within stumbling distance of your home)
  The significant other/spouse:
 Should be brought here earlier in the week, as your deep conversations about your future will be drowned out by the music and the crowd Thursday through Saturday night.
  The last time I was there:
 5/1/2006
  The number of times I've been there:
 Too many to count, but well over 50

t7HzYVvLK2tCAden5FktVw.review_text: This venue is one worth passing by.... but with few options on Fillmore, you will go there, and again, and damn it probably again.  Constant staff turnover, a new batch each week.  Some are good, some not, don't get attached to any bartender or cocktail waitress, they won't be there next week.  All the women serve drinks and cocktail.  Men are at the door and in the kitchen.... boring formula.  Don't get caught here at last call.... just finish your drink and leave.... nope, they literally just take it from you.  I was quite astonished to have someone come to my table and just take the drink I ordered just a minute or two before last call (barely 1/4 consumed too).  So glad I paid for that..... friggin a-hole.  This place is loaded with the frat boy crowd... and the place is so unsure if its trying to be upscale, sports bar, or neighborhood watering hole.... and can't seem to get any of them right.  Some elegant cocktails, some very nice wines, a respectable menu..... then women serving drinks that strike you as if its their first hospitality job, dressed in skin tight clothes.  DJ on some nights.... blasting way way way to loud.  If they would decide what they are trying to be, they could probably pull it off well, as the decor is also pretty decent......   Maybe someday, someone will figure it out and decide: either sports bar, upscale lounge, or neighborhood haunt.

qC50T_ldJ96wPBNDD6vtEA.review_text: Located on Fillmore Street, the dark leather chairs invite you in to watch a game on one of the many televisions.  Although the seating area can be a bit tight, so ask if you can get one of the partial booths instead of the tables.  The best aspect of Harry's is the food - think adult versions of all your childhood favorites - mac and cheese, tater tots, and chicken tenders.  The kitchen is pretty fast too.  I've been there many times when the food comes out in about 10-15 minutes, and I still don't have the drink I ordered.  So, expect slow service for drinks if you're ordering at a table.  You'll definitely get faster service if you approach the bar on your own.  Food and drinks are fairly priced for Fillmore Street - cocktails are about $10 and draft beer is about $6.  Harry's does a pretty decent mojito, and there is usually a fruit mojito option.  Be aware that organizations rent out Harry's for private parties, which is great if you're looking for a bar to host your event, but not so awesome when you're turned away at the door for not being part of that group.    As mentioned before, Harry's falls short on service.  Beyond slow drinks, I had a really rude interaction with a server there when splitting a check.  My friend put down cash and I put the remainder on my credit card.  When I got the bill back, written on my copy of the amount put on my card was the total amount of the bill circled many times.  The original bill was also there with the total amount circled again.  I realize she was probably trying to passive aggressively remind us to tip on the whole amount, but really?  I usually tip well, but that's basically asking to not be tipped.  Long story short: great food, great location, and subpar service.

E1p1QZj9sYDkoWLnIX-qsA.review_text: We were told 1 1/2 hours by SPQR so we walked down filmore and into Harry's bar for the first time.  the place was packed but the wait was 5-minutes - so far so good.  the service was quick and efficient.  the server seemed very competent.  We ordered a turkey burger and the kobe sliders.  The sliders were wonderful and the turkey burger was ok.  The beer was cold and we were happy.  Harry's is loud and has a lot going on.  there is music playing, tv's all around and people having a good time.  We will likely be back.

4Fyf9qPOqjpYofVqNVQfgA.review_text: At first glance Harry's looks like a classy place, and then you walk in. I felt a little guilty being in there-- like I was one of those sleazy guys that just went in to hit on the servers. And how can a 6ft. tall, 98lb. girl have a muffin top*? I don't know but she did. The first thing I notice is that all the girls seem to have to report to a makeup artist in the back room. Then they report to the costume shop.  "OK, you get to wear the frilly little headband but I want you to wear it as a skirt. And you get to wear the 'Harry's Bar' leotard pants. I think your ass is big enough to fit all the verbiage. You, the halter top and stretch pants. Make sure some of that jelly roll is showing too. It increases sales."  Any place that has a Patron chilling machine AND a SoCo & Lime chilling machine AND a Jagermeister chilling machine has to be classy, no? Well at least they had World Famous Bloody Marys. You've heard of them right?  The food wasn't bad. I had the Harry's Hash with crispy hash browns. The hash was scrambled eggs and the crispy hash browns were... crispy. My sister had the breakfast burrito. Yawn.  * Muffin top is a term I just learned today from my sister that refers to when a girl wears pants that are too tight and her fat sort of bulges over the edge like a muffin top.

BdRMVROS1MXOHxr-bdZv0g.review_text: Solid place. kind of a fancy mancave with mediocre food. Most girls here are dragged by significant others, or strategically placed themselves there on sports nights meet guys.  We ordered fish tacos (waitress told us they were very popular), chips & salsa, and sweet potato fries with spicy bbq aioli.  (+) big portions (+) speedy service (-) taste was so-so.  We didn't finish any of the food.  drinks are good though! decent cocktail list and because it's a "fancy" mancave, they have wine and champagnes =]

P3STpnrG356LvQWPSDNoZQ.review_text: really great truffle fries.  seriously, can't get enough of them.  it's also a great place to go to after a show at the fillmore.  the only place in the area with late night food and drinks.    and you can't go wrong with super friendly staff, great drinks that come out fast, awesome djs and happy hour.  really?  happy hour... enough said.

vfEao9vE_ONLL_R1fmbYqQ.review_text: I like coming here, it's a street bar so it has the tendency to get packed, but that's not always a bad thing. I love love love the truffle fries, and they have excellent happy hour specials 7 days a week. I haven't had any of their burgers, but my friends have and they love em. I like the Calimari there as well. The staff is pretty friendly and there a ton of TV's around the entire bar, and they have the MLB package so you can watch whatever game you want (for the most part) depending on whether the Giants are playing or not. All in all a good spot for Happy Hour and def a good place to catch a ballgame!

3Av38uh8aHDvZMV_1eojQA.review_text: Alright so in town for one day before off on the road and I was craving a bit of brunch so this review is for BRUNCH ONLY. Still have not fully explored the Fillmore area even though I live there so I decide to take a walk down the street and check out Harry's Bar. Show up right at opening time and get dibs on first choices for seats. This place got really busy as an fyi as I am sure most places are on this block but definitely check it out towards the early part of opening if you want the easy check in.  The joint is not too large and therefore has limited tables. The menu is the same and not very extensive with only 7 or so items from their "Brunch food Menu." Before I jump in the food, I was pretty stoked to see a bottomless bellini deal which is $10/person for all you can drink which is a solid deal. Although dangerous if you keep drinking as you will feel the buzz quick but bravo for a great drinking deal. After looking through the menu, decide to order the Baked Chilaquiles & the French Toast to get a nice savory vs sweet combo. The food comes on out and the presentation looks fine but after a few bites I figured out why they have the bottomless menu. I am pretty sure people devour their food after drinking so much and think it's awesome because of that buzz but unfortunately, the food here is no bueno. The chilaquiles came out a bit cold and tasted a bit bland with nothing really setting it apart. The French toast tasted fine but again nothing special and actually got boring to eat. Yes I got bored with eating it. So unfortunately not much to write about this spot because there was nothing memorable.  The drink special and the service were good which is what holds this review up but such a shame that the brunch food is nothing good. Will definitely find other brunch spots to venture to in the future.

4mhfQYD1koTnujtgbtp8xg.review_text: When I first moved into Lower Pac Heights, I really wanted to make an effort to avoid this place. It was always packed, and the crowd seemed a wee bit bland. It was tough to get a drink at the bar, and they had no DJ, just mix CD's playing.   The mix CD's are still a pet peeve, but Harry's has managed to tunnel its way into my heart. Here's why.  Originally I had been here for the bar scene. Not that exciting. Once moved into the hood, I went there for dinner. Turns out, the food is great bar food. The prices are good, the servers are really really nice (and cute), and it isn't that hard to get a table, even if the bar is jammed. The Kobe burger is exceptionally tasty.  I'll be going here for as long as I live within a seven minute walk of it.

_pIG1_s6Bzymn1zeyLjBHQ.review_text: This past Tuesday, I was going to stay home and work.  The road to hell being paved with good intentions, what actually happened was quite different from what I intended for the evening.  By 10 PM,   KK and I were at Harry's, comfortably seated at the far end of the bar.  I knew Tuesdays to be half-off wines - and at the top of the menu of white wines, I spotted the magic words: "Cakebread Sauvignon Blanc: $49".  Excellent.  Not being terribly hungry, but then not being full either, we ordered the salmon toast (smoked salmon atop toast w/ a salad) and a Cobb Salad.    What proceeded to happen for the next four hours was nothing short of fantastic.  We had SO much fun.  That said, we had this amazing night together despite the less-than-friendly service from the bartenders, and the mediocre food (and I'm being generous) from the kitchen.   And I have a major pet peeve:  restaurants should not serve good wine in small itty-bitty glasses; it kills the drinking experience.  I asked if they had bigger glasses, and I was informed that they ONLY have small glasses for both their red and white wines.  DING.  But the Cakebread wine was, as expected, delicious.  At half-off, the price is actually LESS than what I can get it for at the winery.  With the wine finished, we ordered the well-known (and deservedly so) Bloody Marys.  It was as perfect as it has always been.  Throughout the whole night, the "Cucumber Gimlet" boldly written on the chalkboard above the bar had been calling my name, so as our last drink for the evening, we finished it off with the gimlet.  As usual, I had a fabulous time w/ KK.  The evening itself gets 10 stars.  The establishment, however, has some room for improvement.  A smile or a friendly word or two from the bartender never hurts, and whoever they have cooking in the kitchen needs a lesson re: how to toast bread, where to buy lox, and how to grill chicken (while keeping its juices in) for a Cobb Salad.  We strolled out of here as the last patrons of the evening, perfectly buzzed and ridiculously chipper.    VIRTUALLY UNREBUTTABLE!  :-))

CJwSYSsw36bPiN5hGyKPaA.review_text: I came here the other day on a Sunday afternoon.  Place wasn't so busy, so we were able to get a seat right away. My observations were as follows:  "World Famous" Bloody Marys: 8 bucks. I'm not sure what's so world famous about these. I'm not sure if there was any vodka in mine.  Cause I didn't even have a slight buzz after. Not spicy either, even though they supposedly use Absolut Peppar. No Horseradish in it either. Zeitgeist BM much better. And Spicier.   Food:  I have heard mixed reviews about this place. And most people seem to recommend the burgers if you do go here. So, I got the regular Harry's burger (not the Kobe beef version).  The food was pretty good. Not the best burger I've had in town, not the worse either. Mozzarella sticks were ok. Not worth 8 bucks. But this place is expensive, so I guess that is to be expected.    Atmosphere/Service:  Well, I do like these kind of bars...you know, old style, wood paneled bars...lots of TVs for sports. Although, I would think that a bar like this would have more that 3 beers on tap (no Newcastle!), It's huge, and I'm sure they can find room in their cooler for more kegs...the service was, well, I'd say ok. Talk about not smiling or anything. I guess they were pretty quick, but the waitress seemed to not want to be there (who likes to work, but gotta do it!). Also, she added money to my bill. The one she gave me was less than the one she ran my credit card with by like 2 bucks. Not that much, and it I told her to keep the difference as part of my tip...but still, what the hell is that?  Average place.

fsXzDlEVqqZA8j6AbJujjg.review_text: I used to really love this place.  I live pretty close and I like their cucumber gimlets and their food and despite some of the other reviews on here I liked the crowd and ambiance.  It was always my "go-to" place for where to bring friends when they visited from out of town.  But lately I have not been enjoying going there as much.  I feel bad writing this because like I said I used to love this place but I've had multiple unpleasant experiences there recently.  I still like the food and the cucumber gimlets but they always seem to be grossly understaffed.  Like to the point where it takes over 20 minutes to get a drink.  I know that's not necessarily the waitresses' faults but it's not really fun to sit there and wonder when/if your drink is coming.  Last time I went there for brunch there was one waitress for an almost full house.  The table next to us just got up and left after a while the service was that bad.  Last night after waiting for at least 20 minutes for our drinks (probably more) they were brought to us in glasses covered in lipstick.  I am not even kidding.  It was so gross.  I think it was the first time in my life I have ever sent anything back.  the waitress didn't really apologize but just said they would make us fresh drinks (really?  How nice of you to remake our drinks in glasses not covered with someone else's gross lipstick germs...).  Anyway I wish they would step their game back up because as of right now I don't think I'll be going there anymore.

Bf87HcPERF9yiSjb2tQBqw.review_text: It's getting raves for food but I find it frustrating to eat here.  It's too frigging loud and when I eat I want to enjoy the company of the people I'm with, which mostly involves talking, unless it's somebody I brought along just to feel up, which I swear I don't do any more. I am not fond of eating in bars, unless I'm at a stool with a burger or some fishnchips and watching the game or flirting with the bartender, which I don't do anymore either because I don't need to.

vD65y5E3Az3bFc6UW4G1eA.review_text: bottomless bellinis to cure the blurriness of the night before.. thank you harry.  came here before the b2b wave hit, and were seated with my girls as we sat and marinated.. marinated on bottomless bellinis, fries, wings, burgers, mac & cheese.. well it seemed like basically their entire menu for a solid 3, maybe 4 hours... it got a bit blurry.  this dark wood bar is chill, at home and all around fun.  came here after a night out and this was the spot to be.  loud enough to be social, but not too loud where you were screaming.  plenty of eye candy to look.  food was tasty.  burgers were well prepared, the truffle fries were yummyness all over... prices were decent.  harrys is a relaxed environment that has upscaled bar food at decent prices and they let you marinate... gotta love it, because it made that day... get so much better.

QXAkmRjGJvLg3fX65A9oNQ.review_text: Went here on a Sat afternoon and had a nice time. We just had a few beers and Kobe burgers and both hit the spot. Nothing super special, but I did think the bar was pretty cool. I can see how when it is crowded that it would be hard to walk around. Our service was pretty good, the place was about half full. It was a nice day out and there was a line to sit outside. We just grabbed a table inside and then we had a great view of the TV's. Not sure I would go there on a weekend night, but if I'm in that area at lunch time, I would go again!
